  –no sound, no movement.
  Only the sky and the sea.
  Only Heart-of-Sky, alone.The videogame.   Certainly, we needed to adapt the story to make it videogame attractive, so we decided to divide it in 7 different chapters, which offer 7 different videogame levels, where children will have the opportunity to join the two princes brothers who crossed 7 Mayan kingdoms, braving dangers and getting new friends.Children will have great fun using special powers to defeat the evil reptilian and monsters who persecuted the princes during the 7 worlds.Our videogame production will be coming to the market by parts, in the form of a Popopulvuh videogames saga:Chapter 1: "The Kingdom of Birds"!!Chapter 2: "The Animal Kingdom"!!Chapter 3: "The Kingdom of Mud"!!Chapter 4: "The Kingdom of Wood"!!Chapter 5: "The Kingdom of the Apes"!!Chapter6: "The Kingdom of the Mayan Warriors"!!Chapter 7: "The Return of the Birds"!!The production.  This is certainly our first videogame production, we are still learning on the go, however we are highly excited and motivated to achieve our goal together.Although we started with a group of only 2 people (father and son), time after, we managed to organize and compile the effort of many highly talented freelancers from many parts of the world: writers, cartoonists, modelers, programmers, musicians, translators and voice actors. With a good project management methodology and spending all our savings :)  ...  we managed to build up step by step a videogame production, which we believe, will bring a unique message and a lot of fun to worldwide children.Our production is based in the concept of family ties, it counts the story of Popolvuh, underlining the family feelings and love among brothers, parents, grandparents and friends.We used the narrative style, which offers narrative segments like a movie and gameplay elements which work together to create a fantastic world of entertainment.The fisrt chapter to be completed.   Our videogame production is right now in phase of testing for Chapter1, looking forward to come out to the market with: Chapter 1: "The Kingdom of the Birds" - The origin of the Maya begins …The internationalization.  Our production  includes more than 1,000 words in the form of videos, dialogues and voice instructions, which were made completely in Mayan language and another 16 worldwide languages:  English, Spanish from Mexico, Spanish from Spain, Portuguese, Chinese -Mandarin, Hindi, Bengali, Arabic, French, German, Italian, Russian,  Japanese, Korean, Turkish and Indonesian. How did we do that? ... "fiuhh, it was a great experience interacting on the web  with so many people from all over the world, who helped us as voice actors :)   ... We will give special thanks to all of them, actually we made a very nice 3DMax video credits for that"The music.  You know that all nice video games include a special song, so we made our own song. We didnt have money to pay an important and famous musician, so we we made it on our own. You won't believe how good this song sounds. Sorry that I am not attaching here videos and songs right now, since we are still protecting all this material for the moment that we come out to the market with the complete production.We made the song in a rock style, I wrote it on my own, I learned some Mayan expressions, so I composed the song beginning with some  lyrics in Mayan language, then English words and then the chorus in Spanish alternating with English Spanish. Everyone who has listened to the song, they really adore it. They say the song is  very lively and rhythmic, so that will help us to send a great message to the world :) The videogame platform. We used Unity3D as platform of development to integrate our videogame production. That means that potentially we could publish the resulting videogame to be played upon multiple console platforms such as PC, Mac, Xbox, Play Station , Nintendo and Wii.  However it is almost impossible to get a  license to publish upon those dominant worldwide console platforms when you are nobody :) ...  So we will have to start deploying the videogame to be played upon Web PC. Eventually, when we make good noise in the market then we could think of talking to the other big companies. Our web videogame on testing...The financial challenges we need to overcome. At this moment, we have invested so much money during 16 months continuously that we cannot keep the rythm any longer, but we need to finish testing and  cleaning many small tech details of the mentioned first chapter to be able to launch it to the market and have a great quality product to compete with another productions. We have already talked to some International publishers who are very interested on our product, mainly because it is something very different, no violence and rich of culture.  So we need a package of money in order to (1) finish the production with our local freelancers and (2) to bring the production to Japan to be played and corrected by another group of more experimented professionals (a specialized studio to publish INDIE productions) who can help us to clean it, so we can finally finish it and launch it to the international market.The estimated date to launch the production to the market: Looking forward to be in the market on November 1st, 2014   We will appreciate your financial support infinitely 
As we mentioned above, we need at least $100,000 USD in order to achieve our goal by launching a historical videogame production to the market.

We will use $30k USD in salaries for mexican freelancers (4 people, 4 months) to complete the production (testing and cleaning) 
We will use another $30k USD for traveling expenditures to go to Japan to correct the production final details (flights, accomodation, food and local transport for 4 people during 8 weeks)
We will use another $40k USD to pay initial consulting fees (additionaly of 30% for success fees that we have negotiated with them)
Your help, whatever it is, will make a great change in our lives. Thank you for believing on us.The impact of your money on us.  If we get more financial support than we are initially requesting here, then we will use that money to go right ahead and start the  next chapters of our production at the same time that we complete the first chapter:
Upto $100k USD then we'll complete Chapter 1: "The Kingdom of Birds"!!

Upto $300k USD then we'll also make Chapter 2: "The Animal Kingdom"!!
Upto $400k USD then we'll also make Chapter 3: "The Kingdom of Mud"!! 
Upto $500k USD then we'll also make Chapter 4: "The Kingdom of Wood"!!
Upto $600k USD then we'll also make Chapter 5: "The Kingdom of the Apes"!!
Upto $700k USD then we'll also make Chapter6: "The Kingdom of the Mayan Warriors"!!
Upto $800k USD then we'll also  make Chapter 7: "The Return of the Birds"!!
More than $800k USD then I will open a formal studio for videogame productions with a quality assurance department and  to focus entirely on completing the complete Popolvuh videogame saga.  If we have gone so far using only  late nights and weekends, I am sure that we could make great productions in a top quality level when focusing full time 
What do we give in exchange for your help?These are the rewards for you:$10.00 USD helpRewards:  Exclusive digital wallpaper using our original Popolvuh videogame images to adorn your PC’s desktop , signed by all the team and with a special thanks for you!$25.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus a free PREMIUM version of the game!$50.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus your name on the thank you  credits page of the game website $80.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus the Popolvuh Original Soundtrack with some introductory words thanking your full name for your help$100.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus  the OFFICIAL game poster sent directly to your door signed by our Producers (Monarres Father and Son) and with a special thanks for you!**National orders, please add an additional $10 USD to your contribution.**International orders, please add an additional $18 to your contribution.$125.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus  a signed postcard, with special thanks for your help, of Mayan Pyramids of "Chichen Itza" city, which was one of the largest Maya cities and it was likely to have been one of the mythical great cities. The city is located in the Mexican state of Yucatán (close to Cancun beach)**National orders, please add an additional $10 USD to your contribution.**International orders, please add an additional $18 to your contribution.$250.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus an exclusive Popolvuh main characters T-Shirt signed by our Producers (Monarres Father and Son)  and sent directly to your door**National orders, please add an additional $20 USD to your contribution.**International orders, please add an additional $28 to your contribution.$500.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus  a cartoon character made specially for you, using the style and scenery of Popolvuh. Just send us over any picture you want and one of our cartoonists will draw a fantastic character out of it.   We will use photoshop to give wonderful colours.  $1,000.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus  a 10 seconds video made specially for you, using our digital material from Popolvuh scenes and the Original Soundtrack. We can make any voice acting to animate your required dialogue in any of the 17 Popolvuh videogame languages.$5,000.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus  a personalized assistance to invite you to visit Mayan piramids at Cancun Mexico. We can help you to book flight tickets, hotels, taxis and the best tours at your own convenience so you spend the best vacations that you ever imagined.$10,000.00 USD helpRewards: Everything above, plus a package of five nights for 2 people at Ocean Maya Royale Hotel -  It is an all inclusive 5 stars resort for adults located in the heart of the Riviera Maya, just 6 miles from Playa del Carmen and 53 miles from Cancun Mexico.(Ocean Mayan Resort at Cancun Mexico)Our final words to kindly request your help We believe that with this production we will send a worldwide message of peace and love. In sum, regardless of the language and nationality, we want to make people feel that we are not that different when we come to the moment of letting our children to play videogames, We all enjoy and appreciate meaningful stories.  We are aware of risks and challenges We are aware that we are in high risk of not receiving the support that we are looking for, no problem, whatever it happens, we will try to accomplish our dream in one way or another one. However, you can help us a lot if you also forward this site link to another people and maybe you can also talk to your friends and relatives about our campaign.  Best wishes and thanks a lot for having read our campaign ;)

story:
My name is Paul and my game is Real Life!

My campiagn not only recognizes and remembers hero's both past and present, but also raises money for some great causes at the same time. There is also a pink ribbon on the box to bring attention to breast cancer awareness. $2.00 from each game will go directly to breast cancer awareness.

Even the deck of cards used in this game honor great people. 

Eugene Landau...Malala Yousufzai...The Fab Five...

...all people who should never be forgotten!!

If it weren't for the help from Broome Community College this game would have never got off the ground. I don't have the funds to market this game, but with your support, this game is going to help many people.

 

All funds raised here go to manufacturing costs.

story:
Short Summary

At AMG Digital Media we believe in education, and we believe in sharing the love of education with he youth. We intend to empower the youth and ignite the love of learning. Children learn when thay are at play, so we decided to take the popular trading card game genre which has become very popular with the youth in the recent years and combine it with the power of math and science to ignite the power of knowledge.

What We Need & What You Get

We are attempting to raise $3000. The funding will be used to pay for the production and duplicaion of the game. This will include graphic artist, game developer, and manufacturing.

Each contributor will receive a complete set of the trading card game autographed by the creator of AFRO-MAN & THE PROTECTORS OF THE BOOK OF KNOWLEDGE.

The Impact

This project has been spawned by the famous animated series AFRO-MAN & THE PROTECTORS OF THE BOOK OF KNOWLEDGE. The animated series is an educational cartoon which deals with character building, math, science, and the importance of history. This trading card game will be used to help children with subjects such as math and science while they have fun at the same time. This game can be used to help tuter, as well as be used in any home schooling setting.

Please share this with your friends and family.

story:
UPDATE:

Dominion is OTW, but still taking donations to buy even more board games!


Dominion is cool

Board Game Night is awesome, but Dominion is super bulky to carry around so noone wants to bring it in! Help make this happen!

We actually only need $75 to get The Big Box set that includes the base game + 2 expansions. But the minimum is $500 so Flex Funding it is! 

Any extra stretch funds go to buying up further expansions or even more board games that will live in the office. Hooray!

story:
Why a Cocos2d-x Book?

Cocos2d-x is one of the most popular open source game engine used to develop mobile games. Nearly 25% of mobile games developed in the world are powered by this engine. 

The community around Cocos2d-x is quite large. There is lots of documentation, tutorials and examples that describe how to use it. The problem is that most of this information is scattered all over the network. Considering the rapid evolution of the engine most of the material quickly becomes obsolete.

Few weeks ago, version 3.0rc0 became available in their website. However, something is missing: a full description from A to Z on how to use Cocos2d-x version 3.0.

The scope of this book is to fill that gap. To gather all the needs from the community and describe in a single place everything that people need to use this wonderful engine.

Why do we need your help?

Our core business is focus on developing games. We are currently investing an effort on trying to understand how to fill the gaps with version 3.0. All this effort is documented and sometimes expose to the community.

Instead of continuing to promote the scatter documentation about the engine, we would like to work completely on the production of this book. By receiving the funding from Indiegogo, we will be able to shift the development of our games and completely dedicate on this material.

We would like also to work independently from a publisher. Working with a publisher will increase the final price of the book, and also will delay significantly the delivery of the material. Also, we would like to be able to maintain the content of the book with respect to the future release of Cocos2d-x.

Funding goals

Our funding goal is the €3.000,00. With this amount we will be able to produce the first eight chapters of the book, which will cover the following content:

1.Introduction to Cocos2d-x (CHAPTER COMPLETED)

  • What is Cocos2d-x
  • What is new on Cocos2d-x version 3.0
  • The Book Game – Aten Saga

2.Getting Started with Cocos2d-x (CHAPTER COMPLETED)

  • Installing Cocos2d-x
  • Configuration for iOS and Mac OS X
  • Configuration for Android on Mac OS X
  • Configuration for Microsoft Windows 7
  • Configuration for Android on Microsoft Windows 7
  • Creating a New Project
  • Summary

3.Toolset and Support (CHAPTER COMPLETED)

  • Graphics Tools
  • Sprite Sheets and Physics
  • Audio
  • Layout
  • Animation
  • Utilities
  • CocoStudio
  • Summary

4.Sprites and Effects (CHAPTER COMPLETED)

  • Working with Sprites
  • Including Actions
  • Using Animations
  • Summary

5.Multiple Scenes and Multiple Layers (CHAPTER COMPLETED)

  • Game Architecture in Cocos2d-x
  • Working with Multiple Layer
  • Workings with Multiple Scenes
  • Summary
6.Simple Game Loop (CHAPTER STARTED)

  • Scheduler and Timer Callback
  • Touch Event
  • Simple Collision Detection
  • Summary

7.Physics Engines and Cocos2d-x (CHAPTER STARTED)

  • Introduction to Box2D
  • Configuring Box2d on Cocos2d-x 3.0 
  • Merging Physics with Sprites
  • Moving a Physic Body
  • Collision Detection
  • Summary
8.Game Layout

  • Building the Game Layout
  • Scrolling Across a Map
  • Adding Parallax Effect
  • Summary

9.Sound Effects and Music

  • Introduction to CocosDenshion
  • Adding Sound Effects and Music
  • Controlling Volume
  • Summary

10.Saving Game Data

  • Using Configuration Files
  • Using SQLite3
  • Summary

11.Mobile App Monetization

  • In App Purchase
  • Advertising with Google AdSense
  • Summary

Book Game - Tap a Plane (NEW CONTENT)

This book provides a game example to give a complete explanation about how Cocos2d-x works. The game is called Tap a Plane, which is side-scrolling game. All the material related with the game will be freely available on the web as soon as the book is ready.

Future of Cocos2d-x Book

Books get obsolete if no further editions are published. We would like to avoid this problem by updating regularly the content of the code examples and also by publishing further editions in the future.

What if the project do not get the funding?

We believe that this book is an important resource for the Cocos2d-x community. There is a large amount of developers asking for this book, and funding is important to make this happen.

However, there might be a change that we do not reach the funding objectives. That does not mean that we will stop this project. We will continue forward to deliver the book as planned, putting as much content as possible.

How you can help?

Your funding will help make this project a success. Pledge €1, €5, €25, or €50. Your pledge is important and you'll have our sincere thanks. In order to make this project a success, there's something else you can do and it's easy. 

Tweet the link to this project. 

Share it on Facebook.

Tell your friends.

story:
The curse of Moorden Update3:

Check out our first gameplay video.

The curse of Moorden Update2:

Check out our new T-SHIRT designs!

The curse of Moorden Update1:

Check out the new video, where we talk about the current activities of the development team.

 


About us

I always loved platforming games, action games and a good brain teaser, so i decided, why not make a game that would combine all the best features of the different genres. The game we are creating will make your brain work overtime solving the puzzles and break your fingers trying to reach that clue.

"The curse of Moorden" is a third-person game for PC/Mac. It combines action, platforming and puzzle games.


Story background

The story takes place in the kingdom of Moorden, ruled by the evil necromancer king. He rules with an iron fist and is known for his cruelty. But it wasn’t always so. Ages ago he had a different reputation. Everyone loved him. But that changed when he became ill. His illness almost cost him his life and so he started his path to learning the secret of immortality. By the time he found immortality he was a different man. There was no good left in him, only darkness. His men found the four ancient artifacts, each representing an element of life. The artifact of water, fire, wind and earth. He summoned all the wizards in his kingdom to perform the ritual of immortality.The ritual did not only make him immortal, it also gave immortality to his armys. Later he ordered his most trusted men to hide and protect the artifacts. But some of the wizards rebelled and  decided to steal one of the artifact to ensure that one day, a hero will rise to save the kingdom from the tyrant king. This is where your journey starts. Support us to experience the end of this tale.


Hall of fame explained (credits)

The hall of fame is a playable series of rooms that are dedicated to all people that have contributed to the game. During your travels you will find various treasures, which will be displayed in these rooms once you find them.

There will be three rooms, bronze, silver and gold. The names of all our contributors will be engraved and displayed in these rooms. The location of your name depends on your chosen contribution.

Example: Bronze, Silver and Gold contributors have a separate room and design of their name plates/engravings. 

 

How will the money be used

We will use the funds that we raise with your help to fund the development and finalization of the game. We have young talented people working on the project that need to be paid for their work. We still need to create some characters, animations and record the story line.


Spread the word

You can also help us by sharing this campaign to your friend via Twitter, Facebook, Google+.

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Crowdfunding beendet!

 Download of english demo!

http://yumecreations.de/kakonokoi/indexeng.html

For the english speaking audiences: this is a german Visual Novel, but if the crowd funding is a succes, there will be an english translated version of the game! So please back this project up! Here are some information in english: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=43&t=20041

Herzlich willkommen bei der Crowdfunding Kampagne von Kako no Koi! Die erste deutsche Visual Novel auf Indiegogo! Ich bin ein großer Fan des japanischen Visual Novel Genres und träume schon seit langem davon eine eigene Visual Novel zu erstellen. Das Problem dabei ist, dass ich natürlich nicht alles alleine machen kann und potentielle Mitarbeiter natürlich nicht von der Luft und der Liebe leben können, bezahle ich andere Leute dafür um z.B. Zeichnungen anzufertigen. Da ich selbst nur Schülerin bin, kann ich dieses Projekt unmöglich selbst finanzieren, deswegen benötige ich eure Hilfe!

 

Mit dieser Kampagne auf Indiegogo möchte ich versuchen genügend Geld zusammen zu bekommen, um mein Visual Novel Projekt Kako no Koi (das ist japanisch und heißt so viel wie verflossene Liebe) finanzieren zu können. Das Ziel ist 5000 €, sollte diese Summe erreicht werden, wird die Vollversion komplett kostenlos sein! Wenn die Summe nicht erreicht wird, kostet die Vollversion dann wahrscheinlich um die 15 € und schließlich bevorzugt jeder kostenloses Spiele, oder? Sollten über 6500 € zusammen kommen, wird noch eine zusätzliche Route eingebaut. Die Belohnungen für einzelne Summen stehen rechts. Geplant sind Releases für Windows, Mac, Linux und später vielleicht auch für Android. Das Genre ist Romantik, Drama und Mystery. Die verwendete Engine ist Ren'py.

 

 Das (internationale) Team besteht aus:

Yukari - Story, Programmierung, GUI

Deji - Sprites, CGs

Badriel - BGs

Shadilyn - Chibi CGs

Musik: Fabian Horstfeld

Hier folgt nun eine kurze Beschreibung der Handlung. Naoya Kiriyama, der Protagonist von Kako no Koi ist ziemlich am Ende, seit seine jüngere Schwester Nagi aus Liebeskummer sich selbst umbrachte. Die Zeit verging und Dank seiner Freunde fühlt sich Naoya besser. Eine große Stütze für ihn ist seine Kindheitsfreundin Chizuru Futami. Beide sind unzertrennlich und verstehen sich bestens. Außerdem muntert ihn Chizurus beste Freundin Tsukasa Hanamiya auf und mit der Zeit verliebt sich Naoya in sie. Doch als er ihr mutig ein Liebesgeständnis macht, weist diese ihn zunächst ab. Die Zeit vergeht und Naoya gibt nicht auf, was sich am Ende bezahlt macht. Tsukasa willigt ein, seine Freundin zu werden. Beide sind glücklich und verbringen eine schöne Zeit zusammen, doch dieses Glück bleibt nur vor kurzer Dauer... Bei einem Unfall kommt Tsukasa ums Leben, was Naoya wieder in Depressionen stürzt. Wird Naoya es schaffen seine Trauer zu überwinden? Wird er Tsukasa vielleicht wieder sehen? Das erfahrt ihr, wenn das Crowdfunding erfolgreich abgeschlossen wird!

(VERY OUTDATED! See link above for new graphic style)

Naoya Kiriyama ist der Protagonist und dessen Rolle der Spieler versetzt wird. Er ist ein Schüler im zweiten Jahr an der Oberschule und Mitglied im Okkultclub. Er ist ein netter, friedfertiger Mensch, aber kann auch ziemlich stur sein. Als Kind war er eine ziemliche Heulsuse und ist am liebsten vor Problemen weggelaufen. Dank seiner Kidnheitsfreundin Chizuru ist er selbstbewusster geworden.

Chizuru Futami ist Naoyas Kindheitsfreundin und geht in die selbe Klasse wie er. Sie ist das Sportass der Schule und möchte später einmal eine professionelle Läuferin werden. Außerdem ist sie durch ihre offene, hilfsbereite Art sehr beliebt bei den Mädchen und hat sogar schon das ein oder andere Liebesgeständnis von anderen Mädchen bekommen. Obwohl sie Naoya immer gute Ratschläge erteilt, liebt sie es ihn zu ärgern.

Tsukasa Hanamiya ist Chizurus beste Freundin und wird später Naoyas feste Freundin. Sie ist schüchtern und ruhig. Am liebsten verbringt sie Zeit in der Schulbibliothek, wo sie auch ehrenamtlich aushilft. Sie wird immer wieder von Jungs angemacht und obwohl sie kein Interesse hat, sind viele der Schülerinnen neidisch auf sie und mobben sie auch ab und zu. Durch einen Vorfall in der Mittelschule hat sie eine leichte Angst vor Männern entwickelt.

Nagi Kiriyama ist Naoyas jüngere Schwester und ging bis zu ihrem Tod noch in die Mittelschule. Sie liebt Geistergeschichten und versucht auch zu beweisen, dass Geister tatsächlich existieren. Grund dafür ist, dass sie sich in den Präsidenten des Okkultclubs ihrer Schule verliebt hat und ihm damit beeindrucken will. Doch bald zeigt dieser seine wahre Gestalt und durch verschiedene Vorfälle sieht Nagi keinen anderen Ausweg mehr, als sich selbst umzubringen.

 

 

Hiroyuki Onosaki ist Naoyas bester männlicher Freund und Klassenkamerad. Er ist ein Möchtegernfrauenheld und ziemlich pervers. In Wirklichkeit hat er wenig Erfolg mit Frauen, aber das hindert ihn nicht daran, sich trotzdem an alle süßen Mädchen ran zu machen. Durch seine peinlichen Aktionen gerät Naoya öfters in Schwierigkeiten.

 

Eine Auflösung von 1024x576

animierte Charaktere

6 verschiedene Enden

Replay-, Musik-, und CG-Galerie

Spielzeit zwischen 10 und 30 h

unterstützt Windows, Mac und Linux

viele Charakterposen und CGs

 

Zurzeit schreibe ich noch an der Handlung, weshalb es auch noch keine richtigen Screenshots gibt. Aber eine Demo soll noch 2013 erscheinen. Geplant sind 6 Routen und eine Spielzeit zwischen 10 und 30 Stunden. Der ungefähre Grafikstil wäre dann etwa so:

 

Es wäre sehr nett, wenn ihr auf anderen Seiten oder im Bekanntenkreis Werbung für dieses Crowdfunding Projekt machen würdet!

 

Wozu wird das Geld verwendet?

Wahrscheinlich werden sich viele fragen, wozu den 5000 € für das Crowdfunding gebraucht werden. Da die Preise für die Zeichnungen je nach Aufwand variieren und ich jetzt natürlich noch nicht weiß, wie viele Grafiken am Ende brauche ist das schwer einzuschätzen. Deswegen hier mal eine ganz grobe Rechnung, basierend auf die Einzelpreise. Die Musik ist da noch nicht mit eingerechnet.

 

Hintergrundgrafiken

Ein Background mit 4 verschieden Tageszeiten kostet 44 €. Geplant sind 25 verschiedene Backgrounds, das macht also 1100 € nur für die Hintergründe!

 

Sprites

Eine Charaktergrafik mit verschiedenen Ausdrücken, aber nur einer Pose kostet 45 €. Für die 5 Hauptcharaktere sind 4 verschiedene Outfits geplant, das macht dann 900 € für die Hauptcharaktere. Bisher sind 7 Nebencharaktere geplant, werden aber wahrscheinlich noch mehr. Diese Nebencharaktere haben 2 verschiedene Outfits, das macht 630 € für die Nebencharaktere.

 

Chibis

Ein ganz simples Chibi Bild (1 Person) kostet 20 € und jede kleine Variationen (z.B. ein anderer Gesichtsausdruck) kosten 10 € zusätzlich. Bei geschätzten 15 Chibi Bildern mit 2 Variationen wären das 600 €

 

CGs

Die Kosten für CGs sind am schwersten einzuschätzen, da die Zeichnerin nach Zeit berechnet. Ein CG mit simplen Background und einer Person kostet etwa 60 €, dazu kommen 35 € für jede weitere Person. Der Prolog und die Commonroute sollen 5 CGs umfassen mit 2 Personen (Wahrscheinlich werden es aber mehr werden) wäre das 475 €. Die 5 Charakterrouten sollen 10 CGs bekommen, wieder mit zwei Personen per CGs gerechnet wäre das dann 950 €

 

Ganz grob geschätzt, würden also die Kosten allein für die Grafik ca. 4655 € sein! Dazu kommt eben noch der eigene Soundtrack, welches sicherlich auch nicht billiger ist, die Gebühren von Indiegogo und Paypal, sowie die Kosten für die zukünftige Homepage. Die tatsächlichen Kosten werden garantiert über den 5000 € liegen, daher ist die Crowdfundingsumme wirklich großzügig angelegt. Hoffentlich entschieden sich jetzt mehr Leute dafür das Crowdfunding zu unterstützen!

 

Since someone ask, here are the translation of the perks:

5 € You'll get a thank you mail with a chibi drawing

15 € You'll get a special fullversion of the game with goodies like wallpaper and special CG

25 € Your name will appear in the credits


50 € You'll get the OST of Kako no Koi

100 € You'll get a guest role and chose the appearance, name and personality of your character

250 € You'll get a dakimakura cover with a character of Kako no Koi


300 € You can write your own story part in Kako no Koi
story_txt:
Crowdfunding beendet!
 Download of english demo!http://yumecreations.de/kakonokoi/indexeng.html
For the english speaking audiences: this is a german Visual Novel, but if the crowd funding is a succes, there will be an english translated version of the game! So please back this project up! Here are some information in english: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=43&t=20041

Herzlich willkommen bei der Crowdfunding Kampagne von Kako no Koi! Die erste deutsche Visual Novel auf Indiegogo! Ich bin ein großer Fan des japanischen Visual Novel Genres und träume schon seit langem davon eine eigene Visual Novel zu erstellen. Das Problem dabei ist, dass ich natürlich nicht alles alleine machen kann und potentielle Mitarbeiter natürlich nicht von der Luft und der Liebe leben können, bezahle ich andere Leute dafür um z.B. Zeichnungen anzufertigen. Da ich selbst nur Schülerin bin, kann ich dieses Projekt unmöglich selbst finanzieren, deswegen benötige ich eure Hilfe! 

Mit dieser Kampagne auf Indiegogo möchte ich versuchen genügend Geld zusammen zu bekommen, um mein Visual Novel Projekt Kako no Koi (das ist japanisch und heißt so viel wie verflossene Liebe) finanzieren zu können. story:
Hi! If you're reading this, you probably know me, Jessi. Last weekend, I participated in the regional Weiss/Schwarz card game tournament in North Carolina. I placed in the top four, which won me an invitation to the national tournament in Rochester, NY on October 27, 2013. In the event that I win at the national level, I get to be sent (for free) to Japan for the World Grand Prix tournament.

I've never really been into card games in the past, but this game has basically taken over my life. I spend at least an hour a day studying the different sets of cards and trying to recognize basic Japanese to give me a competitive edge. I'm practicing really hard and I'm aiming to win at Rochester (or, at least represent well- I'm the only one that's actually from the southeast that's going so far).

I'd really like to go, but the cost is quickly escalating to a point where it would be seriously detrimental to my finances. I need to obtain my deck in Japanese (because of a dumb licensing rule) in order to play in Rochester, which is going to cost me around $150 to $175. A ticket to Rochester (both ways) is sitting around $200 to $250. I think I can use my dad's Marriott points for a room (riiiiight, Dad?), so that's taken care of. I will also need money for renting a car or paying a cab to take me to the shop, depending on the age policy for renting a car there. And of course, for incidentals like food while I'm there.

Expense, right? So, I'm asking you, my friends. I will gladly exchange labor/chores/crafting/whatever you can think of for funding my trip! Of course, living reasonably nearby or asking something of me that doesn't require my physical presence is something to be considered. At the moment, I am living in Boone, but traveling back to the Raleigh area frequently. 

Thanks so much for helping me out! I love all of you and I know that money is tight at the moment, so even if you can support me in spirit, I appreciate it a lot!

I spend at least an hour a day studying the different sets of cards and trying to recognize basic Japanese to give me a competitive edge. I'm practicing really hard and I'm aiming to win at Rochester (or, at least represent well- I'm the only one that's actually from the southeast that's going so far).
I'd really like to go, but the cost is quickly escalating to a point where it would be seriously detrimental to my finances. A ticket to Rochester (both ways) is sitting around $200 to $250. I think I can use my dad's Marriott points for a room (riiiiight, Dad?), so that's taken care of. I will also need money for renting a car or paying a cab to take me to the shop, depending on the age policy for renting a car there. And of course, for incidentals like food while I'm there.
Expense, right? So, I'm asking you, my friends. I will gladly exchange labor/chores/crafting/whatever you can think of for funding my trip! Of course, living reasonably nearby or asking something of me that doesn't require my physical presence is something to be considered. At the moment, I am living in Boone, but traveling back to the Raleigh area frequently. 
Thanks so much for helping me out! I love all of you and I know that money is tight at the moment, so even if you can support me in spirit, I appreciate it a lot!

story:
"When I was young, . . . I wanted to be the world's best Go player." -- Bill Gates

Short Summary

The main idea of this project is to test the ability of the human mind using the oldest and most challenging board game in the world - GO (baduk, weiqi). If you are already familiar with this game, you know that it is played on 19x19 board (361 intersections). The goal of this project is to make this 4000 year old game really extreme. To reach this goal, we have to create the largest GO board in the world - 57x57 (3249 intersections) and play a mind game record match on it.

Two teams having 8 players each will play on the biggest board in the world. Players will be quite strong so that they can focus on the whole game. We are planning to invite players from different countries.

One of our goals is to gain more support so that we could invite professionals to this event, get their comments on the game and publish it worldwide.

Goals, What We Need & What You Get

Goals:

  • To test the ability of the human mind;
  • To reach a new record in the world of mind games.

Tasks:

  • To bring together the best possible teams;
  • To organize the Summer camp for the event;
  • To make a 57x57 board;
  • To publish a magazine or a book about the project and Go;
  • To invite professionals to this event.

Needs:

  • Go board 57x57;
  • Transportation for participants;
  • Event equipment;
  • Preparation expenses;
  • Documenting expenses.

Perks:

  • An e-card with thank you;
  • A postcard with moment of event;
  • An event photo/video album;
  • An event T-shirt and a cap;
  • Unique handmade jewellery with Go symbolic;
  • Amazing magazine about this event and Go game;
  • One of the three special sized boards 57x57 with autographs.

The Impact

This project is a great idea which will unite different people from various cultures and backgrounds. The success of this project will let the world to know more about the game of GO, its simplicity, complexity and possibilities.

Stretch Goals:

 

We will organize a summer camp 2013 for board game Go (baduk, weiqi) players. This event will be held in Europe, Lithuania, Apple Island (July 19th-26th). More information about event, you can find on this website: Summer Camp 2013

 

 

57x57 event will be possible if we collect our financial goal of 5000$ to cover all expenses which will include everything from the making of a special board to the ducomenting all event and of course rewards (perks) for our backers.

 

57x57 color (flower) Go will be even greater step towards making this game extremely complex and some would say "impossible". More details about this stretch goal, we will reveal, when our first goal will be reached. So help us share information about this project with your friends, so we all could experience this type of game beeing played by very strong players.

 

57x57 PRO doesn't neccessary mean that all 16 players playing the game will be professionals. Although, there's always a possibility to make that happen, we just need to work hard towards it. This type of goal will include inviting (that means financially supporting) Top dan players and professionals to come to the summer camp and participate in this game by playing and also giving commentaries.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can help us by spreading information about this project with your friends, family and community. 
  • You are welcome to participate in our camp for this event and become a witness of "eXtreme Mind game Challenge".

Fun facts about Go:

  • "On a 19x19 board, there are about 4.63x10^170 possible positions and about 10^360 possible games. (By contrast, the number of legal positions in chess is estimated to be between 10^43 and 10^50, and physicists estimate that there are not more than 10^90 protons in the entire universe.)"
  • Go is the second most played game in the world, behind Xiangqi (Chinese Chess).
  • Go is simple enough for a 4 year old to learn, but too complex for computers to beat expert players.
  • The world's largest Go game is played in Oita, Japan on a 40 x 40 meter large field. One round stone is 1,8 meters wide and its weight is about 1 kilogram.
  • Go is considered one of the premiere challenges for programmers of artificial intelligence. There is no super computer which can win against professional Go player.
  • There is a historical story that in the 17th century, the rule of Tibet was once decided over three games of Go.
  • Go has an immense impact on the mental development of children, particularly in the area of reasoning.
  • Chess is primarily a left brain game. Go actively stimulates both the right and left sides of the brain.

Sponsors and Friends for this event:

Short Summary - What is Quint?

Quint is an entirely new game - or a well-known type of game with a twist. It is extremely simple to learn and play, but it can be quite tricky to master. Quint can be played against your computer's or smartphone's AI or against real life opponents via a game server. Games in progress can be saved, and players can post their triumphs to various social media. The game is suited for players from approx. 12 years of age.

Each player has 7, 8, 9 or 10 pieces depending on the desired difficulty. 10 pieces = quite easy. 7 pieces = pretty tough. The pieces are placed in turn on a board, and the winner is the one who first achieves a certain geometric shape.

Sounds simple? It is - and isn't. A game may last from a few minutes to several hours, and difficulty is adjusted by using many or fewer pieces.

Playing Quint requires only a minimum of strategic skill, and no luck at all. Whether you win or lose, it's all your own doing :-)

Since games can't be copyrighted (only game designs can), we're unable to be entirely specific about the finer details of the gameplay, but trust us - you'll enjoy it!

The game has been in development and test for more than two years and has received rave reviews from test players.

The Windows version of the game is fully functional (and great fun!) and is now anxiously awaiting being ported to other platforms!

Why do we need your support?

Basically because we are plain, ordinary people working plain ordinary jobs (and night shifts) in order to make ends meet and still can't raise enough money to get the game into final production.

The entire pledged sum will go into production of the game. We won't take a single cent for ourselves before the game has hit the market and the investors have had their share.

If the project does not meet the entire goal, the launch will be postponed and another campaign will be launched. We'd rather hit all platforms simultaneously (this lowers overall costs) instead of launching an app for Android, followed by an app for iOS, followed by an app for Windows Mobile, followed by ... You probably get the picture.

A very, very important point. Please read this!

When the game hits the market, we expect it to make money. The investors will of course get their share, and after that,

50 % of ALL proceeds will go to humanitarian causes.

These causes may include (but are not limited to) support for homeless shelters, malaria treatment, cancer research, initiatives which provide clean water in developing countries, and other causes in need of help. The support will be administered by an unpaid board of trustees, and we will donate 50 % of all proceeds for as long as the game continues to generate proceeds. This is in fact your chance to help make the world a better place for as little as $ 5.

 Who would want to play the game?

Basically anyone who likes a challenging, easy to learn, and fun game. One test player played it with her 10-year old son - and got beaten hands down. Others play with friends, grandparents, neighbors, colleagues, aunts, the lot.

People who like board games like Backgammon (though Quint is a lot easier to learn), Tic-Tac-Toe, Wordfeud, Angry Birds, and even dedicated chess players enjoyed the test version of Quint.

The computer and mobile versions of Quint will be followed by a real-life hands-on version of the game which fits in your pocket and can (literally) be played anywhere.

What's in it for investors?

Even though we'd love to, we can't promise you fame and fortune. However, if you invest, check the list of perks to see what you'll get for your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Visit our Facebook page and hit 'like' or share the page.

When the game hits the market, we'll back it by advertising on social media such as Facebook and Twitter, and we'll launch the official Quint World Championships. This will be an annual worldwide tournament with a grand prize of $ 25,000.- and anyone can participate. And who knows ... You might be the winner!

Where to find us

Website: http://www.quintgame.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Quint/155732024582021

Twitter: https://twitter.com/TheQuintGame - @TheQuintGame

Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DolVF3rWiJ0
story_txt:
Short Summary - What is Quint?
Quint is an entirely new game - or a well-known type of game with a twist. It is extremely simple to learn and play, but it can be quite tricky to master. Quint can be played against your computer's or smartphone's AI or against real life opponents via a game server. Games in progress can be saved, and players can post their triumphs to various social media. The game is suited for players from approx. 12 years of age.

Each player has 7, 8, 9 or 10 pieces depending on the desired difficulty. 10 pieces = quite easy. 7 pieces = pretty tough. The pieces are placed in turn on a board, and the winner is the one who first achieves a certain geometric shape.
Sounds simple? It is - and isn't. A game may last from a few minutes to several hours, and difficulty is adjusted by using many or fewer pieces.
Playing Quint requires only a minimum of strategic skill, and no luck at all. Whether you win or lose, it's all your own doing :-)
Since games can't be copyrighted (only game designs can), we're unable to be entirely specific about the finer details of the gameplay, but trust us - you'll enjoy it!

The game has been in development and test for more than two years and has received rave reviews from test players.

The Windows version of the game is fully functional (and great fun!) and is now anxiously awaiting being ported to other platforms!
Why do we need your support?


Basically because we are plain, ordinary people working plain ordinary jobs (and night shifts) in order to make ends meet and still can't raise enough money to get the game into final production.
The entire pledged sum will go into production of the game. We won't take a single cent for ourselves before the game has hit the market and the investors have had their share.
If the project does not meet the entire goal, the launch will be postponed and another campaign will be launched. We'd rather hit all platforms simultaneously (this lowers overall costs) instead of launching an app for Android, followed by an app for iOS, followed by an app for Windows Mobile, followed by ... You probably get the picture.

A very, very important point. Please read this!
When the game hits the market, we expect it to make money. The investors will of course get their share, and after that,
50 % of ALL proceeds will go to humanitarian causes.
These causes may include (but are not limited to) support for homeless shelters, malaria treatment, cancer research, initiatives which provide clean water in developing countries, and other causes in need of help. The support will be administered by an unpaid board of trustees, and we will donate 50 % of all proceeds for as long as the game continues to generate proceeds. This is in fact your chance to help make the world a better place for as little as $ 5.

 Who would want to play the game?



Basically anyone who likes a challenging, easy to learn, and fun game. One test player played it with her 10-year old son - and got beaten hands down. Others play with friends, grandparents, neighbors, colleagues, aunts, the lot.
People who like board games like Backgammon (though Quint is a lot easier to learn), Tic-Tac-Toe, Wordfeud, Angry Birds, and even dedicated chess players enjoyed the test version of Quint.
The computer and mobile versions of Quint will be followed by a real-life hands-on version of the game which fits in your pocket and can (literally) be played anywhere.


What's in it for investors?
Even though we'd love to, we can't promise you fame and fortune. However, if you invest, check the list of perks to see what you'll get for your help.
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! Visit our Facebook page and hit 'like' or share the page.

When the game hits the market, we'll back it by advertising on social media such as Facebook and Twitter, and we'll launch the official Quint World Championships. This will be an annual worldwide tournament with a grand prize of $ 25,000.- and anyone can participate. And who knows ... You might be the winner!

Where to find us
Website: http://www.quintgame.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Quint/155732024582021
Twitter: https://twitter.com/TheQuintGame - @TheQuintGame
Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DolVF3rWiJ0

story:
Alien Arena is a free, open sourced deathmatch game that has been developed for 8 years by COR Entertainment, LLC.  For those 8 years, the game has continually grown and evolved with only minimal financial gain by COR, which has made it at times difficult to improve the game at the rate, or by the amount that we would like.  Despite this, we at COR have forged on, working on the game in our spare time. 

 

Our goal is to raise enough funds via donation so that we can spend considerably more time and effort on the next major release, which is due out in the Spring of 2013.  With this release we hope to have completed the full revamping of the game's assets and engine code that was begun in 2008.  Along with this, we hope to modularize the game's engine(CRX) to the point that we can more easily use it for other products, and so that others may use it as well as a starting point for their own gaming projects. 

 

COR Entertainment is highly dedicated to our projects, and our track record is quite proven.  We hope that with additional funding that we can dedicated more of our professional time to these efforts.

story:
My Story

Hello, my name is Laura-Lee Walker and I believe social games can help real-world charities achieve their goals.

I want to set-up a social enterprise that does exactly that.


My mission is to create an online social game that connects people with non-profits to raise awareness about issues that matter.

Social games are web-based games like Mafia Wars and CafeWorld that you can play on social networks such as Facebook and FourSquare.

One need only to look at usage statistics of social gaming to demonstrate their popularity: 20 million people are registered players of Mafia Wars and over 100 million people are active on FarmVille.

Now imagine... every time a person plays their beloved game, they contribute something of value to a charity. The more they play, the more the charity benefits. Simple.

With over 200,000 charities in Canada and 1 million in the US alone, the potential impact of popular social games is staggering.

Here's where is get interesting:

My vision is for a game that allows people to give in the most social way possible, feel more of a personal connection than by simply cutting a check and support any number of specific charities while having mad-fun.


So how does this charity-based gaming model work? Players use their sphere of influence to support charities that align with their values.

Starting to get excited? Me too!


With changes in the online world of social media, there are so many opportunities for innovation.

This game is the first of its kind. The social good that can be achieved through its success is monumental. I've cried from the happiness of knowing the good this game can do for so many charities on an international level.


Gamers will know that they are helping charities in a significant way. This is something each one of them can be
proud of.

Thank you for supporting me in this unique, online opportunity to help others in need.


The Impact

This campaign will provide the ingredients to make an effective business plan, which would allow for future financing. Without this campaign we can't achieve an important step in our organizations success.


Your contribution takes us one big step forward to helping charities in a way that's never been done before. This game will help thousands of charities achieve their goals.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Create a detailed synopsis of the entire Project, including functionality for the backed admin user and front-end users.
  • Determine how much time will be required to complete development of the Project.
  • Determine how many billable hours there will be in the Project.
  • Evaluate the technical feasibility of the Project, including which resources will be required.
  • Present a formal project proposal detailing the results of the Discovery.


Other Ways You Can Help

Use the share tools to get the word out and get people excited about this campaign! Social gaming is the answer to many of the worlds challenges. You and your circle of friends and family can be a part of history in the making.

story:
Our Story

Battle Planes is inspired by a variation of classic Warship/Sea battle game. The iOS version of the game has been finished and received nice reviews by Touch Arcade. You can download the game via iTune at this link

http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/battle-planes/id440975088?mt=8


But due to limited marketing resource, we are unable to push the game to as many audiences as we wished. We also do not have the resource to port the game to Android which represent the majority of smart phone market. That's why we need your help. By contributing to this project, we can bring this wonderful game to new fans around the world. 


The Impact

Battle Planes is a new type of strategy board game, some people consider it more fun than the classic sea battle game. If there aren't enough people to play and support this game, the idea will die out and become part of history. With your help, we can spread this idea throughout the world and let as many people know about it as possible.


What We Need & What You Get

To port the game to android platform, we will use the money to hire programmers and testers. It will take approximately 3 months to complete. It includes 2 months of porting and 1 month of QA. Additional funds will be used for marketing campaign.


All contributors will receive a free copy of Battle Planes as gift. Some of them will also receive a free copy of our next game "Mars Lander". Your name, with your permission will be posted on our special thanks on web site and in-game credits.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out about Battle Planes. Please re-share this story, the video above on your tweeter, facebook, etc. If you receive the game and love it, please tell your friends about it. Much appreciated.


About the team

Derek Gu is the founder of Pixiusoft Corporation. He has developed over 15 mobile games in the past 5 years. Before founding Pixiusoft, Derek worked for Capybara Games and Capcom Interactive. Liu Kai is a very talented artist, he has over 10 years of experience in art.
You can find out more about us and our company at the following web site
http://www.pixiusoft.com

story:
Hello friends, I need funding for my game development company

The purpose of this campaign is to promote the creation of ArtMor Games. Right now, we are developing games for free, we have no financing and little time to work on the project, so the idea  is to use the funds to hire personnel such as graphic designers,  cartoonists, then for the usage of  developing platforms, hostings, programming, testings and some other tools.  The lack of funds have been an obstacle to start launching my company, we truly hope to get all the help from donators to start working on this project.

I have a Master’s degree in computer science, although I have experience in developing games and apps and also programming, I don’t have any experience related to graphic arts, cartoons and drawings , so I would need the funds to work on these type of activities.

To develop these games and new games we need funding, we need your help as we need programmers, designers, sounds, music, hosting, sales and marketing for our first 3 applications.

Also need the programming new stories for our characters and villains, as well as the new games that coming soon. 

Everything we develop as a result of this campaign will be released free to everybody, on all platforms in platforms like Facebook, IOS and Android.

With your support and assistance, Artmor Games can continue its mission of making free games for different platforms, the best games of different themes, all free.

Links of our games, but still lack to finish.

Dog Dinasty

UnderWorld Final Battle

Flee Fruits

I have roughly 1 year developing my project in creating games. Games are a subject that have always fascinated me, and who does not? it comes to my mind video games from my childhood such as  Mario Bross, and many others  which have been part of my life and I'm sure  yours too.


The truth is that fantasy is an ally to escape from the reality which is sometimes extremely hard to face it.

I have seen the evolution of games, and as a computer programmer, I realize that we often have fantasies, dreams that can lead to reality through a game. However, over the years I've noticed a few things that have left me thinking ... 

Have you ever wondered, where games come from and its trend in social networks and mobiles?As a  game passionate person, I've searched which are the most sucessful games... I can mention several sucess stories that have left me atonished to some extent.


I've realized that developing a successful game not only requires talent, also needs money.


My dream is build a company which will be ready to compete against large companies focused mainly in developing games and also applications which will come in handy for the society.

I've spent my spare time developing two games for platforms like Facebook, iOS and Android, I mostly work in my games during the weekends or holidays cause I have a job in a company during the day which allows me to support my family. While everybody rests, I'm focused on my games.

It is difficult to have only one person working on the games. If I could have partners to help me with the designs, do the programming and testing I could achieve the creation of a company in Latin America ensuring a better quality and success for the games that are being developed.

I kindly request yoir collaboration to start with the game company. I have the talent and ability, I would just need your support to achieve my goal.

Our characters can improve


Here’s the breakdown of how the money will be spent:

Programers 36.000,00 Staff Salaries, 9 Programers 2 months. UnderWorld: 3 programers; DogDinasty: 3 programers; flee Fruits: 3 programers
Marketing 29.500,00 2 months addwords and facebook advertising  
Designers 20.000,00 Staff Salaries, 4 designers , 2 months  
Manufacturing rewards 14.000,00 Shipping costs  
Audio and music 12.000,00 Staff Salaries, Soundtrack for each game  
QA Testing 12.000,00 Staff Salaries, 4 QA Testing, 2 months  
Voices 8.000,00 Staff Salaries, 6 cartoon voices, 2 months  
Indiegogo Payment 10.500,00 Indiegogo Payment  
Administrative tools: server, database 8.000,00 About 2 months hosting  
total
  150.000,00  

Outgoings

invest all the money from donations will be described in our official website: http://artmorgames.blogspot.com

Bonus for our goals: Game Development:

Funded $150.000: Finish games in progress, UnderWorld, Dog Dynasty, Flee Fruits.

We know we can get more, if we pass the target we know that we can finish our 3 games that are in progress. 

Funded $250.000: Creation of 3 new games is secured and free for next year, Release our games to the android platform (Excellent).

We will finish all 3 games we have in progress, otherwise we will have funding for 3 new games and so consolidate Artmor Games. 

Funded $500.000: Creation of 6 new games for free and is secured by next year.

Release on Android platform and IOS.

Creation of 6 new games, and consolidate Artmor Games in the world of games and apps development. 

Funded $750.000 : New games is secured and free for the next two years.

Release on Android platform and IOS.

We ensure the creation of games for the next two years, free games and apps, Armort Consolidation. 

Funded $900.000: Creating Games Ensures free for the next 3 years and creating apps.

We ensure the creation of games for the next 3 years, free games and apps, Armort Consolidation. 

Platforms:


Note: This is calculated based on the time and expenses involved the development of games and apps.

Thanks for reading, and we hope you’ll consider investing in the future of ArtMort Games an our games and apps. With your help, we can continue to realize the game come true.

Sincerely,
ArtMor Games Studios

Yerme Moreno Gómez
Some pictures of our games

story:
NOTE: If you pledge Stellar Supporter or higher you need to create an I-Novae account by visiting our website at https://inovaestudios.com to play the game. Our system only syncs with IndieGoGo once every hour so it may take up to an hour before you have access. You can verify your access level and download the game by visiting https://inovaestudios.com/Battlescape/Access while logged into your I-Novae account.

NOTE #2: If your IndieGoGo account email is not the same as your I-Novae Account email you need to add your IndieGoGo email to your I-Novae Account before you will be able to see your purchase. You can do this by visiting https://inovaestudios.com/Account/AddEmail while logged into your I-Novae Account.

NOTE #3: We unfortunately had to announce the delay of our Alpha release until early 2018, the reasons for which have been explained in our weekly updates. IndieGoGo does not allow us to change the estimated dates for our perks.

  • We already have a functional gameplay prototype.
  • Engage 100's of players in epic space battles involving everything from small, nimble interceptors up to immense, powerful capital ships.
  • Seamless interplanetary warfare, orbital bombardments, and long range planetary defenses.
  • No loading screens! (except when the game first starts).
  • Breathtaking visuals made possible by the in-house development of the I-Novae Engine.
  • Newtonian physics with with optional auto-assist from your flight computer.
  • A flight model that makes each planet atmosphere a unique experience based on drag, thrust to weight ratio, atmospheric density, gravity, and turbulence.
  • Offline single player mode for exploration and experimenting with the different ship/weapon combinations.
  • Windows PC.
  • Community oriented focus with support for modding.

 

  • Video - Scott Manley takes a look at Battlescape - 20 minutes long Seamless planetary transitions, a little combat, and first impressions
  • Live Stream - Bluedrake42 - 2.5 hours long Streamed live on day one of the campaign! Full gameplay and project introduction
  • Live Stream - theXPgamers - 45 minutes long Learning how to enter atmosphere, an introduction to Battlescape
  • Live Interview with Flavien Brebion - 50 minutes long Answering questions, discussing gameplay and the scope of the project.

 

  • Video - 30km Station fly-through - 4 minutes long
  • Video - Volcanic moon seamless transition - 2.5 minutes long
  • Video - Habitable moon seamless transition - 1.25 minutes long
  • Imgur album - Highlights, and easy to share Infinity: Battlescape project pitch

 

Infinity: Battlescape is a multiplayer space sim spanning a single true to scale star system filled with dozens of planets and moons. Hundreds of players spanning up to 3 powerful corporations of the Starfold Confederacy will fight to win control of the system. The primary goal will be to capture or destroy your enemies infrastructure through a combination of the orbital bombardment capabilities of capital ships and small spacecraft including bombers, interceptors, and corvettes.

“We're working to recreate the epic space battles seen in popular movies and TV series such as Star Wars, Serenity, and Battlestar: Galactica. Combined with our ability to handle seamless planetary transitions and our focus on perfecting space combat, we're going to create a well polished experience that really distinguises itself from other space games. Our technology by itself provides an unforgettable experience and the media that have received the prototype have spent entire days just flying around and exploring”

-Keith Newton, CEO & Cofounder (80.lv Interview)

A match begins with each team being allocated some combination of space stations, planetary bases, factories, and AI controlled defense turrets. Each player will start with a moderate amount of credits with which they can upgrade or customize their ship and equipment, or acquire new ships.

 Every couple of minutes a factory spawns a cargo ship which will transfer raw materials to the nearest space station or planetary base for processing into credits. These credits are split evenly among the members of the team however if the cargo ship is destroyed its owners lose the credits. Players are able to donate credits to other members of their team so that they can pool resources.

 

Small ships with first-person, twitch based newtonian controls will provide players with high speed dogfights inspired by those seen in sci-fi film and television. We've implemented a flight model that makes each planet a unique experience based on drag, thrust to weight ratio, atmospheric density, and turbulence.

  • Interceptors - Your standard fast, sleek, highly maneuverable killing machine. They are primarily designed for destroying enemy light spacecraft.
  • Fighters - Similar to interceptors, fighters are relatively fast and maneuverable however they also provide a limited ability to attack infrastructure. This ship will only be available if we reach our $500k stretch goal.
  • Bombers - Larger and less maneuverable than fighters with limited defensive capability. A handful of bombers can cause serious damage to enemy capital ships and infrastructure.
  • Corvettes - The tanks of space combat. Corvettes come armed with independently targeting turrets allowing a 360 degree arc of fire. While they don't pack the long-range punch of a bomber, a group of them can easily take out weaker capital ships.

 

Capital ships are the backbone of a fleet and will be controlled in the 3rd person, providing a unique perspective of the unfolding battle. Individual weapons can independently target or be focused on a single enemy depending on field of view. There are three types of capital ship within Battlescape, each filling a specialized role:

  • Destroyers - The smallest and most maneuverable of the capital ships - destroyers are densely fitted with light weaponry to protect their larger brethren from swarms of fighters and bombers.
  • Cruisers - Heavy weapons platforms capable of reducing enemy infrastructure and capital ships to rubble within minutes. Despite their awesome power they are particularly vulnerable against bombers fitted with long range weaponry.
  • Carriers - Mobile spawn points capable of launching, refueling, and refitting small to medium spacecraft. A carrier has a finite number of spawnable ships however its squadrons can be replenished at a space station or base. With a limited number of light defensive weapons a carrier is particularly vulnerable once its squadrons have been destroyed.

 

A hardpoint system allows for weapon customization. Choose from an array of weapon types including kinetic projectiles, energy based lasers, and missiles. You may also configure ship sub-systems such as radar, propulsion, and shields.

 

We want to provide solo players with a great experience, but we also want to encourage team play. Each ship is being designed with specific strengths and weaknesses. For example a bomber is unlikely to perform well against an interceptor however an interceptor is almost entirely ineffective against hardened installations and larger ships. A destroyer will strike ice-cold fear into the hearts of interceptor and bomber pilots but a cruiser or a group of corvettes will quickly blow it to bits.

If we reach our $1 million stretch goal we will integrate social features directly into the game. This will include corporation management as well as built-in support for competitive matches between organized groups of players.

When we originally set out to build a space game we came to the conclusion that there wasn't any technology available that would allow us to realize our vision of a seamless transition from the surface of one planet to another without loading screens. We hate loading screens and, as life long space game enthusiasts, we resolved to build the technology to accomplish this ourselves. The fruit of that labor is the I-Novae Engine - a revolutionary new game engine capable of bringing you gameplay unlike anything you've ever experienced before.
For the first time in video game history we're able to give you a glimpse of what a broad range of alien worlds could actually look like if you were standing there in the flesh. The best part is that we recognize our gaming community has a tremendous amount of creative energy and, as long as we reach our $800k stretch goal, we want to make our technology available to you via modding tools!

Many of our reward tiers include limited edition skins and/or decals. We wanted to provide some examples so that you'll have an idea of what your rewards could look like. Please keep in mind that these are examples and do not represent the final limited-edition skins and decals.

For starters we have the default skin for a Hellion corvette as pictured below. We'll use this as a baseline for demonstrating some of the fun things we can do to allow you to customize the look and feel of your ships.

Think of decals for ships in Battlescape the same way you would for your car. If you buy a black Chevrolet Camaro and decide to paint gold wings on the hood the wings would be considered a decal. Similarly the Hellion pictured above has a baseline paint job with an SF-1 Racing decal.

You can think of a skin as a whole new paint job. It's the same as buying a white Camaro with blue lights in the undercarriage instead of a stock black Camaro. As you can see in the image above we've completely changed the look and feel of the Hellion. Here are some more examples:

 

 

 

I-Novae Studios is a small independent game studio building cutting edge technology that allows us to create amazing new gameplay experiences. Our team consists of virtual reality and game industry veterans who've worked on games including Gears of War, Gears of War 2, Unreal Tournament 3, Microsoft Flight Simulator 10, and Forza Motorsports 2.

Visit our forums: https://forums.inovaestudios.com

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/INovaeStudios

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Infinity-Battlescape/14345001234
story_txt:
NOTE: If you pledge Stellar Supporter or higher you need to create an I-Novae account by visiting our website at https://inovaestudios.com to play the game. Our system only syncs with IndieGoGo once every hour so it may take up to an hour before you have access. You can verify your access level and download the game by visiting https://inovaestudios.com/Battlescape/Access while logged into your I-Novae account.NOTE #2: If your IndieGoGo account email is not the same as your I-Novae Account email you need to add your IndieGoGo email to your I-Novae Account before you will be able to see your purchase. You can do this by visiting https://inovaestudios.com/Account/AddEmail while logged into your I-Novae Account.NOTE #3: We unfortunately had to announce the delay of our Alpha release until early 2018, the reasons for which have been explained in our weekly updates. IndieGoGo does not allow us to change the estimated dates for our perks.
We already have a functional gameplay prototype.
Engage 100's of players in epic space battles involving everything from small, nimble interceptors up to immense, powerful capital ships.
Seamless interplanetary warfare, orbital bombardments, and long range planetary defenses.
No loading screens! (except when the game first starts).
Breathtaking visuals made possible by the in-house development of the I-Novae Engine.
Newtonian physics with with optional auto-assist from your flight computer.
A flight model that makes each planet atmosphere a unique experience based on drag, thrust to weight ratio, atmospheric density, gravity, and turbulence.
Offline single player mode for exploration and experimenting with the different ship/weapon combinations.
Windows PC.
Community oriented focus with support for modding.

 



Video - Scott Manley takes a look at Battlescape - 20 minutes long Seamless planetary transitions, a little combat, and first impressions

Live Stream - Bluedrake42 - 2.5 hours long Streamed live on day one of the campaign! Full gameplay and project introduction


Live Stream - theXPgamers - 45 minutes long Learning how to enter atmosphere, an introduction to Battlescape


Live Interview with Flavien Brebion - 50 minutes long Answering questions, discussing gameplay and the scope of the project.



 







Video - 30km Station fly-through - 4 minutes long


Video - Volcanic moon seamless transition - 2.5 minutes long


Video - Habitable moon seamless transition - 1.25 minutes long


Imgur album - Highlights, and easy to share Infinity: Battlescape project pitch



 
Infinity: Battlescape is a multiplayer space sim spanning a single true to scale star system filled with dozens of planets and moons. Hundreds of players spanning up to 3 powerful corporations of the Starfold Confederacy will fight to win control of the system. The primary goal will be to capture or destroy your enemies infrastructure through a combination of the orbital bombardment capabilities of capital ships and small spacecraft including bombers, interceptors, and corvettes.


“We're working to recreate the epic space battles seen in popular movies and TV series such as Star Wars, Serenity, and Battlestar: Galactica. Combined with our ability to handle seamless planetary transitions and our focus on perfecting space combat, we're going to create a well polished experience that really distinguises itself from other space games. Our technology by itself provides an unforgettable experience and the media that have received the prototype have spent entire days just flying around and exploring”
-Keith Newton, CEO & Cofounder (80.lv Interview)
A match begins with each team being allocated some combination of space stations, planetary bases, factories, and AI controlled defense turrets. Each player will start with a moderate amount of credits with which they can upgrade or customize their ship and equipment, or acquire new ships.

 Every couple of minutes a factory spawns a cargo ship which will transfer raw materials to the nearest space station or planetary base for processing into credits. These credits are split evenly among the members of the team however if the cargo ship is destroyed its owners lose the credits. Players are able to donate credits to other members of their team so that they can pool resources.


 

Small ships with first-person, twitch based newtonian controls will provide players with high speed dogfights inspired by those seen in sci-fi film and television. We've implemented a flight model that makes each planet a unique experience based on drag, thrust to weight ratio, atmospheric density, and turbulence.


Interceptors - Your standard fast, sleek, highly maneuverable killing machine. They are primarily designed for destroying enemy light spacecraft.

Fighters - Similar to interceptors, fighters are relatively fast and maneuverable however they also provide a limited ability to attack infrastructure. This ship will only be available if we reach our $500k stretch goal.

Bombers - Larger and less maneuverable than fighters with limited defensive capability. A handful of bombers can cause serious damage to enemy capital ships and infrastructure.

Corvettes - The tanks of space combat. Corvettes come armed with independently targeting turrets allowing a 360 degree arc of fire. While they don't pack the long-range punch of a bomber, a group of them can easily take out weaker capital ships.


 

Capital ships are the backbone of a fleet and will be controlled in the 3rd person, providing a unique perspective of the unfolding battle. Individual weapons can independently target or be focused on a single enemy depending on field of view. There are three types of capital ship within Battlescape, each filling a specialized role:


Destroyers - The smallest and most maneuverable of the capital ships - destroyers are densely fitted with light weaponry to protect their larger brethren from swarms of fighters and bombers.

Cruisers - Heavy weapons platforms capable of reducing enemy infrastructure and capital ships to rubble within minutes. Despite their awesome power they are particularly vulnerable against bombers fitted with long range weaponry.

Carriers - Mobile spawn points capable of launching, refueling, and refitting small to medium spacecraft. A carrier has a finite number of spawnable ships however its squadrons can be replenished at a space station or base. With a limited number of light defensive weapons a carrier is particularly vulnerable once its squadrons have been destroyed.



 


A hardpoint system allows for weapon customization. Choose from an array of weapon types including kinetic projectiles, energy based lasers, and missiles. You may also configure ship sub-systems such as radar, propulsion, and shields.


 
We want to provide solo players with a great experience, but we also want to encourage team play. Each ship is being designed with specific strengths and weaknesses. For example a bomber is unlikely to perform well against an interceptor however an interceptor is almost entirely ineffective against hardened installations and larger ships. A destroyer will strike ice-cold fear into the hearts of interceptor and bomber pilots but a cruiser or a group of corvettes will quickly blow it to bits.

If we reach our $1 million stretch goal we will integrate social features directly into the game. This will include corporation management as well as built-in support for competitive matches between organized groups of players.


When we originally set out to build a space game we came to the conclusion that there wasn't any technology available that would allow us to realize our vision of a seamless transition from the surface of one planet to another without loading screens. We hate loading screens and, as life long space game enthusiasts, we resolved to build the technology to accomplish this ourselves. The fruit of that labor is the I-Novae Engine - a revolutionary new game engine capable of bringing you gameplay unlike anything you've ever experienced before.

For the first time in video game history we're able to give you a glimpse of what a broad range of alien worlds could actually look like if you were standing there in the flesh. The best part is that we recognize our gaming community has a tremendous amount of creative energy and, as long as we reach our $800k stretch goal, we want to make our technology available to you via modding tools!




Many of our reward tiers include limited edition skins and/or decals. We wanted to provide some examples so that you'll have an idea of what your rewards could look like. Please keep in mind that these are examples and do not represent the final limited-edition skins and decals.
For starters we have the default skin for a Hellion corvette as pictured below. We'll use this as a baseline for demonstrating some of the fun things we can do to allow you to customize the look and feel of your ships.
Think of decals for ships in Battlescape the same way you would for your car. If you buy a black Chevrolet Camaro and decide to paint gold wings on the hood the wings would be considered a decal. Similarly the Hellion pictured above has a baseline paint job with an SF-1 Racing decal.
