You may also now add '-BUSCUS' to your name! Forever!!!
Share the ENTIRE journey with us, START to FINISH!
2x a month you get updates with NEWS and CONCEPT ART from the game and animated show!
Exclusive BTS footage of me working with the game designers and animators!
PLUS we'll send you the **OFFICIAL** "I donated brains today" twitter background / fbook wall image, and desktop wallpaper!
A FREE "Thank You Song" digital download!




$25 POSTER OF ULTIMATE WALLIFICATION

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
DRM free downloads of Toby's next 3 songs!
Your name in bronze on the thank you / credits page on the game website!
The OFFICIAL game poster sent directly to your door
A digital coloring book featuring Tobuscus Adventures art!




$50 - GRYPHON MINI CRATE SPECIAL!!!

Get EVERYTHING in the $10 Perk...
The EXCLUSIVE Gryphon "I Will Pee On Everything You Love" T-shirt...
The Gryphon Wizard Mousepad and new Exclusive Signature mobile phone background wallpaper!
*NOTE* this is a special perk and is not included with any other perks.





$55 - T-SHIRT OF EXCLUSIVITY

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
"Official" campaign t-shirt
Two exclusive Tobuscus Adventures: Wizards slap bracelets
Resuable cinch bag - all care of our buddies at Loot Crate!




$85 POSTER OF SIGNIFICATION

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
Access to the BETA version of the game!
Re-stickable Tobuscus Adventures character decals (see below)
A SIGNED OFFICIAL game poster sent directly to your door (please provide address)




$100 - TOBUSCUS POSTER OF EPICOSITY

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
A brand NEW, never before sold Tobuscus poster featuring me...and Gryphon...on a mountain!




$100 - GRYPHON CRATE SPECIAL!!!

Get EVERYTHING in the "GRYPHON MINI CRATE"
The EXCLUSIVE Gryphon "I Will Pee On Everything You Love" T-shirt...
The Gryphon Wizard Mousepad
Exclusive Signature mobile bkgd wallpaper!
GRYPHON BRANDED DOG TREATS!
AN ACTUAL PAW-SIGNED GRYPHON HEADSHOT!
The Poster of Epicosity!
A brand new Wizards Duo re-stickable decal for your laptop or wall!
*NOTE* this is a special perk and is not included with any other perks.




 

$100 - GRYPH + BOBBLEHEAD SPECIAL!



ONLY AVAILABLE UNTIL 11:59PM ON MONDAY 6/24/13
Everything in the GRYPHON CRATE SPECIAL...PLUS...
A brand new EXCLUSIVE Tobuscus Bobblehead only available with this perk!!!
*NOTE* this is a special perk and is not included with any other perks.

 

$125 - CRATE OF LOOTIFICATION

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
Signed Tobuscus Headshot
A Tobuscus fan crate filled with cool Tobuscus collector items!




$250 - MAKE TOBY TALK

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
A 15 second recording of me saying anything you want (that won't get me into TOO much trouble) We'll send you an mp3 file so you can send it as a gift or use it as your voicemail recording or perhaps to prank your friends!



$500 - YOU'RE IN THE PRODUCER CHAIR

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
The coveted 'PRODUCER' credit featured in the actual game.
You'll also get a personalized thank you Vine video from Toby, and an **EXCLUSIVE** Tobuscus Adventures hoodie!



$1,000 - LAUNCH PARTY!

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
Get an invite (+1) to the exclusive VIP game launch party! You get yourself to LA and we'll get you in to celebrate in style and awesomeness!
You can also get a 15 second personalized video instead of the 6 second vine from me saying whatever you want!



$5,000 - BECOME ZOMBIFICATED

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS ...
We'll base a game character on you so other people can kill you :)




$10,000 - BE IN THE SHOW

ALL OF THE PREVIOUS REWARDS...
Executive Producer status in the game credits and website.
A BTS tour at the Tobuscus, Inc Studio where you will play games with Toby AND we'll animate you for your cameo in an in-game cut scene! Get yourself to LA for the launch party and we'll give you the VIP treatment!




FAQ
Q: Will the game be free or paid?
A: Their will be 2 versions of the game. One will be free and there will be a second premium version that will be paid. Exact price of the premium game has not yet been determined but it will be in line with other games of similar awesomeness.
Q. When do we get the perks?
A: That depends on the perk AND where in the world you are. For items that require physical shipment please give us 6 - 10 weeks beyond the end of the campaign. Please note that your perks could also come a lot sooner than that.
Q. How do I tell you my t-shirt size?
A: We are reading every single comment so please leave your t-shirt size or any other additional information you think we should know to make sure we get you your perks :)
Q. What if I left out the shipping costs by mistake?
A. You can make an additional donation in the amount required for your perk and just notify us through the comments. We will be reading them all.
Q. Why don't I see my comment anymore?
All comments that require a response will be recorded, responded to, and hopefully resolved :) We delete them because it makes it easier to track progress.
Q. Can I upgrade my donation to get a higher tier?
A. Yes. You can donate the additional amount to bring you up to the tier level you want. Then, you will receive everything in that tier as well as all of the tier prizes below. Leave information in the comments so we can notate it and confirm that the donation information is correct.
 



tenk you!

story:
What is LifeRPG?

LifeRPG is an application aimed at helping you organize your life and become more productive by using an intuitive, video game-like system, while helping in building confidence and motivation.

It grew out of my frustration at trying to find a productivity system and software that suited me best. No matter what I tried, my mind always kept going back to the almost magical way that video games seem to be structured to capture your interest and reward you for your progress. So I did some research and started developing a productivity system for myself based on game principles. As I started telling others about it, I found out that many other people were interested in a tool like this as well!

At this point, there is a fast-growing community building up around it on reddit, and the best thing is that you can already download LifeRPG and try it out for yourself!

This is a campaign to help speed up the development of the next iteration of the LifeRPG system.

What Can LifeRPG do for you?

Here is what LifeRPG can already do for you, right now:

  • Keep track of your projects and assign a difficulty, importance and skill to each one.
  • View your projects by order of difficulty, from the easiest to the hardest, so that you can build up confidence and motivation by tackling challenges in a game-like fashion.
  • Projects are colored by difficulty to make it easier to navigate the list.
  • Gain points for completing projects, and watch your level progress bar increase until you LEVEL UP!
  • Dynamic skill system lets you assign an optional skill to each project, which can be anything you want, so when you complete them your assigned skill will go up.
  • Manage your skills with the Skills Stats view and see which are beefed up and which ones are lagging. Instantly access your projects for each skill by double-clicking or hitting enter on the highlighted skill.
  • Heads-Up Display is redesigned, can be toggled on and off, and hides automatically if you move the mouse over it.
  • Customize your HUD by entering a name and title for yourself in your profile -- Ninja, Wizard, Businessman, Artist -- whatever you want!
  • Project Log window lets you see a record of projects you've completed, what skill was affected, and what your overall level was, so you can track your progress through time.
  • Momentum Bar (MMT) -- a totally unique concept, not available anywhere else as far as I know, that motivates you to keep making progress on your goals. Every day, your momentum stat will decrease by a certain amount, and will eventually drop to zero unless you complete a project from your list to make it recharge. See if you can get your MMT bar back to 100% every day!
  • Custom Level Up Sound -- Select a sound file to play when you reach a new level, perhaps one from your favorite game, or anything else you want.
  • Keep more than one database so you can track projects for different contexts; like perhaps one database for personal projects and one for your business.
  • QuickAdd Projects window lets you add projects to your database when you're in the middle of anything, so you don't have to switch back to the LifeRPG main window.
  • QuickDone Projects window, similar to the QuickAdd function, but marks the project you enter as done, immediately increasing your points and your skill.
  • Manually increase points with hotkeys so you can adjust your level properly, or to just increase your progress without having to enter any projects or anything tedious if you don't want to.
  • No level cap, infinite content already available, no DLC ever required :)

What Redditors Are Saying About LifeRPG:

The response for LifeRPG on reddit has been phenomenally positive. Just take a look:

"...I think this may honestly be the first to do/life management software that I actually stick with. Awesome work! All we need now is a mobile app (which I would totally pay for, given the already extensive list of features) and we're golden."


"There's just something about clicking project done and seeing your EXP bar go up as opposed to simply seeing a task disappear from a to do list."


"Have to say, I ABSOLUTELY love this. Fantastic, fantastic idea, really... a fantastic program that i see myself using for a long time. Keep up the good work!"

"Beautiful stuff dude! You're helping people fix their lives, thats a big deal...hope this gets more popular soon."


"Oh man, I'm really loving this. This is a great idea, and so far well executed."


"This looks awesome, I can see the IM community getting great use out of this, freelancers, entrepreneurs.. Anyone who's accountable for their own time, really."

"...I´ll be keeping an eye on /r/lifeRPG. this seems awesome."

"wow man! this is absolutely awesome! You're a genius!"

"that's brilliant."

"This looks amazing!"

"I love this idea!!"

"Just want to thank you for the awesome program. It is bringing fun into my studies. Hopefully it is that turning point i need. It is definitely an amazing concept. Keep it up."

"This is great! I've tried to do this before on paper but never got a handle on it, but this is quick and easy :D Great job!"

"This thing is seriously awesome man! Keep up the good work"

"Incredible.. can't wait to get home and run this..."

"...I love this, I've gotten so much done it's insane..."

"I'm loving this so far!"

"Thanks for making LifeRPG! It's awesome :) "

"This is awesome! Fantastic work man, keep it up."

"Great idea, been thinking about an idea like this for a while but you have the skills to do it! "

"Just found this yesterday and love it so far... Keep up the amazing work!"

"Amazing work! Already helping, but can't wait to see what it turns into as it evolves."

The Future: LifeRPG 3 and Beyond

I'm committed to developing the LifeRPG concept and taking it to its limits!

Here are some of the things I want to include in the upcoming LifeRPG 3:

Repeating project support and streak-tracking. By far one of the most requested features on r/LifeRPG. You'll be able to set projects to repeat (whether daily, weekly, etc.) and keep track of your completion streaks, in a "don't break the chain" type of way.

Exercise tracking. A special module to keep track of your workouts, where you can input workout details like times, weights, distances run, etc.

Money management system. A simple, fun system for tracking your finances.

Reward management system. You'll be able to set rewards you can earn for completing your projects. Whether that's a specific reward for a certain project, or random "drops" that only appear some of the times you complete projects, it'll be up to you.

Multiple-language support. Users have already eagerly started translating LifeRPG to their native languages, and I want to enable the app to have the interface available in multiple languages.

Multiple skills per project. You'll be able to assign more than one skill to a project, so completing a project can affect your level in however many skills you want.

More customizations and refinements. I want to consider all the feedback people have been giving about LifeRPG 2, and add some surprises of my own.

This is all just the beginning, and as more support comes in, this is what I can envision for the future of LifeRPG:

  • Linux and OS X compatible versions. Highly requested by many interested people.
  • Mobile versions. Also highly requested. Take the power of LifeRPG with you in the palm of your hand.
  • Collaborative web versions. Imagine competing with your co-workers or group members to complete projects, gain levels and unlock rewards!
  • A real-life heads up display. Can you imagine LifeRPG one day running on something like Google Glass? I sure can, and it's really exciting to think about!

(P.S. if you have coding or design skills and want to talk about working together to help make any of these things happen, contact me and let know!)

What LifeRPG Needs

I have a big interest in developing this project, as it's helped me a lot to organize my own life and become more motivated and productive. However, other users seem even more excited about it and are wondering when the next release is going to happen. The thing is, up until now I've just been able to work on it whenever I can spare. So I figured Indiegogo could help us all out and make LifeRPG 3 happen as soon as possible!

Your contribution will go to help make development of LifeRPG 3 easier and faster. I'll be able to devote more attention and time to the project, so you can get it on your desktop as soon as possible for you to have fun leveling up and managing your life.

At the very least, you can help pay for a few drinks and snacks for while I code :)

Other Ways You Can Help

LifeRPG is free and open source, so if you are inclined you can step right up and contribute to the code, or customize it for yourself or others however you want (it's written in AutoHotkey, which is a fun and simple scripting language for Windows).

Another way you can contribute is by sharing LifeRPG with others if you think it can help them!


If you've read this far, you must be really interested in LifeRPG! So go ahead, make your contribution and tell your friends about it! And come join the community at http://www.reddit.com/r/LifeRPG/

Thanks for supporting free and open source software!

story:
**early gameplay videos in the gallery**

 

Fall of Eternity is an apocalyptic primeval fantasy RPG, featuring a one-of-a-kind "backwards" leveling system.

This game will be free upon release. It is being developed in Linux. I can easily compile it for Windows, and we will add Android and OUYA support somewhere down the line.


This project's funding goal reflects the cost of hiring my friends to contribute their artistic talents to the project, as well as the labor involved in programming the game.

I will personally be donating a portion of my own compensation to a charitable cause.  :)

For an in-depth look at your stats and skills for this game, check out: http://wizardboxgames.blogspot.com/2012/06/official-fall-of-eternity-v10-statskill.html

STORY

"A man is a god in ruins"
-Ralph Waldo Emerson

It is still believed by some that eons before man settled this land, in an era preceding the first sunrise, rainfall, or gust of wind, this world was in chaos...   

In an effort to bring order to our world, the leaders of humanity united to build a temple atop the highest mountain. At the highest point of the temple, humans lit a fire that could be seen from the heavens, in the hope of summoning gods to establish order. They called this the Everlasting Fire.
 
Mankind's wishes were fulfilled when two cosmic beings descended upon our world. One was Altarch, who held dominion over the elements. The other was Dak'Ur, the master of corruption and decay.   
 

Altarch wished to oversee a world where a peaceful race could flourish. However, Dak'Ur had other plans. Upon arrival, Dak'Ur transformed half of the population into monstrous abominations. Altarch commanded the remaining humans in a bloody war which spanned thousands of years. In the end, Altarch and his followers emerged triumphant.   

Furious, Altarch cracked open the planet itself and cast Dak'Ur in its ever-burning center. To seal the dark god's fate, Altarch moved the mountain temple over the chasm and reinforced the Everlasting Fire to prevent the spread of corruption... 

As life grew on the planet, the nations of man united in reverence for their savior. For many generations, the world enjoyed peace and prosperity, never daring to question the way of Altarch.   

To spite Altarch's victory, the rage of Dak'Ur swelled from beneath the surface, slowly tainting the souls of men. As time passed, Altarch's influence over the world dwindled, and so did his godly powers.     

Today, the followers of Altarch are all but few. According to legend, the fading god still guards the sacred flame in his mountain temple, beholding the imminent collapse of the world below, silently awaiting the Fall of Eternity.

 

 

FAQ:

Q: Why the modest funding goal?

A: Our game is being developed in open-source software. Your contributions are compensation for the labor involved in developing the game.

Q: What's the gameplay like?

A: As of 6/15, we decided to transfer our assets from an isometric system to a first-person one. There will be an optional third person view in the final version. Anyone who has ever played an Elder Scrolls game will feel right at home, though the gameplay will feel more traditional, similar to classic first-person RPGs like Ultima Underworld and King's Field. 

Q: How much will this game and/or the soundtrack cost after it is finished? 

A: THIS GAME WILL BE FREE!!! Everyone can download it, play it, mod it, and share it when it's done. Same with the music. The only thing we're asking for is the startup to make this project happen. The physical DVD copies and CD soundtracks are rewards for supporting this pledge drive. You will not be able to get them anywhere else but this kstarter campaign. 

We promise we're not greedy -- we think intrusive features like DRM are only encouraging disgruntled and financially-strapped gamers to circumvent the law. Since we don't support illegal activity, and we don't want people "stealing" our game, we're making it impossible to steal. We honestly love making video games, and Fall of Eternity is our gift to RPG fans :)

Q: Is this game open-source?

A: Short answer: "Pretty much".

Long answer: Our early build runs via a batch file that interprets the game through a GNU-GPL binary. Our artist and writer don't want their work becoming public domain, though I could personally care less if you pick apart the code and have a field day with it. The license will allow you to do whatever you want with the code, such as building your own custom ports... but the art, music, and story are intrinsically the intellectual property of the individuals who created it. When I start releasing beta versions, do what you want with my code, but please be careful or you'll have to answer to some angry artists and musicians.

Q: Do any of the lower level pledges come with digital copies of the game?

A: The game will be free for anyone to download upon release, similarly to La Mulana and Cave Story. We will post the download links on our developer's blog at http://wizardboxgames.blogspot.com. At Wizard Box, we believe the best anti-piracy measure is to remove the retail aspect from gaming altogether. It's impossible to steal free things ;) Donations and fundraising events such as this are our sole means of income.

Q: If I made the $50 pledge, do I also get the lower level tier pledges?

A: Yes, the rewards stack. *HOWEVER*, the soundtrack CD will not be included in the $50 pledge package, though the music files will be on the DVD in a folder. The $100+ pledges include both the soundtrack CD and the game DVD.

Q: If I was to pledge to get a physical copy of the game, is there an added cost for international shipping?

A: Any pledge involving shipping encompasses all shipping costs. It shouldn't cost more than $5-10 USD for us to ship a DVD internationally.

A: Our game is being developed in open-source software. Your contributions are compensation for the labor involved in developing the game.
Q: What's the gameplay like?
A: As of 6/15, we decided to transfer our assets from an isometric system to a first-person one. There will be an optional third person view in the final version. Anyone who has ever played an Elder Scrolls game will feel right at home, though the gameplay will feel more traditional, similar to classic first-person RPGs like Ultima Underworld and King's Field. 
Q: How much will this game and/or the soundtrack cost after it is finished? 
A: THIS GAME WILL BE FREE!!! Everyone can download it, play it, mod it, and share it when it's done. Same with the music. The only thing we're asking for is the startup to make this project happen. The physical DVD copies and CD soundtracks are rewards for supporting this pledge drive. You will not be able to get them anywhere else but this kstarter campaign. 
We promise we're not greedy -- we think intrusive features like DRM are only encouraging disgruntled and financially-strapped gamers to circumvent the law. Since we don't support illegal activity, and we don't want people "stealing" our game, we're making it impossible to steal. We honestly love making video games, and Fall of Eternity is our gift to RPG fans :)
Q: Is this game open-source?
A: Short answer: "Pretty much".
Long answer: Our early build runs via a batch file that interprets the game through a GNU-GPL binary. Our artist and writer don't want their work becoming public domain, though I could personally care less if you pick apart the code and have a field day with it. The license will allow you to do whatever you want with the code, such as building your own custom ports... but the art, music, and story are intrinsically the intellectual property of the individuals who created it. When I start releasing beta versions, do what you want with my code, but please be careful or you'll have to answer to some angry artists and musicians.
Q: Do any of the lower level pledges come with digital copies of the game?
A: The game will be free for anyone to download upon release, similarly to La Mulana and Cave Story. We will post the download links on our developer's blog at http://wizardboxgames.blogspot.com. At Wizard Box, we believe the best anti-piracy measure is to remove the retail aspect from gaming altogether. It's impossible to steal free things ;) Donations and fundraising events such as this are our sole means of income.
Q: If I made the $50 pledge, do I also get the lower level tier pledges?
A: Yes, the rewards stack. *HOWEVER*, the soundtrack CD will not be included in the $50 pledge package, though the music files will be on the DVD in a folder. The $100+ pledges include both the soundtrack CD and the game DVD.
Q: If I was to pledge to get a physical copy of the game, is there an added cost for international shipping?
A: Any pledge involving shipping encompasses all shipping costs. It shouldn't cost more than $5-10 USD for us to ship a DVD internationally.

story:
Short Summary

We have developed a platform that is non-gambling, but allows players to play for significant prizes.  As we are non-gambling, our platform is legal in most markets around the world, including the US.  We have devised a model that through participating advertisers and sponsors, we are able to offer our community of players, life changing prizes including automobiles, boats, trips of a lifetime, cool consumer products, and of course, money.  With grand prizes up to $20 million, our players will be incentivized to come back and play multiple times.  Our model is so unique that we devised it in a way that the winner of a $20 million tournament, would simply have to win a total of 9 times and beat a total of 77 people, regardless of how many players play in the tournament.

This platform has been in development for 3 years and we are now in our beta testing phase.  We anticipate our public launch to commence in Q2 - 2017.  We have distribution partners in many markets including: Brazil, India, Europe, Israel, The Philippines, Thailand, South Korea, Japan, China, and of course, the US.

There is no other platform like ours on the planet.  We have incorporated many unique elements which makes our platform more than just a casual social gaming site.  Players will be able to rent movies, watch concerts, watch sporting events, and much more.  With our strategic partnerships, we have access to technology that is truly next level.   

In addition to the above, we have partnered with hundreds of celebrities (musicians, athletes, comedians, actors, etc) who you will be able to play against and "chat smack" with.  Further, our platform is designed to raise significant funds and awareness for multiple charities around the world.  Further, we have partnered with global brands as we are able to offer the following:

       1) X millions of players will interact with select brands for 30-60 minutes at a time

       2) 100% commercial ad views

       3) 100% banner ad/logo views (in a strategically placed location)

       4) Significantly higher than average banner ad views from other locations

       5) Immediate Response Offer with an expected minimum of 50% participation rate.

All of the above allow us to generate revenues at a rate that is quite attractive.  Using extremely conservative numbers, our first year revenues are expected to be well over $10 million.  By year 3, our projected revenues actually make us blush.  But it comes down to basic math.  We know we have the strategies and management team in place that will steer this train to achieve our goals.  So not only should your investment return you a nice annual return,  if we hit our numbers, we may very well be the target of an acquisition.

What We Need & What You Get

To date, we have been self-funded but as we are preparing for our global launch, we need second round funding.  We are looking to raise $750,000 (selling 750,000 shares at $1.00  You may purchase as many as you wish, but the minimum purchase is 50 shares.  For larger investments, please consider the perks.).  The money will be used for the following:

  • Purchase our own ad server (which will allow us to significantly increase our revenues)
  • As we are launching with slot games, we need to build out other games, including: poker, videopoker, bingo, blackjack, baccarat, mahjong, teen patti, and more.
  • Operational expenses
  • Purchase the code from our platform partner
  • Marketing

Our platform will attract many brands and advertisers from all over the world.  We can support global as well as regional and local brands.  As our platform offers significant value per advertising dollar, we will be in the enviable position of picking and choosing who we want to promote.

Most social gaming platforms earn their revenues by charging players to purchase more coins to continue to play, all the while the players keep playing but cannot win anything.  Further, these same platforms earn additional revenues from in-app/in-game purchases of digital goods.  Although we too will be offering in-game purchases, our players will never need to purchase more coins.  Imagine, by participating in one of our tournaments, our players play for free but can win up to $20 million.  To put things in perspective...the current world record for an online poker tournament was set 2 years ago by powerhouse Poker Stars.  There was a $1 buyin, making the tournament illegal in the US as well as most of the other markets in the world.   The first place prize was $10k.  They ended up having over 277k players in that tournament.  Imagine what we will be able to achieve if we were to hold a $1 million free tournament, which is open to most everyone on the planet.  

Here's the bottom line, we have designed this platform to benefit players, advertisers, celebrities, and charities.  In today's crazy global economy climate, people want to feel good about what they are doing and helping other people is the perfect way to achieve that.  Every tournament we hold will benefit up to 10 charities.  There are 2 elements to our tournaments...the online component and the live component.  When we whittle our players down to the targeted number of finalists, we provide an all expense paid trip for the finalists and a guest to a regional casino, where we will hold a live and televised event.  We will also be inviting many celebrities and brand ambassadors.

As noted earlier, there truly is no other platform like this.  Our build out plans include streaming concerts, renting movies,   It is our goal to get our player base to the point where we have 20 million monthly average users.  To give you an idea of what that might look like in terms of an acquisition, take a look at this firm:

http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/business/.pr...

 

Risks & Challenges

As in all investments, there is a real chance you might lose your money.  However, we believe we have identified the 4 riskiest aspects of this business, and we have built-in contingencies to minimize if not completely mitigate those risks.

Risk #1 - The games do not draw well

We have chosen to launch with our version of the most popular slot games on the market.  We are being very diligent in who we work with as we will continue to bring more brands to our platform.  In addition to offering popular games, we are creating our own, extremely unique games that people will not be able to play anywhere else.   The contingency here is that we have multiple games available to us so if a few aren't performing, we simply bring new games to the fold.

Risk #2 - Not enough players

Again, we feel we have almost completely eliminated this risk as there are multiple steps we can take.  First, when we launch, although we are launching in North America and we are geo-fencing the region, if we are not getting the players at the pace we expect, we will simply life the geo-fence and open the tournament up to all players around the world.  Second, we are leveraging celebrities and non profit organizations.   These sources will bring us plenty of players.  Third, we have arrangements with affiliate groups who have millions of people in their databases who are looking for a place to play and win online.  Fourth, our distribution partners include cellular service providers in the Philippines, India, Japan, Dubai, Sri Lanka, etc.  The total reach of these channels is well over 1 billion consumers.  Further, here are the global numbers of social players:

          •Total worldwide social casino players = 179,000,000 players

          •Total worldwide Poker player base = 100,000,000+ players

          •Total worldwide Mahjong player base = 700,000,000+ players

          •Total worldwide Bingo player base = 100,000,000+ players

Risk #3 - Advertisers feel they are not getting enough value from us

Again, this is something we spent a great deal of time on.  As noted earlier, we can offer sponsors and advertisers, guaranteed results.  To our knowledge, there are no other platforms that can deliver what we can.  Our advertising partners have multiple options on how they want to deliver their message/s, and if we don't deliver, we will make it right.

Risk #4 - The Management Team doesn't know what they are doing

We eliminated this before posting this campaign.  We have some of the top people from gaming as well as peripheral industries.  We are committed to creating a truly innovative, creative, exciting, and profitable business.  We are laser focused on driving revenues as we will be able to change peoples lives across the globe.   We have multiple revenue streams, with the following  generating the most significant portion:

  1. Banner Ads
  2. Commercial Ads
  3. Nightly Raffle
  4. Prizes
  5. Out-bound affiliate revenues

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have your own foundation or can recommend one that we can help, we ask that you come to our website and notify us.  Also, if you are a business owner or are friends with one, and you need exposure and sales, let us know and we can show you how we can create a new sales channel for you

Please visit us at www.yeppersgaming.com

story:
Our watchman reports "Land ahoy! Clouds are clearing up and we can indeed see land!"

Below us, a completely new and unexplored continent unfolds.
A panicked voice sounds from the message tube "Captain, our engine is failing. Our ship is going to burn!"
After several minutes of silence, the Captain finally replies "Okay, I got this. We are going to land safe, but it will be harsh. Hold onto yourselves!" Then, we crashed...
The airship sure didn't make it, but other that that, we, our gear and supplies made it pretty well. Crawling outside we could see a lush and completely wild land...
What would you do here? I know what I'd do. I would run. And I would explore!

Runners Grinders will come in the form of an mobile game mainly targeted towards Android phones. It uses GPS extensively to map your real world position into an in-game position.


The game takes place in a fantasy world on a recently discovered continent. You play as Hjalte, a young and strong spirited cartographer. You set out to explore and map the new world. To explore and travel in the game-world, you need to move in the real world! As you start moving in the real world, you will explore the game-world accordingly. The game will automagically generate a landscape with roads that resembles the routes you've moved in.



The generated landscape contains a variety of nature and places to visit - villages, cities and dungeons are all just a few examples. As you run along a path and pass by one of these locations the visit gets stacked as messages. When you have finished running you can open up the message tab and play through all your visits.



When you play through a visit of any location the game will play like any oldschool RPG. Here you can speak to characters, gather and turn in quests. By helping characters you help the villages to grow and in time they will turn into cities. Of course, turning in quests will give you lots of rewards in the form of trophies and achievements!


So, do I really have to run to play this game?

Not necessarily. Of course, the game is all about motivating exercise, but if you just go out walking that's really enough! The requirement is that you physically move between the locations in the game.

We are still undecided about this, but we might add running specific missions. This could be anything from being chased by a monster to running fast enough to catch a thief. Of course, you should not miss any of the story by walking, but it's good to make it even more fun to run! What do you think?

We will also make sure to add a "travel-mode", which means that you can untie yourself from your actual GPS coordinate. You'll need to generate a map in the standard mode first, but once you have that you can play on the same map from anywhere in the world. You could even play from a treadmill!

Nope, you will not be able to travel by car. The game will only let you play if you move under maximum running speed. We might make it possible to go by bike as you find a special item in the game. The possibilities are endless! This brings us to the next point.

What are your thought?

We are very open for your thoughts and ideas about the game. It's part of the reason why we're doing this campaign!

Is there a gameplay feature you would really love to see? Is there any problem you think we need to solve? Let us know and leave a message at the comment section!

We need you! :)

If we're gonna be able to work on this full time, we need your help to support our time. We have some savings but it's just not enough. Reaching our funding goal of $6000 will make sure one of us can work full time as well as covering all our other expenses, such as maintaining a website and licensing theme music.

If we reach our goal we can promise to release a beta version this coming spring. That way you can start running during the whole season. The beta will be very playable but will lack all the planned content and final polish.

Even though it's not critical, we aim to exceed the funding goal. If we gather the double amount, things will really start to happen. We can then hire someone to make continuous ports to iPhone. We can free up more of our time and even hire in an additional artist which will raise the quality of the release and its amount of content substantially. We could license a lot more music, a full album of scores fitting the theme of the game.

If we don't receive enough funding we will have a hard period ahead. We won't be able to keep up the pace and the release will probably be delayed a year. We intend to complete the game anyway and will try to manage, so don't be afraid that you would fund a project that just dies away!

Your rewards

Of course, a fine deed will not be left unrewarded! There are different reward levels ranging from the very tiny amount of $1 up to $1000. All the perks will reward you with unique achievement badges, such as an golden idol. These will be visible in all online affiliations of the game such as the support forums.

We hope the different perks are explained well enough in the field to the right, but if something is unclear, don't hesitate to ask!

Choose them wisely and remember that this campaign is the only chance to fetch these perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, if you like this game but cannot fund us you can help by spreading the word. This is highly valuable and will help make the game known not only for the campaign itself but for when it actually will release!

However, if you plan on buying the game we still recommend you fund at least the 6 dollars to get the game, because it may cost more at release.

Surely you have friends that might really need this game. You should let them know about this game, for their own good! We're happy to say the benefits are mutual - Not only will you help us that way, but you'll also help your friends getting healthier.

The story behind Runners Grinders

The story of this game begins in this summer, at a computers club. A revolt was on the way, some of the nerds inhabiting the place was actually beginning to exercise and it was spreading like a virus! In the mind of one of them a devilish plan was taking form - A game that would cause any nerd to start exercise!

Actually, this idea maybe wasn't so bad after all. Exercise is a good thing, right? I mean, even though it might be boring and hard to find motivation for, it's not a bad thing. Why not make it fun then? Games with quests, items, levels and achievements can offer an severe amount of motivations, so why not use that potential? This was the thoughts that brought this game to life.

The project started out with just one of us working on it - Fredrik Andersson, which is the one writing this. When I first got the idea I hadn't heard of any game like this before. I found the idea so good that I felt I had to start a company. It was my responsibility to make this game! I was currently occupied by studying for an engineering degree, so I started working on this game in my spare time. The game required more and more of my time and focus. I realized it wouldn't work out to do both and decided to work on this full time!

Since I decided on working full time, the plan looked much more solid which let me recruit two good friends that's actually studying game development.

Keep updated!

Also, if you wonder about anything, don't hesitate to ask. We'll put up a FAQ once we get some questions rolling in.


We hope you've enjoyed our campaign so far! Have a great day, and take care of your health and spirit!

However, if you plan on buying the game we still recommend you fund at least the 6 dollars to get the game, because it may cost more at release.
Surely you have friends that might really need this game. You should let them know about this game, for their own good! We're happy to say the benefits are mutual - Not only will you help us that way, but you'll also help your friends getting healthier.

The story behind Runners Grinders
The story of this game begins in this summer, at a computers club. A revolt was on the way, some of the nerds inhabiting the place was actually beginning to exercise and it was spreading like a virus! In the mind of one of them a devilish plan was taking form - A game that would cause any nerd to start exercise!
Actually, this idea maybe wasn't so bad after all. Exercise is a good thing, right? I mean, even though it might be boring and hard to find motivation for, it's not a bad thing. Why not make it fun then? Games with quests, items, levels and achievements can offer an severe amount of motivations, so why not use that potential? This was the thoughts that brought this game to life.
The project started out with just one of us working on it - Fredrik Andersson, which is the one writing this. When I first got the idea I hadn't heard of any game like this before. I found the idea so good that I felt I had to start a company. It was my responsibility to make this game! I was currently occupied by studying for an engineering degree, so I started working on this game in my spare time. The game required more and more of my time and focus. I realized it wouldn't work out to do both and decided to work on this full time!
Since I decided on working full time, the plan looked much more solid which let me recruit two good friends that's actually studying game development.


Keep updated!
Also, if you wonder about anything, don't hesitate to ask. We'll put up a FAQ once we get some questions rolling in.


We hope you've enjoyed our campaign so far! Have a great day, and take care of your health and spirit!

story:
Do not donate to the project.

This campaign is canceled

 

 

 

Features:

Super-stable physics simulation, written from the ground up in C++ 

  • 5000+ connected springs, stable simulation 
  • Interative, scaleable method - can make the simulation more accurate by throwing more processor power at it 

Imports and builds ships from PNG images 

  • Draw a ship in paint: 
  • Different colours represent different materials

Customize stuff! 

  • Can turn the waves into a storm, or make ships fall apart at a touch 

Fluid Simulation 

  • Simulator models water pressure and the effects of gravity inside the ships 
  • Water is forced in through breaches in the hull and pools at the bottom, dragging the ship down 

Interact! 

  • If your ship's taking too long to sink, smash it to bits with your mouse
  • First you start by drawing an object with the color code in a 80x80 png image. ( I can be bigger )

story:
Short Summary

WarArm is an online free to play FPS made by a group of young students under the age of 25.

We are working everyday at this game with passion and love.

The game will be FREE for all without any charge. Anyone can reach the same level without of spending real money.

The game will have a lot of game modes for example TDM, DM, CTF and more (with also special and unique modes).

What We Need & What You Get

We need aroud 5000 $ to pay the license for the softwares that we are using.

We also need the money to by plugins for the game, for example a real-time weather changer plugin that changes the weather in-game during a match.

If you will be a donator you will get a beta access to the game and you will have also special  camos for weapons and items that you can use in-game.

 

 

 

 

 

We need your help to make a fantastic game!

Other Ways You Can Help

You haven't got the money to make a donation? No problem, you can share this campaign to your friends and show them the project, we need your help!

 

Feel free to watch videos of the game on our youtube channel: www.youtube.com/AstragonGame and our facebook page: www.facebook.com/wararm

 

Official site: www.wararm.eu

story:
I need your help!

The top 50 kids app 'iMommy' is stuck...we need funding to reach the next level of growth.
Kids want more rooms, more interaction, more fun!!
But I can't give it to them without YOUR help!
I want to add new rooms..new levels of interaction, tons of ideas but no way of affording these changes since Apple changed it's rules on ads in apps my income has dropped over 2/3rds!  
PLEASE HELP me get iMommy back on top and give it new life!
Help me be able to tell the little kids who write to me that soon they will see all the fun stuff they have been asking for!
This is a top rated and ranked app..it just needs funding to grow.
If you can't donate money then please, please take a few seconds to share it via facebook or twitter to your followers!
It only takes a few seconds and would mean the world to me and the little fans of iMommy!
Thanks!!

Some Reviews:

story:
This game is designed to be a stealth-like first person shooter. It is a multiplayer-only game that is set in a dynamically changing, stealth-like environment focused on alliances and co-operation. The design puts you in near pitch black with only a flashlight and a gun. Shadows and light will give anyone away, whether it's the light flashing on them, or their own flashlight. The design is supposed to have people make sacrifices using their own flashlight, but also, if they can get away with it, use it to take down enemies. However, the plan is to be able to use it in such a way where someone needs to sacrifice himself/herself for the team to succeed.

As planned, the game's design is going smoothly in terms of team work and lights. The work is focused around stealth and tactical gameplay. Based on you and your team's tactics, the game experience will change.

Another focus in the game is sound. Footsteps and gunshots being heard will be a way to detect enemies. For example, if a unity is looking for you, chances are, you will hide behind an object and turn off your flashlight. When they look for you, they will probably be searching for a light source that doesn't exist; and, since you aren't moving, they have no way of hearing you. You hear the enemy or see them come into your sight, you pop out of your hiding spot, and shoot them. They wouldn't expect this because they had no way of finding you without a flashlight or sound.

The Networking multiplayer tests are already done and completely functional. The next step is the actual game. When we have money, the polish will come into play. The game will be a basic design and things will be added in updates after the game's release.

The minimum amount of money we need for the game is $3,000, but that is only for licenses: the bare minimum. For actual professional design and work, we will need the full amount of fundraising money.

Regardless of what we make, we hope to provide a fun, innovative and new experience to all of the multiplayer shooter audience. Thank you for reading, and, with your help, we will make a great game.

We apologize for not having estimated release dates.

Please, donate, and share with your friends, to start a firefight in the dark.'

GOALS - 

'*'Polished game - $5,000

-Licenses - $1,050

-Assets - $500

-Future Projects - $1,450

story:
What is Voxel Boy?

Voxel Boy is a 3D platformer inspired by the classic 3d platformers on the N64. Physics and collecting items are the heart of Voxel Boy. Players take control of Voxel Boy to explore different worlds in search of gold coins. Voxel Boy can pick-up and throw items, grab and push or pull some large objects and jump like a boss.

Where is the Money Going?

Most of the game mechanics are complete, what is needed are levels designed and constructed as well as some new models, textures and enemies.

What OS Will Voxel Boy Run On?

We are developing Voxel Boy for iOS, Android and PC.

Can I Test the Game?

Sure! There is a web version of Voxel Boy available which contains a sample level.

Play the demo here.

story:
Here's the Deal

We have been hard at work designing an awesome astronomy-themed board game for months, and we're at the point where we are reaching out to artists and graphic designers to make the game presentable for playtesters and printed prototypes.

We want this art to be awesome, which means we would love to have production-quality art right away. This campaign, initially set at $1200, is the budget we have for concept art. We need to fund this step in order to move forward in the process, including submitting the game to Boston Festival of Indie Games!

A Game of Astronomical Consequences

Stars, Inc. is a 2-4 player game where each player controls an alien race that has developed the technology to collapse giant gas clouds out in space to form stars. This has proven easier than making cold fusion efficient, and so this is the best way to harvest elements and resources needed to create planets. The game is won when a player reaches 10 points, and points are scored for having gas giant planets, white dwarfs, and space diamonds! 

The game board is based on a graph in astrophysics called the Hertzsprung-Russell Diagram, and players have to plan their strategy of what types of stars to form: red dwarfs, sun-like stars, or blue giants: blue giants are more expensive, but they end their lives as supernovae and provide oxygen and iron; sun-like stars evolve into white dwarfs; and red dwarfs are cheap to make and live nice, long lives as excellent planet hosts (check out this article on planet occurrence rates).

Stars, Inc. is based on the real evolution of different types of stars, because the creator (me) is a Ph.D candidate in astrophysics at Harvard and has a bit of an obsession with stellar physics. Don't worry, though -- you don't need any background knowledge of science to play, and maybe by the end you'll have picked up some Astronomy 101 about stellar evolution and different types of fusion! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need money to pay for quality art from full-time graphic designers. 

If you help fund this campaign, we are offering digital rewards, since all of the money is going towards the art and not the printing or shipping of games. You'll also get the satisfaction of helping out an independent company create a really cool game!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute in the same way. There are lots of ways you can make a difference in this campaign:

  • Tell your friends!
  • Like us on Facebook: facebook.com/cgsunit
  • Follow us on Twitter: twitter.com/cgsunit
  • Link to our website: http://cgsunit.com/
Thank you for your help, we appreciate every bit of it!

story:
Taken

Taken is an H.P. Lovecraft-themed rogue-like. It has a unique flavor as a horror game, featuring HD resolution black and white sprites, and a classically composed piano soundtrack. Taken does not have any items or equipment as a resource. Fight your way through five randomly generated environments, and three of Lovecraft's stories, and an original story inspired by the writings of H.P. Lovecraft.

About the Studio

Old-Ones Studios is an independent game development studio based in Seattle, Washington. We are a collection of college students and friends. Every day, during our free time, we passionately apply our own unique talents shaping Taken into a true passion project. We have the commitment, the drive, the passion, and the talent. We just don't have any money. That's why you're here, reading this page.

What're You Doing With My Money?

Funds will be put towards the following goals in the order listed. 

  • $100 – Steam Greenlight fee
  • $25 – Spriter (Animation tool)
  • $10 – Domain Registration
  • $100 – Office365 4 Year License Fee (Student deal)
  • $800 – Legal fees
  • $35 – Mothly recurring Office365 fees (any money past our initial list will be put towards this)

 

UPDATE: 

Hey everyone! Thanks to your generosity, we've paid our fee for steam greenlight (Early Access starts 8/29/13), purchased Spriter. We'll be grabbing our domain shortly.

We recently got our company logo submitted just two days after bringing on our new artist, and heres some high res wallpaper versions, in black, and white. However, I don't want to sell our composer Nick short either. He's been hard art work and supplied me with two rough drafts to share with you. He's uploaded rough drafts of both Cthulu's Theme, and the main characters theme. Listen here!

Keep your eyes on this page for more info (steam concepts page coming soon)! But in the mean time, if you want to keep up on our day to day goings on, you can follow us at the following locations:

Facebook: www.facebook.com/oldonesstudios
Twitter: @oldonesstudios
Email: inquiries@oldonesstudios.com

story:
UPDATE: 04/04/2016

Hello everyone! I just want to provide and update for the game. Please stay tuned to the website as there are updates being posted every Monday! Thank you all again for your contributions! The great news is that it has helped us reach where we are today. The game will release this year (2016) between mid - late in the year. We are targeting June/July
Please again, stay tuned to the website for all updates and news!
http://techexecutivetycoon.com

About me

My name is Walter, and I am a very passionate game developer. I am a long time gamer and roughly 7-8 years ago, I started teaching myself to program. A few years ago after many prototype projects, I decided to create a few android apps. Since then I set my goals much higher. I've always wanted to create video games and now I have finally reached a point where I can do just that. I am a huge strategy, simulation and role playing genre gamer. I am passionate about it because it causes you to think, be creative and imaginative. I have always been a fan of these types of games. Some of my inspiration goes back to the first SimCity, Command & Conquer, Civilization, Baldurs Gate, Elders Scrolls, Mass Effect series, Capitalism, many of the Tycoon games on the market as well as many more. 

This game I am creating was birthed from all of my experiences both as a gamer and as a person. I'm hoping to capture the fun of all three of the aforementioned genres and bring a game with some fresh ideas. I know this game can be great and I intend to see it completely to the finish line. 

With your help, I can set the bar higher. I can make the game available on Mac, as the title will be release primarily for PC and Linux. Furthermore, I want to release a mobile version of the game for Mac devices as well as Android devices. By contributing, you will also help me achieve the highest quality graphics, and design available. Most importantly there are many other cost associated with creating a video game. 

About the game

ABOUT THIS PROJECT

Hello everyone! 

This project is a work of passion for gaming! I am an avid gamer who loves this awesome avenue of expression, creativity, design and skill. This will be my first game developed and I hope to make it special. With your help, I can see this through to completion. 

I have been programming for more than 5 years, and have a passion for it! I have created a few projects on a smaller scale prior to this undertaking. Please visit my website @WEB Gaming Entertainment (currently updating) to stay up to date on the progress of this project. I will complete this game, and I almost have everything I need to achieve this goal. There are a few things that will be essential to the completion of this game, such as legal fees, software and licensing. Once this is complete, I have everything I will need to see this game through! 

Thanks for taking the time to hear me. I hope you decide to assist, because you will be a part of a great project that will entertain many! 

THE GAME HAS BEEN GREENLIT ON STEAM AND WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE UPON RELEASE. I am currently evaluating if I will offer the game for early release as well. Stay tuned! http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/updates/208057046/?editsuccess=1

Thank you for your time!!!

Sincerely,

Walter

ABOUT THE GAME:

TECH EXECUTIVE TYCOON is a business management Simulation/Strategy game that puts you in the role of the CEO of a tech company. Can you build this company into a Tech Giant? Develop Hardware that will wow your customers and make their lives easier. Build custom devices, peripherals and products that will make your competitors envy you and simultaneously worship you?

This game will be a deep strategy/simulation game. You will hire employees, delegate responsibility, manage the budget, monitor business relationships, upgrade office equipment, rent new offices, set prices, outsource and more...  

If you enjoy management games, you will definitely enjoy this game! Stay tuned for more information! ***ALL images and video is unfinished quality and placeholder art assets, final quality will be on display soon***

Planned for PC, Linux, Mac and possibly more... stay tuned

The release of the game is planned for December 2014.


What We Need & What You Get

  • The total funding goal is $7,000. 
  • $3,000 licensing fees for the Unity Engine (Mac Pro version, PC Pro version)
  • $1,000 PC hardware parts for optimal development and designing capabilities
  • Marketing and advertising costs
  • Legal fees
  • Professional design and creative suite programs
  • You will get (depending on donation amount) the full game upon release, T-Shirt, different version of the game (Deluxe, Founders Edition). You can also get a DVD featuring me sharing the development process, behind the scenes and thank you's. You will also have the opportunity to help in different aspects of the development process (e.g. naming organizations and items within the game).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not have anything to donate, please share this project with friends and family who might also be interested in this game.

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Google+
  • IndieGogo's sharing tools
  • Word of mouth goes a long way

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for believing in the project!

With your help, I can see this through to completion. I have been programming for more than 5 years, and have a passion for it! I have created a few projects on a smaller scale prior to this undertaking. Please visit my website @WEB Gaming Entertainment (currently updating) to stay up to date on the progress of this project. I will complete this game, and I almost have everything I need to achieve this goal. There are a few things that will be essential to the completion of this game, such as legal fees, software and licensing. Once this is complete, I have everything I will need to see this game through! Thanks for taking the time to hear me. I hope you decide to assist, because you will be a part of a great project that will entertain many! THE GAME HAS BEEN GREENLIT ON STEAM AND WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE UPON RELEASE. I am currently evaluating if I will offer the game for early release as well. Stay tuned! http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/updates/208057046/?editsuccess=1Thank you for your time!!!Sincerely,WalterABOUT THE GAME:TECH EXECUTIVE TYCOON is a business management Simulation/Strategy game that puts you in the role of the CEO of a tech company. Can you build this company into a Tech Giant? Develop Hardware that will wow your customers and make their lives easier. Build custom devices, peripherals and products that will make your competitors envy you and simultaneously worship you?This game will be a deep strategy/simulation game. You will hire employees, delegate responsibility, manage the budget, monitor business relationships, upgrade office equipment, rent new offices, set prices, outsource and more...  If you enjoy management games, you will definitely enjoy this game! Stay tuned for more information! ***ALL images and video is unfinished quality and placeholder art assets, final quality will be on display soon***Planned for PC, Linux, Mac and possibly more... stay tunedThe release of the game is planned for December 2014.What We Need & What You Get
The total funding goal is $7,000. 
$3,000 licensing fees for the Unity Engine (Mac Pro version, PC Pro version)
$1,000 PC hardware parts for optimal development and designing capabilities
Marketing and advertising costs
Legal fees
Professional design and creative suite programs
You will get (depending on donation amount) the full game upon release, T-Shirt, different version of the game (Deluxe, Founders Edition). You can also get a DVD featuring me sharing the development process, behind the scenes and thank you's. You will also have the opportunity to help in different aspects of the development process (e.g. naming organizations and items within the game).
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you do not have anything to donate, please share this project with friends and family who might also be interested in this game.
Facebook
Twitter
Google+
IndieGogo's sharing tools
Word of mouth goes a long way
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for believing in the project!

story:
Who is Hicham?

I am a game programmer, i participated in the creation of many game at Ubisoft and Kunst-Stoff GmbH .

I Love Video Games and mostly the retro ones , and that's why i'm making one... it's been a while since i'm working on CheeseMan alone and i can see the light at the end of the tunnel now :) , i just need a little push .

The Game

CheeseMan is a 2D Platformer where you play with that little cheesy character "CheeseMan" in a quest to save the cheese land from the Mice in suits ;)

it's a work in progress in a pretty good shape ,that will need 2 more months to get finished and brought to the streets.

Release Dates

-iOS (september 2011)
-Mac (october 2011)
-Android(november2011)

Features

- Very easy to learn controls , 2 buttons for the directions , and one button for jump related actions

- skill and reflex challenges which will revive the snes boy or girl in you .

- 45 levels divided in 3 worlds 

- very cool retro sound track (the music in the trailer is not included)

- updates monthly


see the video it's the best description :)


You have An idea ?

you are welcome if you have an idea that you think it will make the game better , just contact me on http://cheeseman.hallaoui.com , i always reply :) .

What's the money for ?

the money will be used to :

-pay the licenses for the tools i'm working with (some are already paid) .

-buy hardware for testing.

-buy hardware for music composing .

-advertising for a short time to give it a kick.

-print the tshirts for the perks :D


T-shirts

CheeseMan Tshirts can be found here : http://cheeseman.hallaoui.com/?page_id=134

You can also help by sharing 

Please  support indie games and help me spread the word , and it would be really great if you like the Facebook page : http://www.facebook.com/CheeseManGame

story:
Yay, the game is now finished and available!

Visit dominiquepamplemousse.com to check it out!

Hi! My name is Deirdra, and I’m a writer, programmer, musician, and visual artist who primarily works in videogames and interactive media. My latest work in progress is a stop motion musical detective adventure called Dominique Pamplemousse in “It’s All Over Once the Fat Lady Sings!”

Pimple-what?

Dominique Pamplemousse, the titular protagonist, is a down-on-their-luck private investigator of ambiguous gender only one rent payment away from homelessness. When the CEO of a major record company shows up asking Dominique to locate a missing pop star, taking the job appears to be the straightforward thing to do. However, as things are never quite as they seem in these kinds of stories, Dominique winds up framed for a crime they didn’t commit, bringing to surface their mysterious past and the events that led them to take up shady detective work in the first place.

Musical? Did I just read that correctly?

With singing, and everything! It’ll be like watching a stage musical, only you get to control which verses the characters sing next. Pretty neat, huh?

I’ve written and recorded quite a bit of music for my previous interactive works, in addition to playing with a super awesome Balkan brass band for the past three years, so I’m definitely no stranger to this whole “being musical” thing. My aim is to go one step further and actually integrate music and singing into an interactive narrative format. Inspired by my experiences with jazz improvisation, the soundtrack to this project is composed in separate sections that can be played in a different order depending on the player’s actions.

And it’s also in stop motion?

I’ve always loved stop motion animation, and have wanted to use it in a videogame for quite some time. Pretty much all the art assets in this game are made from real, physical things: clay, aluminium wire, cardboard, paper, fabric, felt, duct tape, and whatever else I’ve been able to get my hands on. It makes for a much more organic art style than what I’ve previously been able to create using just a computer, and it just plain looks and feels like a lot of fun. (Check out the video at the top of the page to see it in action! You did notice there’s a video, right? Or alternatively, play the demo!)

So, what kind of experience do you have with game development, anyway?

I have a number of finished solo projects to my name, dating back to 2002. Most recently, I released the previously-crowdfunded Life Flashes By and the award-winning, text-based The Play. I’ve also worked professionally in game design and programming on several larger titles.

More importantly, however, I’m known for touching on personal issues in my work, such as feminism, race, gender, coming of age, and social awkwardness -- subjects you’d be hard-pressed to find in most big budget videogame productions. I also prefer focussing on narrative, exploration, and problem-solving as game mechanics, as opposed to combat. Videogames aren’t just frivolous wastes of time to me; they’re how I express myself.

And how are you building this thing?

I’m using Adobe AIR; having been a Flash developer for years, Actionscript 3 is a language in which I’ve become quite comfortable. Plus, it has the advantage of being cross-platform. My current plan is to make the game available for Windows and Mac desktops, as well as on the iPad, but I am open to other devices (e.g. Android tablets) if I somehow wind up having the means to test them. If there’s any particular platform on which you really, really want to play this game, please let me know and I’ll do my best to make it happen!

Okay... but where is the money going?

So far, I’ve been working on Pamplemousse on my own dime, in whatever spare moments I’ve been able to fit in my schedule. However, I currently have enough time between paid work that I’d really like to make this game a higher priority. If this project gets fully funded, I’ll be able to treat the remainder of its development like a Real Job™ and get it finished within the year.

Taking into account that Indiegogo and PayPal will take their respective cuts, and that I’ll also need to create and ship your contribution perks, the amount I’ve asked for is the minimum I would need to fund the game to completion. That is, to finish the writing, recording, set construction, animation, and programming on this project by myself, based on estimates from my work so far on this as well as previous projects. With that in mind, if I just so happen to get overfunded, Tim Schafer-style, I’ll be able to put in more spit and polish, and perhaps even bring on other people to help me. (It would be super fantastic to get a professional sound engineer to help with mixing and mastering, for instance.)

All right, but what’s in it for me?

Why, the chance to contribute to the development of a really, really unique and offbeat videogame, of course! Plus, one of several spiffy rewards, from having one’s name in the credits to owning a piece of original handmade artwork used in the game itself to a custom short film featuring the game’s characters.

But wait, there’s more! If you happen to be the contributor with the highest pledge amount, you’ll get an additional bonus reward: your name (or a pseudonym of your choice) featured in the game as an important plot point! (In the event of a tie, whoever contributed first will be selected.)

I’m sold! Now what do I do?

First, select your pledge and claim what perk you want. Then, tell all your like-minded friends about this project and share it on all your favourite social networks. Remember, this is a “fixed funding” campaign, so if I don’t hit my goal by the deadline, no one gets anything. Which, you know, would be a total bummer. So, please help me spread the word in any way you can! Even if you’re as flat broke as Dominique and can’t contribute financially, any kind of support you can give is super appreciated.

I’m really looking forward to bringing this game to life and getting it into your hands! Let’s make it happen, shall we?
