A mage may instantly turn into a death dealing machine, wielding two handed axe while shooting rays of doom from his eyes. Anything that works!Geared up? Well, ready or not, it is time for a battle. In order to win the game, each party must emerge victorious from 3 increasingly difficult encounters.For each battle, an enemy card will be drawn from 9 possible encounters.This card instructs the players on enemy setup, enemy properties, abilities, victory conditions and points out which artificial intelligence deck to use.The battles play out in an abstract environment, where characters may be either adjacent or distant from each other. The tactical nature of the game is reinforced by battle conditions such as 'engaged', 'surrounded' and some status markers like 'shielding' or 'exposed'.At the start of a battle round, players will roll and re-roll dice, in order to place them on their ability cards with matching die results. This is a planning phase, where party tactics are discussed. After party is done with planning enemies will perform their actions, following the instructions on the artificial intelligence cards drawn by each player.And of course some time during the round, dice may be spent from abilities, to perform actions in game - moving, attacking, healing, shooting, supporting, etc. There is a broad spectrum of abilities and some of them work together in unexpected ways. There are abilities that provide passive abilities as well as initiative enabled abilities - these may be used before enemy has a chance to act.Can you plan the round properly, relying on your various hero abilities and supporting equipment? You will need to anticipate the events, take risks and hope for your fellow heroes support if you want to survive the battles. The enemies will often perform surprising actions, creating fresh situations on every play through. The various aspects of the battles ensure delivering a simple to grasp, yet deep experience.This description touches lightly on how the game is like.Please take your time and watch the introductory play though videos, where setup, adventure mode and battles are explained in greater detail:Video 1 - Introduction and setupVideo 2 - Adventures on the mapVideo 3 - The battleCardboard tokens:6x large hero tokens39x large enemy tokens111x smaller tokens representing various assets and events in the game.Large cards:17x map area cards6x setting cards6x hero cards6x hero trait cards9x encounter cardsSmall cards:24x starting ability cards48x unique ability cards (for level ups)32x card common item deck30x card epic item deck20x wilderness event cards20x mountain event cards72x encounter AI cards10x epic challenge cards24 page rulebook.25x 6 sided dice (12 mm)The box dimensions are 270x187x66 mmOver 300 cards and more than 150 tokens!It is a big game!All the components will meet the highest industry standards.The final component count may vary slightly.The game is nearly finished. All
 we need now is your support in order to produce and deliver it. 
Estimated delivery time is early November 2014, with a possibility to pick 
the game up sooner at our booth at Essen Spiel 2014.As a thanks to the supporters, all perks are rewarded with a name or nickname mentioned on the specially designed sides of the box, found on the lower part of the box (visible once the lid is taken off).In other words, supporters shall be forever cursed, their names engraved upon this Wall of the Dooomed (in random order). : )Additionally, supporters who pre-ordered the game will receive some promotional cards:1 extra trait card with a matching ability card.2 extra common item cards2 extra epic item cardsIf the funding goal is met, then some additional stretch goals and rewards may be added throughout the campaign.Beautiful Disaster Games is a one person company, placed in Poland. The owner - Tomasz Stasiak is the designer of the game and a graphic designer by profession. Huge gaming enthusiast, fan of both board games and computer games. This project is a labor of love by Tom, supported by a couple of young, talented illustrators and friends. A kind request to all the contributors and those who do not want to contribute, but acknowledge this project's value. Please share this campaign on social media. It is a huge help by itself. Thank you! Free print to play game mode with achievement progression and rewards.More information on BGG thread:http://boardgamegeek.com/article/16169022#16169022Upgrade from 270x187x66 mm (Race for the Galaxy size) to a more appropriate 315x225x70 (Agricola size box). Adds 2 interesting setting cards to a total of 8 cards.Major card quality upgrade. Adds another 2 setting cards to a total of 10.

story:
There are two ways to describe what were are doing here, one is to use genres to describe it, other is to point at what analogies there are.

So it's soul is a lighthearted adventure, where you travel around the world, in a semi open fashion, entering different locations and trying to complete the kind and humorous story. You have many moves you can do, like jumping or dashing, you fight enemies and collect crazy things, and here starts the deep complex core. 

You will actually have a role playing experience. You will do quests, train new moves, find new equipment that can give you very unexpected abilities, spend money in shops and overall it will feel like a turn based JRPG became realtime with skill based combat. 

Now comparing to beloved classics you can expect a game that is close in it's adventure mechanics to Zelda, Super Mario 64, you will travel the world map, in different regions like in Final Fantasy and other rpgs, you will fight crazy bosses, meet memorable characters , participate in crazy quests and dare i say it - Change the world! 

As a game director i am deeply inspired not only by classics but by modern masterpieces too. You will find how strongly games like Fez, Journey, Little Big Planet affect the course of Redwood Tale, bringing more light and soul in this world.

  • Main story in three acts with a lot of playtime
  • Side quests
  • You are free to revisit places around the world 
  • Meet characters and help them out
  • Character customization!
  • World map, open for you to go where you want

  • We are developing with gamepads and mouse in mind. 
  • Sophisticated combat with auto target locking
  • Mobility moves like dashing, roll, blink
  • Magic casting system that is super awesome - you charge your spells by making gestures with your mouse or thumbstick and then release it when needed (and your hair glows when spell is charged with the color of the magic school the spell belongs to)

  • Change your build as you go - spend experience points to unlock abilities that will change the way you play the game.
  • Warrior, Mage, Rogue, and other potential builds you can pursue.
  • Equipment can give you new abilities, or modify existing ones.

The features described above are all planned and are the core of the game, however how particularly we will implement is still a question mark and will be thought through extensively and tuned and changed as we go. This is how we work, we test features to see how they fit the game, because what's on paper rarely reflects reality. 

All in all this is a HUGE endeavor, especially for a small team. Nevertheless this is not my first project, and every detail was chosen with realistic expectations in mind.  

 

More info about our vision

We will add many unique gameplay mechanics, unique to locations, to items, to characters.
Remember Link's magnet boots? That sort of thing.
We will make combat feel very good, expect Dark Souls level precision, but less punishing.
Same goes for movement, it will feel extremely responsive and accurate, on par with Super Meat Boy. 

We have a script ready for the whole story, it's our most valuable thing right now, that ties all ends together and we will keep it secret til the release :) You will meet a lot of unique characters and will visit many different places.

FAQ

 

Q: Where will the money go?!

A: This is a complex question. I could write a meaningless chart with standard "marketing/animation..." you know all that. However this is how i see it :
I am working on average 12 hours a day on this project, sometimes i have freelance jobs that can consume a good chunk of my time. This is insane. I'm doing everything - art, programming (all the tools/gameplay/core systems) managing the whole production, social media and writing this. Im leading to the point that first of all i need money to support myself and my family, which is fully involved in the process, and when savings run out and i don't get the fundings that will be it - back to day job, which will slow down the process insanely. However we won't stop there.
If we get funded i will invest chunk of money into speeding up the process, hiring artists, animators, programmers if needed. It's not my first day in gamedev and i know how things roll, how to make a product with limited funds. Nonetheless there are friends i know that will join anyway, and it seems they will during this campaign. 

Q: What you gonna do if you don't get funded?

A: It's not like i have a choice, this is such an amazing project and such a big deal for me that backing off is not an option and won't be considered. The only direction is forward, period, through struggles, through ups and downs this game will live and it will be great.

Perks!

The team

 

Little bit about our family

We are a family(literally), we live in Panama. I am Alex, the older brother, and i am a professional gamedev, with experience in all fields, i am basically a one man army. You can look at my art at  https://www.artstation.com/artist/alexantonov  , and see some of my programming experience here : https://alexantonov.artstation.com/pages/gamede...    and here https://github.com/pointcache .

Then here is Max, my smaller brother that literally today turned 16, and was helping me all along with art assets and music, he wrote the music track in the video :) 

Our mom - Veronica, helps us with story and in general making the world and events cohesive and not the mess we had initially, she is a theatrical/tv director with vast knowledge in script writing. 

Together we develop and shape the world of Redwood.

I was working in studios and freelance for many years, this time i decided to make it on my own. I will take all the hardships that indie dev has and will make amazing games without interference from producers and managers that have no idea what is the soul of the game.

story:
The Plot Thickens is a collaborative game where players create a tale that intertwines in ways no other storytelling game has done before!

Whether you're looking for an energetic, easy-to-learn game to play with your family and friends, or you're a more serious gamer with a love for storytelling and RPGs, you've come to the right place. Even if you're not great at improv or storytelling, the collaborative nature of the game makes it easy to weave a fun and interesting story.

Every game is unexpected! You'll create unusual, imaginative and wonderful tales with any group of storytellers you bring together - whether they be strangers or old friends.


You are a character in a Detective, Sci-Fi or Romance story (or any combination of the three!), and the plot is in your hands. You will craft an improvised narrative from a hand of 5 cards, each representing a person, place or thing in your story. The object of the game is to tell a creative tale and interconnect narratives as much as possible, using “plot points” that you will earn. At the end of the game, the player with the most plot points out gets to decide how the story ends, while the player with the most connections to their cards gets to name the story! You decide how long you'd like the game to be, by playing a quick game of 3 chapters or a longer more convoluted game of 6 or 7 chapters.

In The Plot Thickens, players are rewarded for using other players' story cards and bringing their character together into an epic, or hilarious, tale. Everything you do is canon to the one story you're all building. Didn't name your character? Well, someone else can! Every game is a new and unexpected adventure.
 


One of the most fun features is the ability to mix editions! Want to tell the tale of an alien love triangle in a space station on the edges of the galaxy? Mix Romance and Sci-Fi! How about space mobsters from another dimension? Sci-Fi and Detective! What about lovestruck pickpockets on the run from a private eye? You guessed it - Detective and Romance!

Whether you want a space opera, noir thriller, or cheesy romance novel, you can mix things up and let your imagination run wild!

We recommend Ages 10+ for Detective and Sci-Fi, and 17+ for Romance. 
 

 


Choosing your Character

Each player gets 3 Person cards at the beginning of the game. Choose 1 Person card to be your character for the game, and to tell the story from their perspective. Shuffle the unchosen cards back into the red deck.

Story Cards

Now that you have the character that you’ll be “playing”, you need words to build your story. Deal out 1 new Person card, 2 Place cards and 2 Thing cards to each player. This is separate from the Person card you chose to be your character. You should have a hand of 5 cards, and your character Person card down in front of you.


Playing Story Cards

You will use your hand of Person, Place and Thing cards to tell a story. You can use the words literally or figuratively, and you can use any number of the cards in your hand. Add as much flair and description as you’d like. Here is an example of how it works, and how you lay your cards out as you go:

In this example, we introduced the beginning of the story using cards in our hand, as well as revealed and named our character. Once you are out of cards or ideas, you say “meanwhile...” to pass the turn on to the next player, clockwise. As you tell your tale, place cards down as you say them, in the order they come up in the story. You can use as many or as few of your cards as you want, but you want to use as many as you can.

The second chapter works the exact same way, but you lay the next chapter just below your last chapter so everyone can still see your earlier chapter's words clearly to connect to later.

Plot Points
For every story card played (not including your character), you get a plot point. In the example above, we played 4 cards, so we got 4 plot points. The plot points have other uses as well, but the main purpose of them is to Thicken The Plot.

Thicken the Plot
Use other players' cards by incorporating that person, place or thing into your story. When you use a word, put one of your earned plot points on the white area of their card. You can only put one plot point per card, and you cannot put plot points on your own cards. In order to use another player’s word, you must reference the card in the specific context the player used it. For example, if a player put down “file” and explained it had evidence to a murder, in order to use that “file” card, you must be referencing the same file. You can connect to another player’s character card as well as the story cards they’ve used in their chapters.
 


End of the Game
At the end of your final chapter, don't worry about wrapping up the story - that is the Main Character's job! After the last player's final chapter, each player counts their color plot points on other players' cards. Whoever has the most plot points on other people's cards is deemed the Main Character and gets to end the story however they want. Unused plot points don't count!

Whoever has the most plot points on their own cards from other players is deemed the Author, since they contributed elements that everyone wanted to connect to. They get to name the story whatever they like!

There are a few other rules, like "Writer's Block" and "Edits", you can download the full rules here.
 


Since we came up with The Plot Thickens we have tried to share it with as many people as we could. Not only did we get amazing feedback that ultimately resulted in the game it is today, we met wonderful, interesting people along the way. We gained so many amazing stories created in the game and real-life experiences from interacting with so many game designers and playtesters. We want others to have their own experiences, make their own stories, and have a ton of fun along the way!

We are looking to hit a funding goal of $8,000 to meet manufacturing minimum quantities and cover production of a high quality, professionally manufactured game.​

We are also excited to be one of five finalists in the Hasbro Gaming Lab challenge! We need to get 100 unique backers to qualify to win, after which we'll be judged on other criteria. 


 

 

“I had a blast playing this game. It was fast, fun, and really got my brain buzzing.”
---

"My favorite game of the day! Wish we could buy it now!"
---

"Please dear god, tell me you have found a publisher for this game. I need it."
---

"I played this at Unpub recently, and it was, without a doubt, my favorite game there. The character Mr. Tootytoot the loan shark shall forever live on in my memory.﻿"

---

"So glad to have met you all and been able to play this game. It is truly inspired work. I am waiting in line to buy or pledge for it as we speak!"
---

"I'm just going to hand you my wallet, and you can take whatever you need out of it."
---

"I really liked everything, down to the color choices and box design. I like the cooperative storytelling. It was a lot of fun to weave the stories together"

 

 

 

Brigette Indelicato
Brigette is a graphic designer and designed all of The Plot Thickens game elements, from every single card in the game to the paperback novel-inspired design of the box. She loves problem-solving through design, and really enjoyed connecting with other people in the gaming community through developing this game. Her favorite part of playtesting and promoting the game at conventions and events was creating strange, wonderful tales with people she never met before.

Thomas Rochelle
The board game expert of the group, Tom collects and plays a new game every month to stay on top of innovations. The mechanics of The Plot Thickens, as well as the rulebook, were brought about from his experience with some of the best, and worst, game manuals. Tom's favorite part about creating The Plot Thickens was testing it with so many people. Being able to hone it to what it is from testers' valuable feedback made all the work worth it!

Mike Callahan
Mike created the hilarious puns found on the character cards and also targeted what themes we would ultimately launch as our flagship genres. His love and knowledge of low-rent pop culture tropes created the core feel of the Plot Thickens. With Mike's direction we crafted what words were included in each edition.Mike's favorite thing about the Plot Thickens is seeing people react to the unusual tales that come from so many unexpected places.

 

  • Back us! 
  • Get an extra copy for your most creative storytelling friends!
  • Follow us on facebook or twitter, or sign up for email updates!
  • Share this campaign with friends you think might enjoy it by using the "Share This Project" buttons!
  • Get in touch with us by email with any questions or concerns!

story:
Rehla is an RPG game that takes you on a journey all over the Arabian Peninsula, with a role-based combat system that allows you to control the four main characters and use the special abilities of each one to your advantage. Those abilities are also useful for solving puzzles and exploring multiple dungeons inside the game.

Rehla will be available on IOS and Android, and any supported tablets and mobile phones that use these platforms.
















Masud(مسعود):


A young man in his twenties. He leaves his Eastern city Al-Ahsa to fulfill a request in his father's will, which takes him on an unintended –but eventful- trip around the Arabian Peninsula.


Sadqa(صدقة):    


A Hijazi dealer from Jeddah. He has a distinctive ability to talk to animals and understand them, his companion is a cat.

Aida(عيضة):


A hunter who belongs to a tribe that resides at Aldahna dunes, and the older brother to Tasbihat. He received a cruel order from his tribe to feed his sister to the beast “Al Samtah” that rules the desert.



Tasbihat(تسبيحات):


The Younger sister of Aida. She had a close relationship with the Elder of the tribe (Alkhathra) which would later get her into trouble. Even after Alkhathra had passed away, Tasbihat could still see her in her dreams and that was understood as a bad omen by the others. Tasbihat was sent away by her tribe into certain death, but going on this journey with her brother and the others might just be her salvation.








After his father passed away, Masud receives the will his father left with the mosque’s Imam. His father mentions that he has a friend in Sadir area in Najd, thousands of kilometers away. Masud ultimately decides to brave the harsh Aldahna dunes elements to honor his father’s last wishes and meet that old friend. On his way, he meets the other characters: Sadqa, Aida and Tasbihat; and come across a lot of other friendly (and not so friendly) faces along the way. Their journey spans the Arabian Peninsula from Najd all the way to Alhijaz, then to Yemen, Oman, and even to the port of Dubai.











Features:

Unique stories based on Arabian Folktales:

Rehla will take you into an authentic world you won’t find in any other RPG about Arabs, while missing none of that delicious touch of RPG fiction. In each chapter, the heroes will play a significant role in the making of stories popular in local folklore, and fight together against mythical creatures that have haunted the nomads and townspeople in times past. How many of these creatures were YOU scared of when you were a kid? 



High quality graphics and stunning visuals:

Besides the 3D character models, Rehla has hundreds of individual high quality artworks that blend seamlessly with the 3D game environment, expressive character sprites in menus and conversations, and story-book style illustrations when something important is going on; all hand crafted by local male and female artists and designers from every region of the country.



Dual language support:

First there was Arabic, then there’s a translation!

Rehla currently supports English and Arabic in full: The dialogue, menus, and environment texts, all the things.



Dungeon system:

Rehla has a nice multi touch control system going on, helping the player explore the world and find new treasure at the tip of their finger. The Dungeons have different puzzles and obstacles which can be surpassed using different ways of thinking, or straight up changing the controllable character to use their strengths to your advantage. Can’t reach that Crystal? Just shoot an arrow into it, or get your pet monkey to hop up there and get it!


Turn-base battle system:

Rehla’s battle system is inspired by classic jrpg games where the player can control all the characters in the field, with careful tactics, you can upgrade weapons or activate special skills to defeat the foes, and use handy items or equip accessories to make your life easier.

Other than the aforementioned dungeons, the multi-touch system can be activated during battle. Cutting wood, planting shields, slashing at the Samtah with your very fingers, and raining arrows from the sky; if you time it right, you might just win by the skin of your teeth!













The Team:

Team Reem is a game studio based in Saudi Arabia
Our main focus is on projects that have local language and culture at their core, so that our games will deliver experiences the Saudi gamer can identify with and enjoy.
We have already published three early-stage mobile games, and are working on others, but “Rehla” is our very first big mobile game, and we’re glad we can finally share it with you!
we’d like to do things right for the sake of everyone in the local gaming community, after all, we are gamers ourselves!






--------------------------------------




Grab your perk



5$
Name Mention
Thank you for your support! Have your name mentioned in the credits for everyone to see


15$
Wallpapers + Name Mention
Receive digital wallpapers not published anywhere else + your name mention


25$
Copy of Game + Name Mention
The digital code for your copy of the game + name mention in the credits


 

40$
Copy of Game + Concept Art + Name Mention
The digital code for your copy of game, name mention in credits, and all of the game’s gorgeous concept art made by the artists who worked on it


100$
Copy of Game + Concept Art + Digital Wallpapers + Name Mention + Original Soundtrack
Code for the game, concept art and digital wallpapers, your name mentioned in the credits, and all of Rehla’s Original Soundtrack.



500$
all of the above + Action Figure
A copy of the game and all of the digital perks mentioned above + a 3D printed figure of your favorite character sent to you! (local shipping companies refuse to let us ship you a bucket of our happy tears, so a 3d figure will do hopefully)






FAQ:

-How will the game be delivered to me?

The digital code for the game will be sent to you either as a GooglePlay or Appstore code.

-Isn’t that price a little high?

A lot of time, research, programming, art and effort was required to create Rehla. The dialogue had to be right, the stories are based on real folklore that lives in real towns, the characters and environment take tools and experience and creativity to make. A project this big demands a lot of programming, AI work, big game-making engines, and a lot of promotion so that others know, yes, we can make games ourselves, and we just did! 

By supporting us, you are supporting the local game making industry itself. The artists and programmers and storytellers will thank you by making even more games, better art, and even more epic stories! 

-When will it be out to the public?

Our backers will get early access in April 2016, and the official launch date will be announced within the month following the end of the campaign.

-Is it going to be free once it’s officially out?

No. It will go along the price bracket of other RPG games in the store(s).

-When will the perks be sent out to backers?

The shipping time of figures will not be decided until we know how many you guys end up ordering, but the Digital goods will be sent out to backers during April 2016.







The game will be on:

story:
Who am I & what is this about?

For starters my name is Steffan Harris I am an indie game developer born & raised in  Virginia. I went to college at Westwood College of Technology in Denver Colorado studying Video Game Art & Design. After leaving college I came back to Virginia until I met my now wife & moved to Minnesota after working at Gamestop & years of going to conventions & being an avid gamer decided to use what I had learned in college to develop a game.

Upon talking with friends from X-Strike Studios I found the project I wanted to do & thus we have SideQuest. It started off as a movie a parody of RPG's from the late 80's early 90's but never was finished. I read the script & knew that this would make a great retro rpg.

This game is the best of all the rpg's from the 80's & 90's. It has a huge array of party members to choose from; an epic storyline; monsters & massive boss battles. Oh yeah and did I mention Summons. I am currently using the RPG Maker Xp & Vx to build the game and plan to release it on PC through Steam & on disk and am planning to release it on the Xbox 360 Arcade.

This is my first outing as a developer & it can't fully be done without your help. I thought I could do it on my own but soon realized that is not going to happen. I need help from you the public. This is a labour of love & a personal dream of mine.

The Story

For those just catching up to this Side Quest is a JRPG that parodies JRPGs from the 80's & 90's it was written by our own X-Striker Juese & just a touch rewritten by me. It follows Gale Winthrop (Stormwind..Hey things happen & people sometimes have to visit a naming way) On Gales 16th birthday he is forced to take a stand against not only his father & the Envirocorp his father works for to save the planet but save his friend Dreamer and help his friend Bob pick the pieces of his life back up. & believe me not everything is as straight forward as it may seem in the world of Side Quest.

Now on to the technical aspects. The game will be released for the PC either through disk or through Steam also it is being released for the Xbox through the arcade so there will be options for you all the gamers. As far as perks go any donation amount will be getting thanks in the credits & on the web page but larger donations can earn you a spopt in the game as either a vendor, a quest giver, summon or, special playable character.

The website for the project is Sidequestrpg.weebly.com
And you can find us on the book of faces as well. If you have questions please feel free to ask me either on here on facebook the indiegogo page or email me at sidequestrpg@live.com

The Breakdown

The funds for this game are going to various sources for one I need a machine powerful enough to do the build & the art on. I have a machine lined up it  is 700. I am sourcing out music & some art & want to set aside an additional 500 for labour.  800 is for materials such as paints, pencils, sketchpads, lightbox &, software such as RPG Maker VX Ace &, Adobe Photoshop CS3. $99 is for the mebership fee to Microsoft to be able to release it on the Xbox Live Arcade Inidie section. The rest is for distribution, printing off maps, prints & , authoring soundtracks.

Even if I don't get the full funding I still need to get a machine so I can get back to work on the game itself. The laptop I was working with died but the data is recoverable. & those who do donate will have the game around two weeks after it's completion.

In Finality

First off I need to tell you this isn't a fund my life project I am still working a fulltime job and paying my own life bills  expenses. I am making this game as a labour of love & using it as my stepping stone to get into the industry.

This project is something I have  put my heart & dreams into. It's my first outing into the development world & I want to comeplete this with all my being. Any help is appreciated so plese if you can't donate then tell your friends mention it at your local gaming shop whether it be video or table top get the word out & help me with my dream. I have a great story that was written by great friends & I want them to experience it with me.

I have a great story that was written by great friends & I want them to experience it with me.

story:
Back Then

Remembering back to my adolescence, I used to love experimenting and creating. One of my early inventions was taking a clickable pencil, breaking off the head which would release the inner rod, cutting a slit in the eraser that's attached to the inner rod and then tying a rubber band between the eraser and the clip which would allow for an item to be loaded in to the barrel shell from which one could pull/release the inner rod to shoot the projectile out. To my surprise, it was quite accurate.

My friends would always want to borrow it and test their aim. We would set up targets and challenges. It was all quite fun and entertaining.

Just Recently

Well, contrary to what my friends may have you believe, I'm no longer a child. I'm 32, but who says I can't still enjoy the simple things in life and have a little fun? I recently read up on a few crowdfunding success stories and thought back to the device I used to make as a child. Remembering back to how much fun my friends and I enjoyed playing with it, maybe it's time to bring my idea to life for the world to enjoy.

The grown-up in me says I should make a pen that is practical, purposeful, comfortable and writes well.

My inner child tells me to make it a gadget that can transform in to another device to shoot out spitwads and the like.

My business sense tells me to combine the two functions to make for one awesome, and yet totally cool, device.

Today

I'm ready to move forward and am committed to making the best pen + spitwad launcher ever! The first and only one of its kind, I believe.

So, I've Built An Initial Prototype

The photos below depict my process for creating a spitwad launcher. Please keep in mind that this is merely to demonstrate the assembly and use of the device.

See It In Action

To demonstrate our concept, in action, we have prepared this short video.


The Final Product

The final product would essentially function in the same fashion as described in the above video; however, the device will be a slightly over-sized pen instead of a pencil. The product will be made of plastic and will consist of an unscrewable top, rubber grip and durable elastic rubber band.

  • The unscrewable top will allow you to unscrew and swap out the different color ink tubes or use as a wad launcher.
  • The rubber grip will provide comfort, for your fingers, when writing.
  • The pen tip, itself, will be a ball point.
  • The rubber band will be used during wad launcher mode. The rubber band itself will be very durable, elastic and provide great snap action. We will ensure that the rubber band will be made so as to not break or dry not. However, we will offer replacement rubber bands should, in the rare case, one ever break.
  • Wads ammunition. Each wad is a small capsule that can be loaded in to and shot out of, the pen. We will offer a variety of different wads including regular wads and sticky wads. Wads will be made of a Nerf-like material.

Product / Accessories

For initial product launch, we intend to offer the following product and accessories:

  • Main device (pen / wad launcher).
  • Wads. Both regular wads and sticky wads will be available.

Manufacturing Process

All designing, prototyping and packaging will be done out of our office in Virginia Beach, VA. The manufacturing and assembly will be handled at the location of the manufacturer (China).

Designing - I will be leading the industrial design effort as I have a background in graphic design. I've created most all of the design works for my ad agency over the past 18 years. My 3D background experience is a little lacking, having only worked with 3D Studio Max and Cinema4D on hobbyist-type projects, but I plan on brushing up on my 3D design skills to develop the look and feel for the Wads device. I'm a fast learner and work diligently on my own. In researching online, I've found that Autodesk123D seems to be a popular 3D design platform for use with 3D printers. So, I plan to start there. We estimate this process to take 1 month.

Prototyping - Once our 3D designs are complete, I'll begin creating prototypes using a 3D printer. I'm still researching which printer would best suit my needs as this product will require a very high layer resolution in order to output a smooth surface. I'm leaning towards MakerBot's Replicator 2x. Handling this process, in-house, will allow me to tweak the various design components of the device until everything is perfect (Lord knows I'm a perfectionist!). We estimate this process to take 1-2 months.

Manufacturing & Assembly - Once we have successfully created our fully functioning prototype, we will meet with our local outsourcing partner to demonstrate our product and deliver our final 3D files. They work with local companies that require outsourcing their product development needs. They have relationships with manufacturers in China and act as main point of contact throughout entire development process. This will help us out tremendously as we don't know a lick of Chinese. We've worked with them in the past and feel very comfortable with their capabilities. Based on initial conversations with this company, there's often a little back and forth with the manufacturer when developing the molds. Tweaking of specs and so forth. Given that, we estimate this entire process to take between 3-4 months.

Packaging - All Wads products will be packaged by us, in Virginia Beach, VA. This will allow us to keep a close eye on quality to provide you with the best product possible.

We hope to be ready for orders by May 2014.

Future Plans (Interactive Game)

Please note that all items listed below are "Future Plans." They will not be included in initial product launch. The good news is that you will not have to replace your device when we do release these new products.

Wadboard - We plan on offering both a laser pointer accessory and a Wadboard (think dartboard). The laser pointer can be attached to the pen for aiding in accuracy. The Wadboard will be able to sync with a user's mobile device (phone/tablet). On the mobile device, the user can download our native app. This app, which communicates with the Wadboard, will allow the user to take part in challenges with other Wad users, track the distance of wads shot out of it, measure accuracy, community rankings, scores and more.

Wads - We will offer a variety of additional wads including glow-in-the-dark wads, rocket wads, etc.

Pen wraps - Cool design wraps, on an adhesive material, used to customize the look of the pen. We'll offer a gallery of different wraps, for purchase, on our website. In the future, we'll allow for users to create their own wraps, through our website, from which we will print and mail to customer.

We're stoked about bringing this product to life. We just need your help and support in making our dream a reality.

The manufacturing and assembly will be handled at the location of the manufacturer (China).Designing - I will be leading the industrial design effort as I have a background in graphic design. I've created most all of the design works for my ad agency over the past 18 years. My 3D background experience is a little lacking, having only worked with 3D Studio Max and Cinema4D on hobbyist-type projects, but I plan on brushing up on my 3D design skills to develop the look and feel for the Wads device. I'm a fast learner and work diligently on my own. In researching online, I've found that Autodesk123D seems to be a popular 3D design platform for use with 3D printers. So, I plan to start there. We estimate this process to take 1 month.Prototyping - Once our 3D designs are complete, I'll begin creating prototypes using a 3D printer. I'm still researching which printer would best suit my needs as this product will require a very high layer resolution in order to output a smooth surface. I'm leaning towards MakerBot's Replicator 2x. Handling this process, in-house, will allow me to tweak the various design components of the device until everything is perfect (Lord knows I'm a perfectionist!). We estimate this process to take 1-2 months.Manufacturing & Assembly - Once we have successfully created our fully functioning prototype, we will meet with our local outsourcing partner to demonstrate our product and deliver our final 3D files. They work with local companies that require outsourcing their product development needs. They have relationships with manufacturers in China and act as main point of contact throughout entire development process. This will help us out tremendously as we don't know a lick of Chinese. We've worked with them in the past and feel very comfortable with their capabilities. Based on initial conversations with this company, there's often a little back and forth with the manufacturer when developing the molds. Tweaking of specs and so forth. Given that, we estimate this entire process to take between 3-4 months.Packaging - All Wads products will be packaged by us, in Virginia Beach, VA. This will allow us to keep a close eye on quality to provide you with the best product possible.We hope to be ready for orders by May 2014.
Future Plans (Interactive Game)
Please
 note that all items listed below are "Future Plans." They will not be 
included in initial product launch. The good news is that you will not 
have to replace your device when we do release these new products.
Wadboard
 - We plan on offering both a laser pointer accessory and a Wadboard 
(think dartboard). The laser pointer can be attached to the pen for 
aiding in accuracy. The Wadboard will be able to sync with a user's 
mobile device (phone/tablet). On the mobile device, the user can 
download our native app. This app, which communicates with the Wadboard,
 will allow the user to take part in challenges with other Wad users, 
track the distance of wads shot out of it, measure accuracy, community 
rankings, scores and more.

Wads - We will offer a variety of additional wads including glow-in-the-dark wads, rocket wads, etc.
Pen wraps
 - Cool design wraps, on an adhesive material, used to customize the 
look of the pen. We'll offer a gallery of different wraps, for purchase,
 on our website. In the future, we'll allow for users to create their 
own wraps, through our website, from which we will print and mail to 
customer.
We're stoked about bringing this product to life. We just need your help and support in making our dream a reality.

story:
Our goal and commitment to our fans as Leap To Mobile indie studios is to develop the most entertaining and exciting games for years to come!

We want to help animals wordwide for years to come! We can only do this if we can reach our goal and complete development of Skipping Turtles.  Portion of ALL sales will be given to help animals. 

Concept sketch for opening game video

Skippy's Adventure Begins

At the request of his friends Skippy has decided to come out of retirement and assemble the crew back together for one last adventure. Salty, the menacing saltwater crocodile and his minions are back from exile from the harsh Australian Outback and have started to take over the water supply from the other animals by constructing a water system that will effect the Land Down Under. Skippy and his team are their last hope to get things back to normal again. 

Early Development of Skippy Sliding

What is Skippy's Goal in Skipping Turtles? 

Your goal is to navigate Skippy along water slides, tunnels, pipes, and make sure you are on the lookout for hidden underground levels. Skippy needs to collect as many shells as he can as well as open the water plugs to release the water back to where it belongs and away from Salty's fortress. As you embark on Skippy's adventure there will be additional characters you will face as well as meet more of Skippy's friends who can help you succeed defeating Salty and his minions. Additional shells with unique powers will also be available as well as the chance to unlock levels. It will be 2D side scrolling game with intuitive controls for jumping and changing velocity to increase height and distance off of slide and pipes. Skippy can't wait for you to help him defeat Salty! 

Skippy and his best friend, to be named as a reward!

Portion of all game sales will be given to help animals around the world!

We are firm believers in giving back and helping others.  We have chosen to donate a portion of all game sales to animal organizations around the world. As a pledge reward we have given you the opportunity to select the organization we will donate to for a full year!  If someone does not select that reward we will decide where the money will go and share it with our fans.

Who we are and the inspiration for Skipping Turtles? 

Kevin and Steve have been working on Skipping Turtles for close to a year now in one form or another. When Leap To Mobile was created late last year it was time to get serious about developing Skipping Turtles. 

The inspiration for Skipping Turtles came while Kevin was fishing in OK. He thought why not create a mobile game starring a turtle as the hero who saves the day from a much larger foe. Kevin has lived in Australia and want to begin begin Skippy's adventure in the beautiful country of Australia. 

Skippy going through a tube opening the plugs to return the water to the other animals that Salty is trying to steal and route to his exiled land.

Salty, the evil salt water crocodile

What Will indiegogo Funds Be Used For? 

We have started the design and development process for Skipping Turtles. We have chosen to utilize indiegogo to assist us in raising the additional funds needed to fully design and develop Skipping Turtles for OUYA, iOS, and Android. We hope to raise more than our goal so we can create additional levels, work on the back story of Skippy and introduce new characters. We will be creating hidden levels within the game, additional shells that can be utilized on certain levels and enemies. We also have some exciting stretch goals if we reach our initial goal before campaign ends.

We sincerely appreciate everyone's support and could not do this without your help.

Salty's right hand minion. Name him/her as a Pledge Reward

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to the fundraiser for our God of War focused fan film, Ashes! This page is dedicated to raising funds and interest for a very exciting project a very talented group of people will be putting together.

Please note; we are actually aiming for about £250-£300 worth of funding but IndieGoGo's minimum is £500!

This cosplay showcase will focus on the relationship between Kratos and his son Atreus, and we want to convey their growing relationship through the video that does the game's beautiful theme and moods justice. Not only are we aiming for a roughly 4 minute video, but also a gorgeous set of prints available both physically and digitally for our backers. Each different tier offers different, exciting rewards that we can keep adding to if this fund raiser goes well!

Meet the cast and crew; 

Kratos : @ BaldSasquatch

Atreus & creator : @ Opal.Ink.Cosplay

Videographer & Director : @ Electrospectrum

Photographer : @ Laughing Orc

Handler and extra : @ xbladeycakesx

What We Need and Where Your Money Goes

Funding will go multiple ways, but namely towards;

> Travel/accommodation costs for the cast and crew
> Costume costs
> Merch for the selected tiers
> Conservation efforts towards the beautiful locations we will be utilising

Any amount of donation will leave us eternally grateful for your support, so please do not feel the need to stretch yourself. Sharing our project is just as great a way to support us!

The Impact

We are all dedicated fans and artists in the forms of cosplayer, videography and photography. All of us are incredibly fond of the game and would love to convey how much it impacted us as creatives through this project to thank Santa Monica for such an incredible experience. A  dedicated God of War cosplay showcase doesn't yet exist so we would love to change that.

Risks & Challenges

Obviously the main risk is that we do not reach adequate funding to cover all the costs of everyone fairly. This project will go ahead no matter the outcome, but any contribution we can put towards the costs of travel/locations would be incredible!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing is caring! Getting the word out there to fellow God of War/cosplay fans would be insanely helpful, so please feel free to share on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram! I will also link an amazon wishlist that you can feel free to buy off if you instead wish to contribute in other ways that we can use for the costumes/props themselves.
