Tuttavia vogliamo avere un occhio di riguardo per i nostri connazionali!VI invitiamo, per mettervi in contatto con noi, a visitare il sito, la pagina Facebook, o il nostro account Twitter, che trovate su questa campagna, oppure a scriverci a info@italiaquidditch.com se volete saperne di più.Vi saremo immensamente grati se voleste aiutarci, anche solo mandando questo link ai vostri amici. Se 100 di voi visitassero questa pagina e ognuno di questi convincesse 10 amici a donare un solo euro, avremmo soldi sufficienti a pagare un biglietto ad un giocatore della nazionale! Aiutateci a mostrare che l'Italia è una nazione da non sottovalutare :)

story:
-- THREE DIMENSIONAL COMIC BOOK VIDEO GAME BOARD GAME --

(CAMPAIGN BEGINS: MARCH 10th, 2014 - FOR 30 DAYS)

NOTE: THIS GAME DOES NOT HAVE TO REACH ITS GOAL TO BE PRODUCED! WE ARE MOVING AHEAD WITH PRODUCTION UPON COMPLETION OF THIS CAMPAIGN AND ALL DONORS WILL GET THEIR PERKS AS PROMISED. DON'T MISS YOUR CHANCE TO BE PART OF SOMETHING SPECIAL - DONATE TODAY!

The Homemade Game Guru is a You Tube channel started in 2008 as a creative hub for DIY how-to videos centered on making cardboard crafts, comic book themed crafts, geeky concepts and general over-the-top inventions made out of simple materials. Creator and host Luanga Lue Nuwame is an award-winning designer who conceived the Homemade Game Guru as a way to share his ideas and love of inventions with viewers worldwide. (http://www.youtube.com/homemadegameguru)

Superpowerful Bonanza will be the first board game published under the Homemade Game Guru Products banner. Like all Homemade Game Guru concepts, Superpowerful Bonanza will be handcrafted with each and every edition made with care and dedication. Mass production is of NO interest here!  All perks are limited editions EXCLUSIVE to this campaign.  Any and all future 2015 specialty market editions of Superpowerful Bonanza will be REDESIGNED to differentiate them from these Indiegogo exclusives!


The goal is to raise at least $5000 to garner materials, tools/machinery and a small industrial space to begin making editions of Superpowerful Bonanza in time for Christmas (for donors to this campaign) and for specialty stores/comic book stores (Spring 2015).

Although the campaign is 'Flexible Funded', if the $5000 minimum funding level isn’t reached by the 30 day mark, I will offer a refund to anyone who requests their money back! This game and the promised perks WILL BE MADE at the end of this campaign - regardless if it fails or succeeds (this is my dream and you never kill a dream - you just work twice as hard). However, if you request a refund if the campaign doesn't succeed, I will respectfully oblige with a "thank you"! I want my donors to feel comfortable with their investment and this is my unique way to respect the chance you're taking. But again - this game WILL move forward!  

Superpowerful Bonanza was first conceived on March 10th, 1999 when Luanga was going through a deep depression during his early 20s. The idea of the game unexpectedly came to Luanga after he suffered a mental breakdown and within six months of dedicated work, the finished concept was completed using only basic materials like pencil crayon, Bristol board, cardboard, glue, duct tape and toy cars.

The creation of this game not only served as an anti-depressant for its creator, but it also started Luanga’s life long journey of creating with cardboard. In essence, Superpowerful Bonanza was responsible for the creation of the Homemade Game Guru You Tube channel and over 100 personal inventions. 15 years since the concept was first conceived, the You Tube channel it helped create is now giving birth to a new handmade limited edition rendition of the game!

More information on the history of the game’s creation and how mental health can be healed with invention and imagination, please view the following video: Mental Health, Depression, Board Games & Crowdfunding

Superpowerful Bonanza combines three amazing things into one concept: 1) Board games, 2) Video game-play and 3) Comic Books! It is a three-dimensional multilevel board game that plays like a classic video game and stars awesome looking comic book characters – it doesn’t get any better than that!

The game was developed to play like a classic ‘side-scrolling’ video game reminiscent of Double Dragon or Contra, but with a series of new superheroes and villains created by Luanga Nuwame and drawn by Daniel Wong.


Superpowerful Bonanza has five levels, each with its own boss and differing rules of play.  Up to four players move along each level collecting weapons, health, powers and superpowers revealed on game cards selected with each move. Certain spaces reveal minor enemy characters players must battle using a combination of strength, speed and intelligence points. There are other obstacles revealed throughout the game and players can choose to either help or hinder their fellow players/heroes.



In order to defeat the boss at each level, players must collect enough weapons, powers, superpowers and strength/speed/intelligence points to combat those of the bosses.  Each boss has their own card deck with weapons and powers. Thus, moving around the board quickly to reach the boss first isn’t good enough – without the right combination of provisions, the heroes will lose! 

As an added feature, there are two Secret Levels on each extreme side of the game.  Players must find the right spaces and get the perfect roll of the dice to enter the secret levels and gain the treasures available.

Visually, the game has been designed to be a stunning work of art. Hand cut and glued, all aspects of the game are painstakingly put together. Toy trees and individually wrapped and glued building balconies are added with care. The completed game is as much of a centerpiece as it is a highly competitive superhero battle-fest! A cardboard and a spruce wood edition are available in this campaign.

Both the cardboard or spruce wood editions come with the following components:

1)  The completed handmade Game Board

2)  A pack of toy trees to adorn level two

3)  250 game cards

4)  Two dice

5)  1 card tray to hold all cards not in play

6)  5 card battle boards

7)  One spinner

8)  A pack of score sheets

9)  46 health sticks

10)  Nine character playing pieces

11)  Game manual + character bios

12)  Each edition signed, embossed sealed and numbered by Luanga Nuwame

If this has perked your interest so far, please read on. We have truly amazing gifts to offer…


So what can you expect to receive in exchange for your trust, belief and hard-earned cashola? The answer includes a limited edition trading card set, comic book, card game and versions of the completed game EXCLUSIVE to this campaign! When we say EXCLUSIVE – we truly mean EXCLUSIVE and LIMITED ONLY TO THIS CAMPAIGN!  All perk gifts will NOT be reprinted as is once the campaign is concluded! It is our intention to ensure those who help this dream materialize receive benefits that are rare and meaningful!

New Life Level Perk $5

Every new idea has a beginning and even the smallest donations are meaningful and appreciated.  You will receive a sincere "thank-you" email and your name will be listed in the game's instruction manual as a Donor Contributor along with the contributors of all the other perk levels.


Civilian Populous Level Perk $15

(Sample images – final cards to be finalized)

You will receive one set of 12 Superpowerful Bonanza Trading Cards complete with a wood case. The set features the four main heroes, five villains plus the two secret level characters and a card featuring a yet-to-be-revealed Supervillain who appears in the comic book (see next perk).

This perk will only be available exclusively during this Indiegogo campaign! It will NOT be reprinted or sold after the conclusion of this campaign.

International Shipping IS included!!  Projected delivery: June 2014


Everyday Hero Level Perk $25 

(Sample cover - final cover art to be finalized upon completion of campaign) 

You will receive the set of 12 Superpowerful Bonanza Trading Cards (the $15 perk), plus a 20-page Superpowerful Bonanza #0 b&w comic book! This comic fully explains the story behind the board game and features the 1st appearance of all the characters.  One of the characters’ origins is also revealed! Each issue will be hand signed and numbered by creator Luanga Nuwame.

This perk will only be available exclusively during this Indiegogo campaign! This specific issue will NEVER be reprinted or sold after the conclusion of this campaign. 

International Shipping IS included!!  Projected delivery: July 2014


Superhero Hero Level Perk $65 

You will receive the set of 12 Superpowerful Bonanza Trading Cards (the $15 perk), plus the signed 20-page Superpowerful Bonanza #0 comic book (the $25 perk), plus a copy of the Superheroine Slamdown novelty card game.

Superheroine Slamdown is a 55-card fast paced and simple to learn battle card game featuring all the powerful female characters from Superpowerful Bonanza, plus two new characters (one of which is featured in the trading card set). The game comes with 55 cards and manual in a wood box. Each set is signed and numbered.

This VERSION of the game will only be available exclusively during this Indiegogo campaign! This card game will be REDESIGNED and sold online in 2015. 

International Shipping IS included!!  Projected delivery: July 2014


Superpowerful Superhero Level Perk $125 (Only 100 available)

You will receive the set of 12 Superpowerful Bonanza Trading Cards (the $15 perk).

You will receive the signed 20-page Superpowerful Bonanza #0 comic book (the $25 perk).

You will also receive a complete Cardboard Edition of Superpowerful Bonanza! This single corrugated version is ‘fold and ready to go’ and comes with assembly instructions. All cards, playing pieces and components are included. The game is signed, embossed sealed and numbered by Luanga Nuwame.

This VERSION of the game will only be available exclusively during this Indiegogo campaign! The planned 2015 specialty market edition will be REDESIGNED to differentiate it from this Indiegogo exclusive!

International Shipping IS included!!  Projected delivery: October 2014


Superpowerful Superhero of Awesome! Level Perk $250 

(Only 50 available)

You will receive the set of 12 Superpowerful Bonanza Trading Cards (the $15 perk).

You will receive the signed 20-page Superpowerful Bonanza #0 comic book (the $25 perk).

You will also receive a complete Spruce-wood Edition of Superpowerful Bonanza! This hand cut edition is complete out of the box and only requires the toy trees to be added.  All cards, playing pieces and components are included. The game is signed, embossed sealed and numbered by Luanga Nuwame.

This edition will ONLY be available exclusively during this Indiegogo campaign! This specific edition will NEVER be reprinted or sold after the conclusion of this campaign.

Bonus: Two bottles of the new Moon Voodoo Log Sorrel Beverage – a new, delicious beverage to be launch for Christmas 2015 by Nadia Jones. You will be one of the first in the world to experience this new amazing drink! 

International Shipping IS included!!  Projected delivery: October 2014


Omnipotence Level Perk $725 (Only 10 available)

2x The 12 piece Trading Card Set +

2x Superpowerful Bonanza #0 comic book +

2x Superheroine Slamdown Card Game +

1x The Superpowerful Bonanza 3D Board Game: Cardboard Edition +

1x The Superpowerful Bonanza 3D Board Game: Spruce Wood Edition +

4x Bottles of the new Voodoo Log Sorrel Beverage


+ 3 Superpowerful Bonanza T-shirts (your choice of size – background color options are only Black or White).


+ A TBA Vinyl Figurine of the evil Voodoo Log Idol! The completed design will be posted once available. (Note: the Voodoo Log Idol is one of the ‘enemy’ game cards that can hypnotize any hero and render their intelligence points void during an attack.)

The Voodoo Log Idol figure will be numbered to 25 copies exclusively (the remaining 15 held for possible convention or retailer gifts). The first numbered 1-10 copies are earmarked for this perk!

International Shipping IS included!! Projected delivery: October 2014


As mentioned previously, the campaign's goal is to reach $5000. However, if the amount raised surpasses that goal, we would like to extend further perks and gifts to everyone who has donated – regardless of amount.  Added limited edition perks (available to everyone) will be posted as the campaign grows. Our way of saying “thank you” for helping this dream become a reality!

Additional funds raised will be put towards a possible comic book limited series based on the characters and for additional game production supplies and equipment.

story:
Follow us!

Twitter Facebook Youtube


To stay updated see our indiedb web:

Play our DEMO here: Link



The game divides itself in missions like any other top-down space shooter, however there are other scenes, like the universal map, where you can explore for secret areas, ships, weapons, or even unlock new endings.

Fast-paced action! - Responsive controlers are what makes the combat so exciting, dont believe me? watch the trailer!

Level up your ship! - In CR-Figther your shield and power systems level up so you can use more abilities, weapons and more!

Level up your weapons! - If you think firing one small laser is not good enough, level up and see your ship's weapon system gaining rate of fire and firepower!

Unlock new weapons! - You want more? ok, search the galaxy and use ancient technologies or new races weapondry to achieve your goals.

Decide where you are going! - Non-linear story. You fell in love with your AI? You hated it and change it for a butler? it's up to you!

Explore the universe! - After a stage is cleared you can re-enter it with no enemies and explore in all (2d) directions (not just forward).



What this game will give you?


  • Space-shooting with rpg elements.
  • Twelve completed levels.
  • More than 20 different types of enemies.
  • More than 12 playable ships .
  • Beautifully blended 3D FX and particle systems.
  • Original soundtrack.
  • Non- linear story.
  • Lots of PEW PEW PEW! Cause we all love that stuff!
  • PC and Vita versions. (PSM)


T.A.I.

TAI is "The Artificial Intelligence" onboard the spaceship you pilot, she... well it... is very logic but will find some problems that logic can't solve due to its ability to learn and feel.  She likes telling you what to do and seems to dislike you.

H.E.R.


HER stands for "Human Earth Resistance" (I know you are all overwhelmed with our sense of originality), this guys will help you in some missions, even some unnamed soldiers (check rewards) will join you as wingmans!

Non-dependant A.I.s

This AI's were programmed to defend the earth and expand the human domain, however they started to think that humans were not needed to acomplish the mission.

The pilot.

Well... it's you! You don't know a single thing about space ships, but you have a talent for it... Right?



The story starts with you getting into the ship as the flagship "Hope 2" begins to collapse, everything's on fire, people dying, the HORROR!, the only thing you could think about was "I need to get out of here" somehow you managed to activate the A.I. and take off before the collapse. So, after the flagship explosion, the A.I. scans you and finds out you are not a pilot, and sadly, will have to try to survive by its own given there's no capable human help. Or is there?


This game have soul, combining the fast action of a shooter with RPG elements, like excellent narrative and characters that you'll care about, all with responsive and addicting game mechanics, is our idea of an excellent game. Something fun to play! But the only way for it to be it's best is with your help!

There are many risks that could jeopardize the timing release of the game, however, we will do our best to avoid all of them. Also the game its almost 60% done but we want to make it better, to reach it's full potential and with your help release it!

I thank you all for taking the time to read through this.


So what's this campaign about?



Luckily, we have been able to get enough talented people interested in the game and ready to start. Some of them even allow us to use their material for this campaign! However, professionals like them will hardly want to work on a project with you if you don't have the funds to pay for their work.


Money will go to:


  • Paying for music compositions.
  • Paying for graphical works, more and better ships, better UI, overall better looks!  
  • Improving code.
  • Paying taxes.
  • Some fees for release.


We are puting our souls into this proyect for 2 main reasons:

We believe games are meant to be played by anyone that wants to play it. So we are making a Semi-Arcade game that every casual gamer can play and enjoy and adding enough depth and dificulty for hardcore gamers too.


We also believe that games are all about emotions, so we write a story that will make you feel something for our game, we create characters that will make you laugh, hate them, and maybe even cry... don't want to spoil anything so we leave it there.


Thank you!

So you like it, but can't contribute?

No worries! like this page and leave a comment, every 100 likes we will select a lucky guy/gal and we wil give out a free digital copy of the game! 

(Upon release)


Grillo.- Born somewere far, with a joy for casual games and only 27 years old. She is the voice behind T.A.I.

Daniel.- He is an imaginative guy, always daydreaming and trying to create mind challenges. He is our level designer.

David Perez.- Also helping with level design and feedback.

Mathew Pablo.- Experienced composer and creator of the excellent soundtrack!

Alberto Leal.- He will be the one creating the ships for the final version! and already created this one: 

Henry Wonderwall.- Lead programmer and creator of the game.

http://www.kenney.nl provided CC0 graphics used for the prototype.

We all thank you for your support!! If you like our game please contribute and pick one of our rewards!

Important note:

All reward content is guaranteed for PC, but we will do everything posible to give a vita version for the ones that want that instead, however we can't promise you a vita version. (it's not up to us just yet)

Follow us!Twitter Facebook YoutubeTo stay updated see our indiedb web:Play our DEMO here: LinkThe game divides itself in missions like any other top-down space shooter, however there are other scenes, like the universal map, where you can explore for secret areas, ships, weapons, or even unlock new endings.Fast-paced action! - Responsive controlers are what makes the combat so exciting, dont believe me? watch the trailer!Level up your ship! - In CR-Figther your shield and power systems level up so you can use more abilities, weapons and more!Level up your weapons! - If you think firing one small laser is not good enough, level up and see your ship's weapon system gaining rate of fire and firepower!Unlock new weapons! - You want more? ok, search the galaxy and use ancient technologies or new races weapondry to achieve your goals.Decide where you are going! - Non-linear story. You fell in love with your AI? You hated it and change it for a butler? it's up to you!Explore the universe! - After a stage is cleared you can re-enter it with no enemies and explore in all (2d) directions (not just forward).What this game will give you?

Space-shooting with rpg elements.


Twelve completed levels.


More than 20 different types of enemies.


More than 12 playable ships .


Beautifully blended 3D FX and particle systems.


Original soundtrack.


Non- linear story.


Lots of PEW PEW PEW! Cause we all love that stuff!


PC and Vita versions. (PSM)

T.A.I.TAI is "The Artificial Intelligence" onboard the spaceship you pilot, she... well it... is very logic but will find some problems that logic can't solve due to its ability to learn and feel.  She likes telling you what to do and seems to dislike you.H.E.R.HER stands for "Human Earth Resistance" (I know you are all overwhelmed with our sense of originality), this guys will help you in some missions, even some unnamed soldiers (check rewards) will join you as wingmans!Non-dependant A.I.sThis AI's were programmed to defend the earth and expand the human domain, however they started to think that humans were not needed to acomplish the mission.The pilot.Well... it's you! You don't know a single thing about space ships, but you have a talent for it... Right?The story starts with you getting into the ship as the flagship "Hope 2" begins to collapse, everything's on fire, people dying, the HORROR!, the only thing you could think about was "I need to get out of here" somehow you managed to activate the A.I. and take off before the collapse. So, after the flagship explosion, the A.I. scans you and finds out you are not a pilot, and sadly, will have to try to survive by its own given there's no capable human help. Or is there?This game have soul, combining the fast action of a shooter with RPG elements, like excellent narrative and characters that you'll care about, all with responsive and addicting game mechanics, is our idea of an excellent game. Something fun to play! But the only way for it to be it's best is with your help!There are many risks that could jeopardize the timing release of the game, however, we will do our best to avoid all of them. Also the game its almost 60% done but we want to make it better, to reach it's full potential and with your help release it!I thank you all for taking the time to read through this.So what's this campaign about?Luckily, we have been able to get enough talented people interested in the game and ready to start. Some of them even allow us to use their material for this campaign! However, professionals like them will hardly want to work on a project with you if you don't have the funds to pay for their work.Money will go to:

Paying for music compositions.


Paying for graphical works, more and better ships, better UI, overall better looks!  


Improving code.


Paying taxes.

Some fees for release.
We are puting our souls into this proyect for 2 main reasons:We believe games are meant to be played by anyone that wants to play it. So we are making a Semi-Arcade game that every casual gamer can play and enjoy and adding enough depth and dificulty for hardcore gamers too.We also believe that games are all about emotions, so we write a story that will make you feel something for our game, we create characters that will make you laugh, hate them, and maybe even cry... don't want to spoil anything so we leave it there.Thank you!So you like it, but can't contribute?No worries! like this page and leave a comment, every 100 likes we will select a lucky guy/gal and we wil give out a free digital copy of the game! (Upon release)Grillo.- Born somewere far, with a joy for casual games and only 27 years old. She is the voice behind T.A.I.Daniel.- He is an imaginative guy, always daydreaming and trying to create mind challenges. He is our level designer.David Perez.- Also helping with level design and feedback.Mathew Pablo.- Experienced composer and creator of the excellent soundtrack!Alberto Leal.- He will be the one creating the ships for the final version! and already created this one: Henry Wonderwall.- Lead programmer and creator of the game.http://www.kenney.nl provided CC0 graphics used for the prototype.We all thank you for your support!! If you like our game please contribute and pick one of our rewards!Important note:All reward content is guaranteed for PC, but we will do everything posible to give a vita version for the ones that want that instead, however we can't promise you a vita version. (it's not up to us just yet)

story:
The Story of Paranoid

Paranoid started in 2010 literally with a dream. In the beginning of 2011 this dream was acted, recorded, composed, drawn and coded by a tiny, tiny team of passionate people. It became an audio-and-GPS-augmented-mobile game, where you run for your life. It was published in the Spring of 2011.


Now we need You.


Our Situation

We are now struggling with competition and sales. And we are now forced to either we make this big or then to wrap up the loose ends and leave it for now. We need you to be able to fight our competition, because we STILL have better ideas and better path to develop this type of game and we know how to keep things simple and with Your help we can make them into reality.


Paranoid 2.0

We need money for production, it's as simple as that. We have the skills to make these things happen. To top that: we are creative.


We are going to use the money to go on-line, to introduce 3D in the gameplay, more themes and a couple of surprises for our competition, so in short your money will be spent well. That's about 2/3 of the funding we ask for. The other 1/3 will go to Android development.


Considering what we are about to do (and what we have done already), these numbers are 'peanuts' in the world of gaming. Our advantage is that we happen to have a very devoted and talented people working in this project.


What you will be giving us is time to work on this. Shiing has a lot of work lined up for it, so we're trying to figure out would the world like Paranoid 2.0 to be made or should we concentrate on the other stuff.


What Else?

If everything goes better than expected, we'll launch an ad campaign to boost the sales once the product is finished and start working this game out for other platforms than iOS and Android. If it goes worse than expected, we will use the money raised to make Paranoid 1.1 and leave it at that.

Paranoid Right Now

Right now, you can go and download the free version of Paranoid 1.0 (sponsored by a Finnish soft-drink): 
http://itunes.apple.com/app/paranoid-dead-escap...

or you can go ahead and buy the Paranoid 1.0: 
http://itunes.apple.com/fi/app/paranoid/id43536...

About Shiing

Shiing is a small, but award-winning Helsinki-based company. It makes apps and games with or without friends alike.

story:
Community Ad Fund Goals

Here is our mission and purpose for this funding:

  • Advertise on 6-10+ Gaming Websites
  • 90+ days of consecutive "live" advertising
  • 3+ Million Impressions
  • Increased Global Marketing Reach
  • Contract professional grade graphic design (banners etc)
Simply put, this will place WWII Online: Battleground Europe in front of hundreds of thousands of players who currently do not know about our game.

The Impact

By accomplishing this funding, we see a dramatic growth of players entering the game and subscribing to the game. All of these new areas hit increase a large outcome of needed gamers.

  • Hundreds (if not thousands) of new accounts
  • More populated battles
  • Increased opportunity for long-term advertising funds

Spread the word

Let your squad mates and fellow gamers know about this funding project, it will do wonders for the game.

PayPal Contributors

When you go through the process of contributing via PayPal, "Knight Airsoft LLC" will be the donation area you see. This is XOOM's business account, and is all going to the actual funding process of this initiative.

Surplus Funds (Beyond the Goal)

Any and all left over funds will go towards increasing our reach by days, impressions and conversions.

story:
Why do we need BasedGamer.com?

The gamer voice has become more prominent than ever before. Through social media, game forums, and aggregator websites, gamers have taken it upon themselves to demand a more sincere platform for games journalism.

BasedGamer will be devoted to a community driven by gamers. Similar to the popular website, “RottenTomatoes.com,” BasedGamer will feature a genuine aggregation of game reviews and other great features.

BasedGamer’s reviews will include written and YouTube reviews. Unlike other game-review aggregators, BasedGamer will compile and score game reviews based on four categories: Visuals, Storyline, Gameplay, and Entertainment. The categories will be rated via a simple, four-point scale: Excellent, Good, Okay, and Very Bad. This simple grading system will define scores with much more clarity.

BasedGamer will also include transparency, a platform for the gaming community, and monitor trolls and astroturfers.


Who is behind this?

Hello! This is Jennie Bharaj. I am a humble gamer who is passionate about video games. I have made it my goal to highlight the positives of video games and the games industry. I created BasedGamer.com to further my objective - for myself and for my fellow gamers.

I have secured a team of dedicated people who will be working closely with me to create this website. They are very passionate about the cause as well and are willing to put in sweat, determination, and hard work to bring this idea to life.

The following is the current team breakdown.



Note: Due to the current sensitivity regarding corruption in games journalism, these team members will remain anonymous for the protection of their wellbeing and their careers.


BasedGamer.com - From Concept to Final Product

This project is dependent on your support!

Show us your interest by signing up on the website and spreading the word! You can sign up at http://www.BasedGamer.com.

Raising financial support is very important. My team and I are expecting 650 hours of work to build the website. This includes design, programming, and testing. Here is a percentage breakdown of cost:

43% Development – Back and front end development including testing, tuning, and bug fixing

12% Functional Analysis and Prototyping – Includes planning, strategy, and project requirements

15% UX/UI – Includes design and development of all user experience and user interface assets

24% Legal – Includes all legal requirements and documents

6% Architecture – Setup and design

We are expecting to work with a team of five: two front-end designers, one back-end programmer, one front-end programmer, and one testing lead.


Risks

As of now, a low number of sign-ups is a definite risk. Moreover, there has been a lot of recent incidents of malicious attacks targeting individuals and websites in the games industry. We are concerned about similar attacks towards BasedGamer.


Perks

BasedGamer's perks are very humble. They range from thank-you letters to being featured on the website.

I kindly ask those who would like to provide input in the creation of BasedGamer to consider donating to the larger perk packages such as "Be The First!" or "The Works!" Our top perks all include involvement with the creation of BasedGamer.


Outline & Details

Check out the outline and details for BasedGamer. Click here to see it.


Infographic


Contact

For more information or other inquires, please contact us at info@basedgamer.com. For press and media materials, please visit our media kit.

Note: I have put in $2000 into the Indiegogo campaign as well! This is a community-driven project, and it's important that I show everyone how committed I am with BasedGamer.

story:
This draw and discard card game is simple to learn but challenging to master. The objective is to build a complete creature that's worth the most points. You get to enhance your creature with crazy accessories and special powers for bonus points,  play negative points on other players and even steal their creature pieces! The player with the most points wins! This game is suitable for ages 8 and up and helps teach math skills too! It's unique, silly, visually fun, and different each time you play so it keeps your interest. Don't be fooled by the simplicity of game-play. It takes strategy and planning to win.

The objective of the game is to get the most points. You can do this in a variety of ways. Build the most creatures, have the most bonuses, the best abilities or a combination of all.

Every turn starts with drawing a card and ends with a discard. Each turn you can play one card to your score pile. Unless you have a special card! More about that below.

The game deck is divided into categories. The 3 main categories are Head, Body and Feet. These are the basic components of any creature. To score any points you must complete a creature with head, body and feet. This makes a scoring set.

Once you have a complete set you can start customizing your creature. The other categories are bonus, ability and special. Bonus cards are used to add bonus points for each body part. Some of these are claws, webbed feet and googly eyes! Ability cards are rare abilities each creature can obtain. Such as fire breathing! But watch out... someone may have a water ability to put out your fire! Special cards can be played on other people or to the deck and have powers like stealing a creature part, drawing extra cards, or shuffling the deck. When a player has used all the cards in their hands the game ends. The player with the highest score wins!

Let's take a look at a sample score:


It's for everyone! The game can be played with 2-6 players ages 8 and up. Children can play it alone but it's fun for us big children too. The game helps teach math skills with addition, subtraction and multiplication by 2. The game deck is also categorized in ways that help teach pattern recognition and like object grouping. Each head, body and feet card has it's own color and icon. Any card you can play on a head, body or feet card shares the same color and icon making it easier for younger children to play and understand.

The game concept and deck with sample graphics is complete, tested and fun! Basic package design is complete. What I need is refined graphics for the bonus, ability and special cards. These refined graphics will tie into the package design as well. I have some local and regional sales outlets but need complete printed decks to present. The main bulk of funding needed is to cover artwork, printing and marketing costs. I know the game works well and has expansion possibilities for continued growth. My goal is to get this game into the hands of local stores, regional and national chains. Every donation will go to getting as close to that goal as possible. The $3,800.00 goal will cover the costs of revised artwork, printing costs and marketing for enough decks to hit my regional goals. If I get less then I'll stay local and still get this in front of as many people as I can. If I get more I'll get it in front of national chains. If I end up going way over my goal then anything remaining will go towards making the first themed expansion deck.

One of the hats I've worn has been in sales and marketing. I've been part of a clothing company that grew from selling t-shirts in the parking lots of concerts to going wholesale in major resort destinations in Hawaii, California, Colorado and Arizona. I know how to pound the pavement, make calls that lead to appointments and be diligent to get my product in front of the right people. I bring that same tenacity to my first self published game.



If you can't make a donation but like the idea:

Spread the word!

Please feel free to share this with those you know and love! This game couldn't have been made without the help of my friends and family and I value their input and support greatly!


Perks:

Featured Perk: $38.00

Game deck (96 cards), sleeve and instructions, plus a Creature Craze T-shirt.

Thanks you!: $10.00

All the crazy creatures Thanks You! You'll receive a "Thanks You" postcard as well as my gratitude for supporting Creature Craze! in any way you can.

Game Deck: $20.00

Be one of the first people to own a Creature Craze! deck. You're contribution gets you the first printing of a complete game deck (96 cards), sleeve and instructions.

Creature Craze! T-shirt: $20.00

Creature Craze! T-shirt. Available in Adult and Kid sizes. Short sleeve heavyweight cotton.

Custom Creature T-shirt: $35.00

Choose your creature, saying and shirt color to make it completely your own! Choose any one of the 6 creatures or a combination of many! Should any of the creatures change before final printing the new creature designs will be posted here. You can choose the new creature design or keep the "vintage" creature. It will be up to you! Available in Adult and Kid sizes and a variety of colors. Short sleeve heavyweight 6 oz. cotton.


Special Ability Game Card design and game deck: $100.00

Create your own Ability card that I will incorporate into the deck. These are the cards that add points to each monster. Pretty much the best cards in the game! This is a chance to be part of the creation of the final deck. Not only will you choose an ability you can help decide what the graphics look like. Get creative with it. Lightning, Earthquake stomp, Extreme napper... you decide! As people support this perk I will post the new abilities. I expect some interesting counter abilities! You will also receive a game deck.

Special Ability Counter Card design and game deck: $100.00

Just like the above perk except you create the card that negates the special ability others have chosen. Or create your own counter ability first! You will also receive a game deck.


Call them by name: $250.00

You get to name a creature. The name you choose will be printed along with the creature in every deck and incorporated into the instructions. Forever the name you choose will be a part of the game. Do a good job! It will be your own! Just remember it's got to be kid friendly! You will also receive a custom creature t-shirt with your newly named monster as well as a game deck!

story:
Welcome to Lairs & Encounters!

Lairs & Encounters is the ultimate supplement for fantasy RPG sandbox campaigns. Designed for use with the Adventurer Conqueror King System™ (ACKS™), it is readily compatible with other fantasy role-playing games built on the same core rules. In Lairs & Encounters you will find:

  • More than 155 ready-to-play monstrous lairs - that's at least one lair listing for every possible monster lair mentioned in the Adventurer Conqueror King System. The lair listings are designed to be used both as dynamic points of interest that can be discovered while wandering through the wilderness and as obstacles to a would-be ruler’s attempt to secure land for a domain. 
  • 25 lair maps for use in running wilderness encounters and 8 treasure maps for use as player hand-outs.
  • New subsystems for sandbox play, including rules for populating 6-mile hexes with lairs based on the terrain and extent of settlements in the region, and rules for searching for lairs in the wilderness factoring in terrain density, aerial reconnaissance, splitting up to cover more ground (never split the party!), and more.
  • Additional mechanics for monsters, including ability scores for monsters, proficiencies for monsters, and young monsters.
  • A complete system for taming and training monsters, with details on the lifespan, roles, tricks, trained and untrained value, supply cost, training period, and the trainability modifier of every monster in the game.  
  • A complete system for creating your own unique monsters. In the ACKS Player's Companion we gave you mechanics to create balanced new character classes and new spells; now we bring our same rigorous attention to balance and customization to monsters.

What is a Lair Listing?

A lair listing is a description of the type and number of monsters encountered in a wilderness lair, along with a physical description of the lair and, if necessary, a map of the environs. When a wilderness encounter throw results in an encounter with a monster in its lair, the Judge runs the encounter using the lair listing for that monster. 

Depending on the type of monster, lair listings can range from a short but flavorful paragraph of text to a multi-paragraph mini-dungeon with a map. Below we have presented two examples of lair listings drawn from Lairs & Encounters. The Brigand lair is extensive and complex while the Skeleton lair is simple though still interesting.

Thank You!

Thanks for checking out Lairs & Encounters! Let us know if you have any questions or feedback in the Comments section. We appreciate your interest in our supplement, and hope you'll become a backer.
story_txt:

Designed for use with the Adventurer Conqueror King System™ (ACKS™), it is readily compatible with other fantasy role-playing games built on the same core rules. In Lairs & Encounters you will find:
More than 155 ready-to-play monstrous lairs - that's at least one lair listing for every possible monster lair mentioned in the Adventurer Conqueror King System. The lair listings are designed to be used both as dynamic points of interest that can be discovered while wandering through the wilderness and as obstacles to a would-be ruler’s attempt to secure land for a domain.

story:
One of the most important element of our game is big open world, in which you will find a lot of secrets, puzzles and dangerous enemies. Our world is made by hand and not computer generated. It was very important to us to create world that is constructed out of unique places that you can explore.

Even though big part of the world is nature, every place will feel unique and different so after playing few hours of game you will feel comfortable withouth using map of the world. There are 7 theme bioms: green spring, autumn, snowy, desert, savanna, jungle and drought island.










Probably your main goal in The Warhorn will be creating your own village. You can do it almost anywhere in the world by placing totem and setting up name for your village.
 
 

Then you will be able to invite your friends, so development of your village will be easier and more fun.The Warhorn offers two types of building systems:
First one is for creating your own house - you can build using ready elements like foundations, pillars, walls, doors and etc.

You can build what you want and how you want. In your house you can keep your most valuable items you have.



Second way to develop your village is by placing functional buildings like sawmill, blacksmith, armorer, mill or alchemist etc.

These predefined buildings are very usefull for creating tools, armors and weapons. 

Your future achievements and safety will depend on these buildings. The most important functional building is townhall, which you have to build in first place because it will allow you to fully manage your village.

 In townhall you will be able to check level of your village, list of all members and  theirs role, list of buildings and NPCs that you own. Level of your village will depend on two things: resources that you will bring to village and buildings you will create. When your village level is high enough you will get information that new era has come, which means that you can now build better buildings and upgrade the ones you already own. This is very important part of the game because new elements will be much stronger and you will feel much safer.



As owner of the village you will be able to create NPCs that will help you in the game. You can craft 3 types of NPC's:
- Villager who can extract resources and bring them to village.
- Warrior who will help you fight with every creature and player in the world. He will also take care of helpless villager who is exposed to other players when he is gathering resources by himself.
- Gate guard who will guard entrance to you village.

Crutial place when you will start the game will be main village which is mutual for every player.

 When you will need any armor or weapons you can visit any of functional buildings that are available in main city and buy what you want.

That place is a safe zone where players can not fight and it is place where you can meet new friends. There is also an arena where you can fight for money and honor.


This approach allows you to have fun all the time without spending too much time on looking for resources because you can just buy it.

Multiplayer in our game will operate on dedicated servers, but there will be also possibility to create you own game and invite your friends to join you. So if you want to play alone or with couple of friends it will be possible.

When your village will be developed enough you will gain access to build war machines like catapult, ballista or battering ram so you can attack other villages and defend your own one.



All over the world there will be a lot of mysteriuos places that will be a challenge for everyone. Often before you will get acces to that place you will have to resolve a puzzle. Many entrances will be hidden or locked.

Just remember to have your eyes open. Look for buttons, mechanisms, levers and everything else that you can interractc with.

Frequenty you will notice different symbols that will help you find an answer. Almost everything what you will encounter in game will be important.

When you finally find the end of dungeon you have to face big beast. You will die or win the fight. There will be no return.

Kill, cook, eat, drink and survive.

We are three students of computer science in Łódź. We always loved video games and especially that new kind of open world sandboxes that are available on steam. We have noticed that there is unused potential in that type of games - we wanted to add puzzle elements and large ammount of unique places that you can explore.     Łukasz Adamski - 22 years old, 3d artist, 2nd programmer

    Jakub Choróbski - 21 years old, main programmer

   Adam Olesiński - 22 years old, 2d and 3d artist

We are currently working on our world and because it is big we need better computers. Right now few hours of every day of our work is consumed by loading time and computer lags. Thats why we need your support. We also want to set up official dedicated servers for our game when the game will come out and it is fairly big cost. We spend all the time we have to make that game for other players and most important thing for us is your satisfaction. If you think that this project is worth few dollars help us!

If you have any questions please feel free to email us at:

info@thewarhorn.com

You can also follow us on our social media sites:

story:
Français     (English lower page)

Sylvain Bertrand a commencé à collectionner et à jouer à l’airsoft en 1993. Entre les premières maquettes à monter soi-même, les gbb et Aeg.Il a eu la chance de voir l’évolution du monde de l’airsoft. Très vite, il a commencé à démonter, bricoler et réparer ses répliques. Pour lui l’airsoft est une passion, mais le partage au sein de ce jeu est le plus important. Perfectionniste et rêveur, il décide en 2008 de réaliser un rêve que beaucoup partage, fabriquer le AA-12 en airsoft.

Il fit connaissance en 2011 de Stéphane Jacquemin, sculpteur modeleur qui en 25 ans d’expérience dans le monde du cinéma et la reproduction publicitaire a su s’imposer une discipline de fer dans ses réalisations.

La rencontre avec Sylvain l’a motivé car le projet de faire quelque chose en partant de rien et que personne n’avait jamais fait a été un véritable défie pour lui. Ils décident ensemble de monter Airsoft Absolution pour lancer ce projet.Développer et construire le prototype du AA- 12 en AEG entièrement financé par leurs propres économies n’a pas été simple et de tout repos.

Ils ont rencontré d’énormes difficultés pour se procurer des Gearbox en quantité pour assurer la pérennité du projet.Ils ont donc décidé de poursuive l’aventure en réalisant la réplique mais en Gaz blow back avec un contrôle sur la fabrication de tous les éléments.Ils proposent un nouveau concept sur leur future Store. De pouvoir laisser choisir à l’Airsofteur, la customisation de leur modèle à leur commande et en fonction de leurs gouts et pouvoir d’achat. La réplique de leur AA-12 gbb sera fabriquée sur une base acier inoxydable avec un coque en polycarbonate armé. Il sera capable de tirer plusieurs billes de 6mm à la fois en full auto, d'une puissance de 300-350 fps maxi. Le modèle de base devrait sortir entre 400 et 500 euros déjà bien équipé, prêt à jouer, avec la possibilité de le customiser à la commande avec une multitude d’options.

Sylvain et Stéphane veulent que le AA-12 gbb soit très fiable et extrêmement robuste. Ils ont déjà fait beaucoup d’éléments et de tests à leur propre compte pour savoir si le projet était viable. Mais le développement coûte très cher et ils ont besoin de vous pour continuer cette aventure ! Comme l’airsoft est réglementé, et que sa vente en est interdite au mineur, ils proposeront des bons d'achat et réductions dans leur future Store et bien sûr, un compte rendu des évolutions du projet ainsi qu’un modèle en édition limité sera proposé aux personnes qui auront donner les plus grosses participations.

"Faisons quelque choses de différent et rêvons ensemble pour plus de fun !"


                                              First Teaser Aisoft Auto-12 AEG Prototype


                                                            English

Sylvain Bertrand began collecting and playing airsoft in 1993. Between the first models to fit yourself, the gbb and Aeg, he had the chance to see the world of airsoft changing. He soon began to dismantle, tinker and repair his aftershocks For him, airsoft is a passion but the most important is sharing. Perfectionist and dreamer, in 2008, he decided to fulfill a dream that many people share : produce the AA-12 airsoft.

In 2011, he met Stephane Jacquemin, sculptor modeler whom in 25 years of experience in the cinéma and advertising industries has imposed an iron discipline in his achievements.

Meeting Sylvain has motivated him to make something out from nothing and create a project that no one had ever done before. To launch this project, they decide to start Airsoft Absolution. Develop and build a prototype of AA- 12 AEG fully funded by their own savings was not simple and easy.

They encountered huge difficulties in procuring Gearbox quantities to ensure the sustainability of the project. They decided to continue the adventure by making the replica in gas blow back with & strict control over the manufacture of all elements. They propose a new concept on their future Store. You will be able to customize your own model according to your likes and your purchasing power. The replica of their AA-12 gbb will be manufactured on a stainless steel base with reinforced polycarbonate Hull.

The airsoft-player will be able to shoot more 6mm bbs in full auto, with a max capacity of 300-350 fps. The basic model will cost around 400 and 500 euros, already well equipped, ready to play, with the possibility to customize it with a multitude of options.

Sylvain and Stephane want the AA-12 gbb very reliable and extremely robust. They already have done a lot of items and tests on their own account to check if the project was viable. But the development is very expensive and they need your help to continue this adventure! As airsoft is regulated in some countries, and sales prohibited to minors, they will offer vouchers and discounts in their future Store.An report of the evolution of the project and a limited edition model will be offered to people who will make the biggest donations.

"Let's do things differently and dream together for more fun!"

story:
Table of Contents

  • About the Game
  • Perk Packages
  • Get on the Cards!
  • Stretch Goals
  • About Us
  • Risks
  • Endorsements

** A note to Potential and Current backers**
We forgot to specify in each perk for Card likeness, that you should email the campaign or info@surplusofpopes.com with your preferred card choice. Please give top two, as we will try to keep the list updated but may not have it immediately refreshed and it is first-come-first-served. HERE IS THE LINK for the current cards.


About the Game

SURPLUS OF POPES is a new card game where every player is a Pope, but are you the coolest Pope? The goal of the game is to create the best life story by playing various cards that can enhance your Pride or withhold your Shame.

The game is played with each player having four cards in their hand and each turn you draw a card and then play a card. Then you just follow the rules written on the cards themselves. The winner is decided by whoever has the highest PRIDE score. 

The cards are:

PRIDE!
Something great you did. Be sure to read the cards closely because a few of them have special bonus acts you can do to earn extra points. For example, making beverages for everyone, or creating a cool new dance! 

SHAME!
Something you would not want to admit you did.

FLIP!
Once you play this card you flip a coin and you risk getting either PRIDE or SHAME points from it.

But what's a game without a bit of healthy competition? 

That's where EVENT cards come in! They can steal, copy, or remove cards, as well as either enhance or detract their Point value.


And what's this? THERE IS A SECOND GAME HIDDEN WITHIN THE GAME! It's called Mummy Want Banana 

If you get the special Mummy Want Banana card, you get to challenge another player to the game-hidden-within-the-game! It's a simple game where you draw cards from two piles. 2 Bananas beats 1, Mummy Cards beat both. Whoever has the most Bananas wins! Make sense? No? Good!

So there you have it! Everyone is a Pope! So Pope it up Pope-y!


(POPE BOAT MAYBE?)

Here are the versions of the Game and some perks you can get:

Along with getting a copy of the game, you can get yourself some fantastic bonuses along with it. You can get accessories for the game, or even be a part of the game forever by appearing on the cards or box!




FOR THOSE SEEKING TO HAVE THEIR LIKENESS APPEAR ON A CARD, HERE ARE THE AVAILABLE CARDS:



CLICK HERE FOR A HIGH RES PICTURE OF AVAILABLE CARDS


STRETCH GOALS

If we pass our goal we will offer added stretch-goal bonuses to EVERYONE who buys the game. 
At the $6000 marker we will add 2 extra ten sided die to each set to be used as Points counters. 
At the $7000 marker we will change the box into this fancy-shmancy magnetically sealed version!
At $100000000 we will murder your enemies! (shipping and handling not included)



BIO & APPEARANCES>

The game came from the think-muscles of two comic artists based in Winnipeg, Manitoba; Will O'Donnell and Bart Rucinski. Originally starting as hobbyists who published comics in University newspapers, they became high-functioning hobbyists by appearing at numerous comic conventions such as Central Canada Comic Con, Toronto  Fanexpo, Calgary Expo and Jimcon while creating the  webcomics: One Shot Left, Downe and Owte and Pseudo Snipe Hunt. 


Bart R has done graphic design and advertising work for numerous companies and was a part of the creative team who developed the Warhammer video game The Horus Heresy: Drop Assault. Bart is not confined to visual arts. He also has been a lifelong member of the internationally renowned dance group S.P.K. Iskry!


William has spent most of his days writing and performing comedy for stage and screen. He has appeared in numerous films such as Capote, Mr. Hockey: The Gordie Howe Story, and the Astron-6 cult classics The Editor, Manborg and Father's  Day. He has also loaned his voice talents to televisions shows such as Lanfeust Quest and Supa Strikas and the popular online fan series Transformers: Generation. 


RISKS & CHALLENGES

It helps to be transparent and here we go....

This game has already been made. That is, there are no moulds to make, no more developments to...develop. The game is ready! And it is going to be printed, regardless of what happens in this campaign. 

Supporting us puts the game in your hands and puts us closer to expanding upon it! We have already worked on numerous potential expansions that have already caught the attention of play-testers. 


ENDORSEMENTS

"Since the dawn of time boys and girls could only dream about becoming the Pope, but now Surplus of Popes puts YOU in the pulpit! Ecclesiastical fun for everyone!"

- Bill Forsteris an author and artist with IDW Publishing. Along with Jim Sorenson, he restored and did layouts of character designs in the Ark books.


"The most entertaining, easy to learn game that deals with the pressing issue of how to deal with a booming pope population"

-Dylan Fries (Co-Director of the feature-length Documentary Men with Beards and Owner of Electric Monk Media).

"Is this like Magic cards? That game is too complicated. I'm confused, why are there so many popes all of a sudden? Well, Any game endorsed by Pope Francis gets my goddamn seal of approval! Fun for the whole family!"

-Steve Kostanski (Writer/ Director of the cult favourite films Manborg, Bio Cop and Father's Day. Plus the upcoming horror feature THE VOID)

"I absolutely love the absurdity of the cards. I'm very much looking forward to getting my copy of the game."

-David Annandale (Black Library author of such Warhammer books as The Damnation of Pythos.)                            


 "I've never played this game, but you can never have enough Popes!"

-Aisha Alfa (Comedian/Actress from MTV's Degrassi: The Next Generation, Royal Canadian Air Farce and MUCH's Video on Trial.)

Media:
http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/our-communitie...

http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/video?clipId=811152&...

SURPLUS OF POPES is a new card game where every player is a Pope, but are you the coolest Pope? The
goal of the game is to create the best life story by playing various
cards that can enhance your Pride or withhold your Shame.



The game is played with each player having four cards in their hand and each turn you draw a card and then play a card. Then you just follow the rules written on the cards themselves. The
winner is decided by whoever has the highest PRIDE score. 
The cards
are: 

PRIDE! Something great you did. Be sure to read the cards closely because a few of them have special bonus acts you can do to earn extra points. For example, making beverages for everyone, or creating a cool new dance! 
SHAME!Something you would not
want to admit you did.
FLIP! Once you play this card you flip a
coin and you risk getting either PRIDE or SHAME points from it.
But what's a
game without a bit of healthy competition? 
That's where EVENT cards
come in! They can steal, copy, or remove cards, as well as either
enhance or detract their Point value.
And what's this? THERE IS A SECOND GAME HIDDEN WITHIN THE GAME! It's called Mummy Want Banana 
If you get the special Mummy Want Banana card, you get to challenge another player to the game-hidden-within-the-game! It's a simple game where you draw cards from two piles. 2 Bananas beats 1, Mummy Cards beat both. Whoever has the most Bananas wins! Make sense? No? Good!
So
there you have it! Everyone is a Pope! So Pope it up Pope-y!


(POPE BOAT MAYBE?) 


Here are the versions of the Game and some perks you can get:


Along with getting a copy of the game, you can get yourself some fantastic bonuses along with it. You can get accessories for the game, or even be a part of the game forever by appearing on the cards or box!






















FOR THOSE SEEKING TO HAVE THEIR LIKENESS APPEAR ON A CARD, HERE ARE THE AVAILABLE CARDS:












CLICK HERE FOR A HIGH RES PICTURE OF AVAILABLE CARDS





STRETCH GOALS
If we pass our goal we will offer added stretch-goal bonuses to EVERYONE who buys the game. At the $6000 marker we will add 2 extra ten sided die to each set to be used as Points counters. At the $7000 marker we will change the box into this fancy-shmancy magnetically sealed version!At $100000000 we will murder your enemies! (shipping and handling not included)
  





BIO & APPEARANCES>




The
game came from the think-muscles of two comic artists based in
Winnipeg, Manitoba; Will O'Donnell and Bart Rucinski. Originally starting as hobbyists who published comics in University newspapers, they became high-functioning hobbyists by appearing at numerous comic conventions such as Central Canada Comic Con, Toronto  Fanexpo, Calgary Expo and Jimcon while creating the  webcomics: One Shot Left, Downe and Owte and Pseudo Snipe Hunt. 
Bart R has done graphic design and advertising work for numerous companies and was a part of the creative team who developed the Warhammer video game The Horus Heresy: Drop Assault. Bart is not confined to visual arts. He also has been a lifelong member of the internationally renowned dance group S.P.K. Iskry!
William has spent most of his days writing and performing comedy for stage and screen. He has appeared in numerous films such as Capote, Mr. Hockey: The Gordie Howe Story, and the Astron-6 cult classics The Editor, Manborg and Father's  Day. He has also loaned his voice talents to televisions shows such as Lanfeust Quest and Supa Strikas and the popular online fan series Transformers: Generation. 
   
RISKS & CHALLENGES
It helps to be transparent and here we go.... This game has already been made. That is, there are no moulds to make, no more developments to...develop. The game is ready! And it is going to be printed, regardless of what happens in this campaign. Supporting us puts the game in your hands and puts us closer to expanding upon it! We have already worked on numerous potential expansions that have already caught the attention of play-testers. 

   
ENDORSEMENTS

"Since the dawn of time boys and girls could only dream about becoming the Pope, but now Surplus of Popes puts YOU in the pulpit! Ecclesiastical fun for everyone!"

- Bill Forsteris an author and artist with IDW Publishing. Along with Jim Sorenson, he restored and did layouts of character designs in the Ark books.



"The most entertaining, easy to learn game that deals with the pressing issue of how to deal with a booming pope population"

-Dylan Fries (Co-Director of the feature-length Documentary Men with Beards and Owner of Electric Monk Media).



"Is this like Magic cards? That game is too complicated. I'm confused, why are there so many popes all of a sudden? Well, Any game endorsed by Pope Francis gets my goddamn seal of approval! Fun for the whole family!"

-Steve Kostanski (Writer/ Director of the cult favourite films Manborg, Bio Cop and Father's Day. Plus the upcoming horror feature THE VOID)
"I absolutely love the absurdity of the cards. I'm very much looking forward to getting my copy of the game."
                            
-David Annandale (Black Library author of such Warhammer books as The Damnation of Pythos.)                            
 "I've never played this game, but you can never have enough Popes!"
-Aisha Alfa (Comedian/Actress from MTV's Degrassi: The Next Generation, Royal Canadian Air Farce and MUCH's Video on Trial.)Media:http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/our-communitie...http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/video?clipId=811152&...

story:
UPDATE: FAQ added at the end of the campaign. A statement, addressing questions and concerns about the fundraiser can be found here: http://www.methodwow.com/board/showthread.php?15445-Method-Fundraiser-Statement-FAQ&p=116843#post116843

Scott 'Sco' McMillan founded the World of Warcraft guild Method in summer 2005. Since then the guild has developed into a community, forming friendships and even relationships over the past 9 years.  Amongt them is a couple, now married with a kid, who found each other by being members of Method. Besides raiding in WoW and playing other games together, some of us also meet at events like DreamHack, Gamescom and Blizzcon.

Method is a gaming community that we want to preserve and expand. We also want  to share our experience with other gamers. This fundraiser campaign, if succesful, will help us immensely to achive these goals.

We promise that, if reached, goals will be fulfilled.

A complete re-work of the current Method website.
  • Re-design of the frontpage, forum and sub-pages
  • Player page including links to UI's, guides, social media, coaching and more
  • A sub-page dedicated for guides
  • Media page for our videos, screenshots, interviews and more
  • Re-worked livestream page
  • Integrated Method shop
  • Sponsor page

    Warlords of Draenor guides for every class and spec in the game. The guides will be written by Method members and a few other top raiders.

    Our members will share their knowledge about every boss in the upcoming Highmaul and Foundry raid dungeons. The guides will be in a written format.

    We are planning to sign more professional Hearthstone players in order to make Method one of the leading teams in the scene. Money will be used exclusively to cover flight, hotel and ground transportation costs of our players to Hearthstone competitions.

    Method's Hearthstone players will share their strategies with the community. After tournaments they are going to post decks used in addition to the strategy behind the decks. Also planned are guides on: how to climb the ladder in ranked and how to beat arena.

    Our next mission is to compete in Heroes of the Storm with a team of top players. If this goal is reached, Method will sign 5 of the most promising players in the scene who are able to compete with the best in the world. Money will be used exclusively to cover flight, hotel and ground transportation costs of our players to Heroes of the Storm competitions.

    Guides for every hero in the game, written by top players from the Heroes of the Storm scene and/or other MOBAs.

    Method T-Shirt

    Method Hoodie

    Jersey Male Version

    Back

    Jersey Female Version

    Back


    Thanks to all supporters and a special thank you to our loyal fans and the World of Warcraft community. We hope to see many of you next month at Blizzcon.


    Why do you need money at all?

    Method is an old WoW guild, but as an organization we are making baby steps. As many other organizations in their early years it is a struggle for us to be financially self-sufficient. So we are asking for your help to get things moving.

    Don't you get money from sponsorships like other teams?

    We have received small amounts of financial support from sponsors. However it has been no where near enough to finance a full Hearthstone or Heroes of the Storm roster for a longer time though. Besides, most bigger esport teams have wealthy investors behind them who provide funds in addition to sponsorships. Method does not have that unfortunately.

    Why do you need money to write WoW/HS/HotS guides?

    Most people who ask this would be surprised about how many WoW guides on the internet are paid content. It is painful to ask our members and players from other top guilds to write in-depth guides for no pay while other sites are paying for the same work. In general it is our believe that game guides are work that deserves pay, hopefully others see it the same way.

    If other websites already write guides, why do we need yours?

    In regards to boss guides we would definitely be able to write mythic guides much earlier than anyone else. Our class guides are written only by members of Method and other top raid guilds. Not saying that makes our class guides better, but it certainly makes them different.

    How do you come up with the amount of money needed for each goal, like 3000€  for class guides or 4000€ for new Hearthstone members?

    First you have to keep in mind that Indiegogo, like all crowdfund websites, and PayPal take fees for their services. On top of that there are the costs for perks. In the end somewhere between 70-75% of the funded amount will be available to achieve our set goals. The 3000€ (2100€+ after costs) for class guides for instance were calculated by taking the total amount of guides needed and multiplying that number with the average amount of money that other websites pay for class guides. Same goes for boss guides. 4000€ for new hearthstone members is an estimation of the money that will be needed to sign players for 6 to 12 months. As explained in the campaign, the money will be used to cover flight, hotel and other travel costs which occur when our players attend live event competitions.

story:
The entire iCTABLE Team would like to thank every customer that used the Indiegogo Pre-Order Service to be enlisted in the First Priority Group and Pre-Order their own iCTABLE! 

If you missed out on this opportunity to use the Indiegogo Pre-Order Service, you can purchase your iCTABLE now in our online store at https://store.ictable.com
story_txt: The entire iCTABLE Team would like to thank every customer that used the Indiegogo Pre-Order Service to be enlisted in the First Priority Group and Pre-Order their own iCTABLE! If you missed out on this opportunity to use the Indiegogo Pre-Order Service, you can purchase your iCTABLE now in our online store at https://store.ictable.com

story:
RPGnet is the top independent web site for tabletop roleplaying games. The heart of our site is one of the most talked-about forums in the industry — with 11,000 active members and almost 16 million posts. We also publish several reviews every week and a few columns. Finally, we maintain a constantly expanding catalog of roleplaying products that currently indexes 19,000 games and supplements, 2,000 magazines, and 36,000 articles.

All of this costs money, so in 2013 we decided to turn to crowdfunding to encourage readers to become members, to support the site. The drive was very successful, so we've turned into a yearly tradition.

In years past, we've thanked our members with proactive work that's helped to make the site a better place.That's included the reinstatement of the search function, the movement of the machines to a cloud platform, the fixing of bugs, and the improvement of security.

We'll be offering proactive work again this year, with a focus on improving the mobile experience. However, we also want to offer another sort of thanks. So this year we'll be offering some free PDFs in January and February to everyone who's a member, as long as we hit the core goal of this crowdfunding. So, join us now, and get some cool stuff for some cool RPGs. 

Following the end of this GoGo, you can sign up for a membership directly from RPGnet. Cool stuff will be available to everyone who signs up before the end of February.

We hope you'll become members to support a site that you use and enjoy. However, as long as we meet our core goal of $2,500 $1,500 (see below), we'll also be giving out cool PDFs to all of our members in January and February 2016 thanks to some help from some great RPGs companies!

If you're a Cthulhu fan, we have:

  • Extraordinary Renditions, the new fiction anthology eBook for Delta Green.
  • The Unspeakable Oath #23, with the "Cold Dead Hand" scenario.
  • The Unspeakable Oath #24, with haunted houses, shotguns, and more.

If you're a fantasy d100 fan instead, we have:

  • Legend Core Rulebook, Mongoose's take on a classic d100 system.
If you're a Pathfinder fan, we have:
  • Ultimate Relationships #1: The Lonely Lyrakien from Legendary Games.
  • Dungeonlands: Tomb of the Lich Queen from Savage Mojo.

Finally, if you're an indie fan, we have two books from Rogue Games:

  • Colonial Gothic 2nd Edition Rulebook.
  • Lovecraft for Colonial Gothic (yep, that's another Cthulhu book!).

Thanks to these product sponsors!

      

   


Though ads and affiliations pay some of our costs, we are picky about which ads and ad networks we use, so that we can maintain high-quality ads that are likely to be of interest and that won't distract our readers. We've opted out of high-value ads that include audio, that expand, or that are placed as interstitials between pages. We forbid dating ads, gambling ads, gold-farming ads, political ads, and certain other categories of advertising. 

As a result, we occasionally ask RPGnet readers to become members, in order to help support the community. We've done this on a somewhat ad hoc basis in the past, but now that crowdfunding has matured, we've turned to IndieGoGo for our annual RPGnet Membership Drive.

We hope that you'll join us, and help to support the RPGnet community.

Our goal for this IndieGoGo crowdfunding is simple: we want you to become an RPGnet member. Every single reward other than the $5 support level will grant you a membership at RPGnet. Most of them provide membership for the next year*, but we also offer Lifetime Memberships for Patrons and others who want to offer a higher level of support.

As a member, you'll receive a few benefits as thanks:

  • No Ads.You may choose to turn off some or all ads at RPGnet.
  • Forum Recognition.You'll receive a Member flag on your forum account.
  • Forum PMs.You get a larger 150-item PM Box and you can mail to users with full PM Boxes.
  • Forum Avatar.You can select a larger 60x60 avatar.
  • Early Columns Access.You can read columns before they're posted.
  • Early Review Access. You can read reviews before they're posted.
  • XP. Just for fun, we'll give you Experience Points every month, to reflect your contribution to the site.
  • Cool PDFs. Becoming a member is how you get access to the PDFs our sponsors are providing. From about 1/1/16 to 2/28/16, they'll be available as a free download directly from your membership panel. 

* We'll start all memberships shortly after this crowdfunding closes, once we get your forum account names. If you already have a yearly membership, we'll just add a year to your current end date. If you already have a lifetime membership, then we offer our thanks!

Your support ensures that we can continue to give RPGnet the same attention that we have in the past. However, we'd like to do more than that. If we raise higher levels of funds, we'll also work to make RPGnet more self-sufficient, so that its improvements don't depend upon Skotos staff not being busy with other tasks.

To ensure this, we'll guarantee increased staff time at many of our stretch goals. That will allow us to once more be proactive in 2016 and to put more time toward increasing the coolness of RPGnet. 


As we reach new funding levels, we'll be adding stretch goals, most of which relate to specific work that we'll undertake for the site in 2016. 

We gave our past sponsors the opportunity to renew their sponsorship buttons in advance of the GoGo and will be counting that toward the drive. As a result, we've lowered all our intended stretch goals by $1,000, thanks to the sponsorship renewal by DTRPG.

$1,500. Bag of PDFs. As soon as we hit our core goal of $2,500 $1,500 we'll start working on programming a simple interface to let you download our sponsor's PDFs. Files will be available in January and in February. Goal Met! PDFs are Coming!

$4,000. Boots of Striding. The biggest technical request for RPGnet seems to be better mobile support. If we hit our first stretch goal, we'll put up to a week of effort into making mobile work better. This will definitely involve releasing a standalone mobile app and ensuring that we have the newest and most up-to-date mobile skins for RPGnet. We may decide to upgrade from vBulletin 4 to vBulletin 5 as part of this process, to really make sure that everything is up-to-date. Goal Met!

$6,500. +1 Staff. Our chief programmer (Shannon) dedicates a full week of work to RPGnet, absent any emergencies with our various machines. Our top priorities for this (and all other work time that we stretch in) will be: improving the security of the site; aggressively fixing bugs; and adding cool features (possibly including blogs, but fundamentally focusing on what our Patrons, Talkative Members, and Lifetime Members want to see). Goal Met!

$9,000. Amulet of Contributions. Though our forums are the heart of our site, our reviews and columns are very important too. If we hit this stretch goal, we're going to create some infrastructure to better identify our top contributors of all sorts, allow them editing capability, and give them a place to talk. We'll also create the foundation for a line reviewers program. If you're a reviewer or columnist, you'll get better support; and if you're a reader, you'll get more cool stuff. Goal Met Through Bonus Stretch Goal! (See Below.)

$11,500. +2 Staff. We dedicate a second full week of programming & sysadmin work to RPGnet. This will probably occur late in 2016.

$14,000. Bag of Holding. A new membership benefit? This stretch goal slot is undecided, so feel free to offer suggestions.

$19,000. +3 Staff. We dedicate a third full week of programming & sysadmin work to RPGnet.

Bonus Stretch Goal: If we hit 104 backers, exceeding the size of our 2013 Membership Drive, we'll automatically bump up to the next stretch goal!

Thank you for your support!
